It is one of the friendliest places that I have ever worked with dedicated people making things work.
cons: In such a complex environment communication can always be a challenge. FedEx services has its moments when it could do better, but they constantly work toward making it better.

pros: Good hours/ benefits, flexible vacation time, employee discounts (airline, car purchase), workload is not difficult if you have any kind of good work ethic/ intelligence
cons: Promotions only available to IT-type people or if you kiss up to the manager, project work/ performance review system is a joke, same mundane job day in and day out, no working from home because certain people abused the privelege so now nobody can do it, incompetent management/ director, too many "lifers" that can't carry their own workload - but they are not reprimanded or fired, everyone gets the same 3% raise every year - regardless of performance, if you are a productive worker - you get rewarded with MORE WORK, and you get to do the lifer's work since they don't care to do it.

review: Great company to work for, growing in size and importance within FedEx.
pros: FedEx is one of the world's most respected brands, takes good care of its people, promotes from within.  FedEx Trade Networks, which is one of the "OpCos" that make up FedEx, is growing and trying to expand its business around the world.  Although relatively small, FTN is starting to gain some respect and notice as an important part of the overall company.
cons: FedEx is trying to improve profitability in a weak global economy which makes it difficult to try to grow and expand... you can't do both at once.

review: Good internship, led to job offer
pros:
Good pay for summer internship (3k a month after taxes)
Interaction with very senior executives
Positive work environment
Good work hours
Good culture
Company you can be proud to work for
Although my group had a hiring freeze, my manager worked the phones with other managers and directors and got my two interviews that both led to offers
cons:
Working in Memphis (and I'm from Memphis)
Overall intern program was unorganized, my manager did a good job though
Many interns had great reviews but hiring freezes meant their managers couldn't offer

review: Ok if you like to get burned out for little pay
pros: Interesting people thats about it.
cons: They work you to the bone, especially during peak which usually starts end of October through end of January. Basically your there from 6am to about 7-9pm. The contractors pay about 1.25-1.50 a stop. Depending on the day you could have between 70-180 stops(stops not packages, you could have 1 stop and have 10 packages to drop off). Its great if you can work under 6-7 hours, but anything over that your about 8-9$ an hour in the end. Totally not worth it. Contractors make a lot and the more routes they own the more bling. Not sure what they got exactly but when your living in a nice 4-5 bedroom house, own/lease 3-4 luxury cars BMW, Land Rover and Mercedes and own all the toys, you must be making over 250-350k a year if not more.  Its fine if you want no life, single and like to drive around. The trucks are hot in summer and cold in the winter (if you have newer truck you should be fine).

pros: Culture and Leadership.  Outstanding core values from top down. At any level, you are part of something bigger and your contributions are actively appreciated and valued.
cons: You may not be an overnight success.  With such a large population of employees, many of which are looking for regular promotional opportunities, you will have to be patient to progress you career.  There are many great stories of 20 and 30 plus year employees who have remained loyal, patient and have moved up the chain.

pros: Steady hours, decent health benefits.
cons: The pay situations are garbage.  I started with the company as a package handler. After getting a degree, I moved up to a Maintenance position. HR has told me that there is a "cap" as to how much you can increase pay. So I am forever below the pay rate of people who came from the outside. I've even trained new employees who started off making $4+ per hour MORE than me; just because they worked for a completely different company for 20 years (no experience in this field). FedEx can learn something from Unions. Cut & dry requirements. You can't do the job, you don't get the pay.

pros: Good benefits and great company
cons: No concern for disabilities

review: I feel lucky to be working for FedEx...
pros: The majority of employees who work at FedEx consider themselves fortunate to be part of a great company whose visionary leader founded an entirely new industry 35 years ago. Those who have worked here for awhile are extremely proud of its heritage. FedEx was (and still is) built upon a philosophy of People First.  I've personnaly seen our founder walk up to handlers and ask them about their job, what could be done better, etc. Our customers are our focus and delivering great service is our mission. If you have a passion to do all that you can to serve the customer, then we want you!
cons: Organizations are composed of people and people are not perfect.

review: It's hard work, but a good company to work for.
pros: I like the fact that it's basically a paid work out.  Moving packages is not for the faint of heart; it takes a certain amount of mental toughness and stamina in order to complete the work day in and day out, and it pays off in the end (literally with paychecks, and metaphorically with the loss of weight!).
cons: It can be really difficult some days.  It's physically demanding work, and if you're not having a good day coming into it, it's going to be all the much harder.

pros:
‚Ä¢Interesting work
‚Ä¢Relaxed environment 
‚Ä¢Rapport among coworkers
cons:
‚Ä¢Overstaffed
‚Ä¢Work is repetitive
‚Ä¢False 
‚Ä¢Poor communication and consistency from management 
‚Ä¢Less than adequate business resources and aid materials
‚Ä¢Noticeable gap between high performers and others yet no rewards for those that perform at a higher level or go above and beyond 
‚Ä¢Holidays were taken away, and, at times, overtime is mandated  
‚Ä¢Favoritism shown by management 
‚Ä¢Pay is not as high as similar positions in other companies
‚Ä¢No opportunities for advancement in company
‚Ä¢Special projects only given to select group of people
‚Ä¢Lack of true management on certain shifts

pros: Quite friendly environment for intern
cons: Low salary for interns but not accept negotiation

review: A good company, that has been better.
pros: Its a fun yet challenging job that provides adequate pay and benefits. There are legitimate avenues for advancement within the company and FedEx will help pay for your education in pursuit of them.
cons: Right now, due to leadership changes within the company the way FedEx relates to its employees is becoming increasingly based on productivity to the exclusion of all else. There is much uncertainty concerning what our jobs will become as they attempt to wring more out of less. The philosophy used to be, if FedEx took care of its employees they would take care of the customer. That has seemingly been abandoned as FedEx heels to its stockholders. Also, employees of other companies in the industry are more generously compensated for comparable work.

review: We all have a commitment to make every FedEx experience outstanding!  We only want people w/ great attitudes!
pros: Great company to work for , hands down!!  People are very proud to work for FedEx. THe company is constantly changing and growing.   I have every confidence that this company is extremely ethical and would not compromise it's integrity!    FedEx has always had a no lay-off philosophy!!   Each FedEx family member is responsible to keep this philosophy in tact.
cons: Just as with any company, there are always a few bad apples with bad attitudes!  If you don't want to work for this family, don't apply!  We only want people that will make a contribution and have a commitment to work hard so that we can feed the thousands of employees that work here.  We have that responsibility as employees!

review: Overall great company and benefits, but very painfully slow advancement."
pros:
- paid training
- lots of vacation time
- 5 sick days and 4 single days off the first year (and every year thereafter)
- 2 weeks vacation after 1 year/3 after 5/4 after 10/5 after 20
- good health insurance
- tuition assistance (about $2,500/yr)
cons:
- extremely unstable hours (They will work you all sorts of different shifts in the same week!)
- company constantly cutting benefits every year
- advancement takes forever (I drove tractor trailers for them.  At most carriers, you reach the top of scale in 1-3 years.  At FedEx Express, reaching the top of scale takes 15-20 years!"
- Oh yeah and their volume is WAY down right now.  Hours are being cut and it's likely that their no-layoff policy may go out the window.

pros: Lots of promotion opportunity if you're willing to relocate. Company will pay for it as well. Awesome 401k and pension plan, decent benefits and average salary. Lots of different people to network with and learn from. If you're open to advice and willing to work you'll love it.
cons: Lack of communication between departments and different levels. Not always focused on what's best for the customer. Numbers aren't always in your control. If you're looking to explore other career options (such as marketing, HR, pr, or finances) you'll have to live in Memphis. Only gives you options for sales or managing sales of you're anywhere else.

pros: easy work, time killing, great pay, great benefits package, great manager/employee relations, the way the career advancement is set up is great, managers cant just go in and pick who they want in the position, there is a computer program where you put in your application, and they haave to choose the best employee for that job, based on seniority, experience, and certifications, the longer you have the certification most important for the job your bidding on, the better your chances.
cons: WEATHER, WEATHER, WEATHER, there is really no way around it, rain, sleet, or snow, and there is no protection from it if your a driver, when its hot its HOT! when its cold its COLD!

pros: Good work out. Good hours. Good management. I personally enjoyed the hours, but the time frame they were in left a bit to be desired (I understand why it was so early). The crew was very stable; not much turn over. Whenever someone left it was usually because they were retiring.
cons: AM shift is kind of early. Seasonal work gets really heavy during the peak seasons (Valentine's Day, and all of November and December). I really enjoyed this job, but the overall pay was not enough, and it doesn't really correlate to any field that will make a good living wage unless you want to be a driver.

pros: There are some good attributes to working for FedEx when you are part time.  For example you will have 2 personals, 2 floating holidays, and 2 weeks vacation, 401k and health benefits.
cons: I have worked at several locations at my current 11 years, and the one things that all of them have in common is that the ramp agents are abused on a daily basis.  As a ramp agent your are responsible for running the sort and have almost 4 pages of job responsibilities for a whopping 15:85 an hour starting with a 30 cent raise every year.  You are responsible for keeping handlers in line, but you can't fire or discipline them but you are responsible for their actions and held 100% accountable.

pros: FedEx Express is a fast paced dynamic and exciting environment. There is an ongoing skill development program available, competitive compensation and MBO bonuses. The guaranteed Fair Treatment Process really works.
cons: Some days are very long, and upper management goals are not always grounded in reality but seem at times to be arrived at by playing with numbers on a calculator and not from a complete assessment of the challenges at hand. Failure to implement upper management goals as your own is considered leadership failure. Sometimes there are initiatives that one just doesn't believe in yet you have to carry out.. There is a continuing process to maximize productivity which can come across at times as uncaring and a bit anti-human...

review: It's not just a job, it's an adventure...
pros: The overall pay is excellent.  FEDEX provides a reasonable benefits package as well.  If you like to travel and fly to strange places at very odd hours, this is the job.
cons: Slow advancement due to the change in mandatory retirement age and difficult economy.  Although some of the flying can be quite interesting, much of it is to challenging locations in challenging conditions with arduous on duty periods.  There is no real opportunity for personal or professional growth much like any pilot position as it is strictly a seniority based system.

pros: Fast paced and a good work out and great medical plan.  FedEx was fun I meet a lot of nice people while working on the ramp I have always loved aircraft and working around them the X gave me all the time to near commercial AC I could handle.
cons: When there was no work you went home, and there were systems in place to prevent favoritism but it seemed that middle managers could always get around hiring practices. I applied for a position with in the company and was told I did not even get considered because I had a write up 6 months earlier. Oh well over all FedEx is not bad just stay away from the drama and it is a good part time job with good medical.

review: Not bad if you stay on your toes
pros: Great customers. We where always given the tools we needed to help the customer.  Fun place to work with a great mix of manufacturing, office and, retail selling.  over all a good employer.
cons: This is a complicated place to work.  There are a lot of sales goals that must be met or your job could be on the line.  These sales numbers are set without much concern for reality.  The prices are to low to support the margins they need to be profitable.

review: A fascinating experience that has taught me much and has made me grow not only as a person, but as an individual.
pros: Two of the best reasons to work at FedEx are teamwork and learning. As a team in the Memphis Hub, our collective goal is make sure our customers are satisfied. Working together allows us to achieve this. Learning allows us to better perform our duties( individual and other wise) efficiently. Knowing our customers needs and being able to both execute a plan and anticipate change means we will succeed at our duties. Teamwork and learning are two of the most important experiences at the Memphis World Hub.
cons: There are always things that some will be dissatisfied with....maintaining focus in these situations is key. You will also need a rain suit and extra layers as the temperature drops :)

review: Great Job for the young and uneducated
pros:
Courier jobs with Fed Express offer an amazing opportunity for young individuals who are not interested in pursuing a  college benefit and who have several years ahead to devote to building a career with this company. At first,  the pay is not so good and good luck with ever getting a day off, but with time and seniority the Company rewards begin to accumulate. 
Also, full benefit is available for part-time employees.
cons: It takes so long for the rewards to begin.

review: A solid company to get your start with
pros: High levels of activity in this job! You get cross trained on everything, the management is some of the best in the world, awesome benefits, and a great job to have as a student or as a almost retiree.
cons: It's a part time job. So 25 hours a week is the usual rate which tends to mean you end up with paychecks that come out to $250 after taxes. It can be tough to live on $1000 a month.

pros: My ideas are different than most...I didn‚Äôt mind the cold or heat. I didn‚Äôt mind the hours, the rest of my day was clear. The pay rate was good.
cons: I didn‚Äôt mind working with no heat or AC...dress accordingly. Having to be there at 3-4 a.m . The majority of the other employees are grumpy and rude. Management was hard to find. If you did something wrong, mgmt did t say anything, the drivers would. If you do something right or are proactive to a situation, don‚Äôt look for mgmt, ask your drivers. If you have to take a couple days off because you‚Äôre sick, etc...I guess they think that‚Äôll be your in for quitting,,,they don‚Äôt care

review: Other than keeping your Job, working hard doesn't benefit you here.
pros: Money was good for what you were doing. You get a raise for just staying for longer than a month. Job is very easy mentally, you just put boxes on a belt. Your work days never changed, so you always knew your schedule. Management were lenient when asking for days off.
cons: Managers were nice one day, but very rude and disrespectful the next. Managers in a sense are slave drivers, meaning no matter how ahead of schedule or how hard you work, they wanted you to work harder. Managers get angry if you start to slow down slightly after lifting 50 Ib boxes straight for two hours. Overall just a lot of disrespect and lack of constructive motivation from managers. Aside from management, working there in winter is bitter cold. The job is also very repetitive.

pros: For part time employees you have hours that you are assigned and are not required to work more than those hours. This makes it easy to maintain a full time job elsewhere. There are also minimum pay guarantees that prevent them from working you too few.
cons: Lots of people there that should not be but it is difficult to fire people due to corporate red tape. It is also hard for management to give quality new employees much work causing many quality employees to leave. After an initial year or two opportunities open up, but that can be a long time.

pros: Company pays okay good benefits and people mostly.
cons: The companies is not what it once was. It is no longer about people like they claim. Profit is now king. Watch out for those hungry for advancement. They are the quickest to throw people under the bus. Watch what you say and get ready for a ride on the PC train. They are more worried about getting sued than keeping quality people

pros: They provide marketing and business for your delivery business.
cons: Fedex continually increases the delivery load and other responsibilities they place upon the contractors in order to increase their profits, without any concern whatsoever for how it affects the contractors.  In fairness to local management, they probably have their hands tied as more and more volume is generated in their area without the terminal being awarded adequate PSA's to cover it, so they are forced to either run supplemental routes which mean additional payroll, rental, insurance, and fuel expenses, or their drivers end up working past the hours allowed by DOT.

pros: Work life balance is required, most managers are really nice and understanding. Benefits are good, standby flight benefits on all airlines.
cons: If you are unable or don‚Äôt want to move from Dallas, consider your career dead. There are virtually no positions to promote to, and too many politics and higher ups with power struggles. Unable to control your numbers, it seems like they draw names from a hat to see who gets a bonus, internal issues are unreal for a company this size. The director is a nightmare, she is anti-family, anti-team work, if she had it her way we would be glued to our desks all day. They also changed the bonus payout and they don‚Äôt care how that money affects our families.

pros: A company you can be proud of, gives superior service to customers, opportunities to grow a career and gain experience in variety and cutting edge tecnnology.  I was able to work part time at FedEx while in college, made a very good wage and received health care!  Other perks for working at FedEx allowed me to travel extensively on very little cost, all over the US, Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, and Hawaii.
cons: Very fast pace, always changing, very high expectations... to some, these are very much down sides.  For me, I thrive on these attributes!!!  With every company this size, you will end up running into some knuckle heads, but just keep on doing your best!

review: This company has been here for me
pros: Once you're in they bend over backwards for you; managers are encouraged to keep you happy and listen. The workload is balanced as much as possible. Benefits, tuition reimbursement, vacation time same for full and part-timers.
cons: You must be savvy about some politics in order to make this company work in your favor. Management gives the squeaky wheels all the grease and the hard-workers end up working harder; isn't that EVERY job though? I think so. Money is tight at fedex right now and I'm not sure we will survive if we don't innovate somehow.

pros:
They say we will never be laid off, so job security is good.  But they are also not hiring so...
Good benefits and they do seem to honestly care about you and how you feel and work.
Very good people too work with both in the lower levels and in Management.
cons: Rather tedious work, very little variation.  Also at time feeling of not really being able to help the customers as much as you would like. Which can make the job very stressful at times.  You know you will be taking the same kind of calls 8hrs a day 5days a week with very little variety or change in routine.

pros: Excellent promotion opportunities.  FedEx definately promotes from within.  They attempt to make work life balance a non issue in their culture.  The salary range at FedEx is very broad and movement within the ranges is easily accomplished.  You are rewarded for doing a good job in most areas of the company.  The benefits of this company are great.  The comprehensive medical and dental insurance are some of the best I have had in my career.  There are many, many discounts and fun things to do at the company...discounted shipping is a bonus.  The 401(k) is good and there is still a pension, so retirement savings are above average.
cons: There is a lot of work and sometimes it requires a lot of hours to accomplish that work.

review: The FedEx Family is hard to beat!
pros:
This is a great company with terrific benefits, great team members and a decent atmosphere. Volunteerism is highly encouraged.

Top management communicates very well to all of the employees on a regular basis.

Modernization is top priority and cutting edge technology is being implemented in many areas.

Lots of growth and acquisitions on a global scale.
cons:
This company does not provide  a very well defined career path and promotions seem to take forever in current positions.

Vacation for seasoned professionals begins with the standard two weeks and management needs to address this issue in order to to bring on seasoned professionals.

pros: Fed Ex gives students like me the flexibility to be a full time student, while working part time and having all of the perks of a full time employee. Not to many jobs out there will give you full benefits (health, dental, vision)from the day you start. Fed Ex helps with tuition reimbursement (up to $3,000 per year).  You also get flight benefits if you are over the age of 21 years old, and have been with the company up to 6 months. The flight benefits allowed me to travel to places through any airline at 75% off the total cost of any plane ticket.
cons: Fed Ex is an extremely physical job, with high risks of injury day in and day out if not cautions at all times. The entry level pay can be a higher for the amount of work provided. Starting pay is not far from minimum wage in the Bay Area.

pros:
Early adopter of technology
Low number of layoffs
Senior management is very competent
Very skilled employees
The most diverse company I have ever heard about
Very low turnover
cons:
The salaries are not the highest in the industry
The benefits are not great and are getting worse
Be prepared to only have two weeks of vacation for your first 5 years at FedEx
When something bad happens, assigning blame is more important than resolving the issue and moving on

review: Good place to work overall, but there are definite downsides.
pros: Good benefits package.  New employees start with two weeks paid vacation.  The medical insurance package is fairly good too.  I've heard that the annual bonus program is better than average, but I have yet to see that due to a downturn in business.  The annual raise is 2-4%.  I enjoy my coworkers as well.
cons: New hire training was non existent.  I spend more time dealing with the "system" than I do writing code.  We have tons and tons of paperwork to complete.  The system is very rigid at FedEx.  Recently we were told that we needed to work at least 45 hours per week.

review: I still have Purple Blood after 25 years.
pros: FEDEX is very diverse.  We have a very flexible work schedule.  When disaster strikes, FEDEX is there to help it's employees no matter where or what.  FEDEX supports a lot of charities.  Our CEO is probably one of the most creative and prolific leaders I've ever seen.  His thinking is so advanced and 'into the future' that I am proud to work for his company.
cons: Not enough room for growth in my field.  Not enough recognition for the job we are doing.  I'll see in this survey if we're getting enough pay for the work we do.

review: Overall very good experience. The company is well-run and responsive to employee needs.
pros: The benefits and worklife balance are excellent at FedEx. Without question this is the best place I've worked as far as that goes. The ability to move around in the company and grow is also quite good. I've now had three careers at FedEx and they have generously paid for my education while preparing for the latest. Their policy of promoting from within means that a lot of people I know have had opportunities to grow in ways they could not imagine.
cons: Innovation takes time. Paperwork and procedures are somewhat complex and getting moreso all the time. This may be occurring at other firms as well, but it seems especially difficult here.

pros: Great healthcare coverage, benefits, bonus opportunities, career growth, and profit sharing.You are not allowed to work more than 40 hrs a week so the work/life balance is great. Only down side is sometimes not having enough time for all the work you want to do in a week.
cons: Time commitment of 18 months before you are able to be promoted to any position in the company. Lack of opportunities cross-opcos. Too many administrative things to complete that are not in our job description. We do way too many things that customer service should be doing instead of focusing on selling.

review: Think there is anything better out there...think again!!!
pros: Large company with limitless opportunities.  They treat their employees fairly.  Although they are not unionized (thank goodness), employees have more protections than a company with unions.  This company is one of the most recognized in the world and the name recognition shows with the great service provided by wonderful employees.  I would (and have) recommended FedEx to friends and family.  Several friends have left government service to come to work for this great company.  I would not want to work for any other private company.  FedEx is a multi-billion dollar company that truly cares for its employees.  I feel as if I am part of a family.
cons: Private Company. No cost of living increases.

pros: Great working enviornment, team atmosphere, ongoing training to help broaden knowledge of portfolio of services, flexible work schedule, great management, excellent benefits, definite career growth, work/life balance
cons: Promotion is achievable however you must be willing to relocate if you are wanting to fast track. This is not a salary position so they are very strict on working only 40hrs/week. I appreaciate the work life balance but sometimes wish I had more time in the day to get everything done.

review: Excellent place for leading a comfortable life
pros:
- Most people work 30-35 hrs per week
- High job security 
- Good work environment
- Nice team work culture
cons:
- Salary is just comfortable and mostly the same for high, low and mediocre performers
- There is no career growth path
- Very low risk taking culture
- Every job is posted and people are interviewed. People who want to move forward spend more than half their time networking and other half creating interview packets. Promotion or career advancement is probably 20% dependent on skill and 80% on networking.
- Without promotions, which take on average about 5-10 years, the annual raises are about 1-3%. Yes the range is difference between significantly exceeding expectations and not meeting expectations

review: Hey, it's a job. You could be doing a lot worse...
pros:
Decent benefits. 
As a courier you get to meet new people everyday. 
On great weather days, you're outside and enjoying the sun.
cons:
No Union for couriers because of some governmental loophole FedEx has been able to take advantage of.
 It'll take you 15+ years to get to top pay as a courier,which is in the neighborhood of $29hr. ( compare it to UPS which is Union, their top pay is at $33hr+ and achieved at approx. 4-5 years)
Until then, be ready to put in as much overtime as you possibly can if available. 
Several couriers moonlight for Uber just to be able to make ends meet

Also, FedEx "Ground" and " Home Delivery" contracted drivers (not actual FedEx employees) with their lack of professionalism and work ethic that tarnish the FedEx name. 
The ISP model at Ground and Home Delivery is bad for company image, but great for the bottom line.

review: Put the "People" back in the PSP!!!
pros: job security, freedom to do my job,
cons: no time for a personal life. 12-13 hours spent at FedEx every day leaves no time to unwind and come to work the next day all rested and ready to go.

review: FedEx - Time for some tough decisions.
pros: Good well run company normally with better opportunities for advancement.  The compensation and benefit plans are some of the best in corporate America and rival government aganices
cons: "management by consensus" philosophy inhibits the ability to make neccesary but tough decisions.  The company has grown so much and moves very slowly at time to get things done.  Opportunities for growth are very limited but we ARE in very tough economic times and I believe this will change in the future and I hope it does so before we lose too many good people.

pros: Solid company with a superior product portfolio.  Great reputation in the industry with a forward thinking philosophy.  The compensation structure is fair and the benefits are very good.  Promotions are base on performance of course - the upward mobility within the company is very good.  Ample opportunties throughout the US if you are able to relocate within the Corporation.  Working for a company that has a brand recognition like FedEx helps as well.
cons: Office politics - although probably not unusual in any Fortune 100 company.  Overall, I've had a great experience working for the company and they have been fair with me in just about every aspect.

pros: Perfect for the single guy.
cons: It's very hard to move up in this company if you have been there for a while. If you have aspirations of moving up , you will need to do it within the first 3 to 5 years otherwise it will be a hard struggle up.  Management there is not so professional either! Just research and look at all the lawsuits that have been filed against FedEx in the past 8 yrs! I knew someone who tried to move up for over a year and was stuck doing work for his manager without anything to really show for it. He came close to getting fired for getting an injured doing his job.  He eventually was forced to relocate or be out of a job.

pros:
Managers are nice, although not always the best at managing. They do listen to requests for change of position and time off. Each warehouse is different and your experience may be good or bad depending where you go.  For a college student, I am able to work at night and go to school during the day. Nice co workers.
Many opportunities for growth and raises.
cons:
This job alone is not enough to make bills; most people have 2 or 3 jobs. 
It is hard work but the pay is nice.
People quit often and you have to pick up the slack from the "newbies" all the time

pros: Great people and good benefits.  Depending on your location and job, the facilities can be very nice.  Management is very down to earth and everyone seems to look out for each other.  This is not a company where you work a ton of weekends or a ton of hours.  They strongly promote work-life balance.
cons: The average person lacks a lot of urgency and controls are extensive.  It would not be an ideal place for independent thinkers.  Promotions are sometimes only tied to amount of time you have worked with the company.  This can be somewhat of a disappointment for people looking to quickly advance.

pros: Interline discounts haven't changed other than 6mos certification on dress code and conduct as a representative.
cons: Higher out of pocket health costs, retirement contribution match not what it used to be, takes longer to top out. New hires earn almost as much starting than 10 yr employees.

review: Best place to work in Memphis, TN
pros: Management stresses a good work / life balance.  FedEx has the best, highest paying jobs in Memphis, TN.  The company has not had to layoff workers (offering early retirement is first option).  There is a great benefits package, and many training opportunities for employees.  A person can join in one position, then quickly find an opportunity which best fits their desires / skills.
cons: Bureaucracy and cross-functional, cross-OpCo complexity makes it difficult to implement large scale projects.  Currently faced with economic issues related to oil prices and overall macro environment.  This has put the company is in a holding pattern keeping career opportunities limited.

pros:
FedEx is an excellent brand name offering decent pay with fair benefits, paid time off, retirement, profit sharing.
It is an excellent part time job while going to school and there are many advancement opportunities for those willing to move around.
cons: Benefits have been greatly diluted over the years. The traditional retirement is gone, pay did not keep up with society, jumpseat priveleges were abandoned, pay for performance and other benefits were diluted. The people, service, profit cornerstone was abandoned for profit, profit, profit. Long term employees are greatly disillusioned by the company. Management does not support the workforce.  No longer can you be assured of a job merely by being a conscientious hard worker.

pros:
-High base salary, especially if you stay with company and promote to senior sales executive.  
-Job Security
-Brand Recognition
-If you are willing to relocate there are many options for promotions
-Home office, set your own schedule (to an extent)
cons:
-Daily/weekly face to face call requirement is ridiculous (6/day; 30/week)
-More "customer service" than sales; too much admin work  
-Bonus is based on overall territory performance, not a lot of control as a rep on shipping needs of customers.  If customer business needs change and they don't need to ship as much, rep is negatively affected.
-Lots of internal issue with accounts being misaligned to wrong rep, this benefits some, and detrimental to others in terms of territory goal attainment and bonuses paid. 
-You can work really hard and not get paid, or you can not work hard and get paid, seems like a coin flip at times. 
-For the amount of work you do, the compensation (bonuses) really isn't that great.

review: Working at FedEx is not a job, it is an EXPERIENCE!
pros: FedEx has an excellent work-life balance and the opportunities to further your career or profession is excellent.  FedEx thrives on delivering the "Purple Promise" to their customer, which is: provided their customers with an outstanding experience.  The same holds true for FedEx employees...FedEx delivers an outstanding experience as you grow with the company.
cons: Wow...I can't think of any downsides to working at FedEx. There are outside challenges (fuel cost, electronic document exchange, etc) that sometimes hamper the business development process, yet even with these challenges, FedEx provides us with the tools and resources to overcome the challenges.

review: Lots of cover ups from management
pros: The people on the dock and the drivers are a ball to be around. The teamwork that goes on to load and unload trailers. The lead supervisors on the dock are people persons.
cons: Things that go on that get covered up would never happen elsewhere. Pulling trailers away from the dock with someone in it someone said the person was in training when in fact two other people were trained after this person. Opening a Fulltime positon and giving it to someone that took a sevrence left for a year and came back as a supplemental dockworker.Thats Just Wrong...

pros: Great company to work for, simply the best company in the metro Memphis area. The only Fortune 100 company in the metro area as well (to my knowlege).  Company has jobs which comes with Career tracks.  Great company culture.
cons: Far too much company politics.  Slow to adapt and change.  Seems like it's the "superstar" employees that do the real work of the company, while the others are just running their mouths but not accomplishing much.  Limited salary gains and very paltry bonuses.  Healthcare plan is mediocre.

review: New Accounts Setup and Specialized Call Routing
pros:
The position is work from home.
Good benefits.
LWOP means you can ask to take hours off on any given day and it does not go against your attendance. It is offered pretty frequently.
cons:
Even though you are a "specialty" department you are paid the same as a regular CSR.
You are eligible for a raise only once each year and the amount is incredibly low. I was the top rep in my department, getting the highest scores you could possibly get and received an 11 cent raise. 
Management is not effective and does not even attempt to fix or address some issues.
There is a large amount of contractors and it makes your job more difficult.

pros: Friendly culture.  Strong brand.  Good work-life balance.  Nice training opportunities.  Solid career advancement opportunities.  Good opportunities to work in a number of divisions.  Good benefit package overall.  Good salary comparable to other companies of similar size.  Pension plan.
cons: Poorly orchestrated layoffs.  Bureacracy given the size of the company.  Working alongside poor performers.  Minimal incentives for strong performance.  Poor HR division.  Very conservative legal department that slowed everything down or prevents things from moving forward.

pros:
-Start off making $11.90/hr. Overtime is like $18+/hr. Raises come every 3-12 months
-Easy work moving boxes/mail if you're in good shape
-Get a personal workout everyday (you will sweat & work most muscles in your body but its worth it and you'll feel great, make sure to stretch 
-Nice hours, only 3-4 a day unless you do overtime
-Complimentary Uniform/boots 
-Vision/Dental/Medical benefits after 3months
-College tuition assistance & reimbursement
-Retirement Plan
-Good working environment
-Resembles a small city 
-Complimentary food catered every few months
-Security
cons:
-Gets very hot in unairconditioned work areas esp. In the summer
-Hours (start time & end time) are different everyday so you have to call a hotline in the mornings

pros: People are the focus for FedEx, you always feel that the company cares about you. This is also a very customer centric compnay so we will bend over backwards to make customers happy and FedEx rewards employees for doing that.
cons: As any large corporation, there is bureaucracy and things are slow to get done as you have to fight for resources. Currently due to bad ecomony there are no carreer opportunites at FedEx, it is in a so-called 'hiring freeze'. Memphis is another downside. This is not an exciting city and crime is bad.

pros: A great place to work. Forgiving of mistakes.  My job entails using advance analytics and project management on cross functional projects. Forward looking strategic analysis. Mentoring newer employees. Team leader at times.  I truly admire about half of my management,
cons: Multiple operating companies means no unions,except for pilots, but it also means inefficiency. Changing focus multiple times during the year.  Much emphasis put on as opposed to valuing challenging ideas. Most executives children work for the company and are promoted very quickly.  Promoting within leads to group think.  Salary for the highest level individual contributors is too low.

pros:
I've worked for FedEx for five years, many of my colleagues have worked for the company over 15 years (and I have one who's been with FedEx 40 years!). I feel my pay is commiserate to my job title, our health benefits are excellent (coverage and cost) and we have a generous pension and 401(k) opportunity. 
My work / life balance is what I'd expect for a full time corporate level position and I have the opportunity to learn and explore new challenges.
cons: In my department opportunities for advancement are limited (but not at the company as a whole). And we have a low morale issue due primarily to poor vendor management and a few very very negative employees (they are never happy).

review: FedEx reminds me of a dysfunctional but loving family... for the most part, it's great, until the doors are closed.
pros: FedEx is stable and tries to keep employees best interests at heart. They offer reasonably competitive pay and benefits. There is pride in the brand, even among employees.
cons: FedEx can be political and two-faced... the company seems much more concerned about their reputation to the public (shareholders) and sometimes shoots itself in the foot. Also, FedEx has become very bureaucratic and more of a popularity game, rather than truly rewarding innovation and hard work. The employee has become more disposable over the years, though, admittedly, it's still better than most companies.

review: FedEx truly a first class company
pros:
The best reasons to work for Fedex include the following:
-The ability to work for a great company
-The experience of working for a top notch organization
-Great name for building your resume
-Great benefits and competitive pay
-Everyone knows what FedEx does
-For the most part, people are truly valued by the company
-Work/life balance is good
cons:
The downsides to working at Fedex include the following:
-Career opportunities are limited because people in management rarely leave FedEx
-Some questionable people in management
-Employee development could use improvement
-Memphis is not the best of cities to work and live in

review: Excellent place to work but driven individuals beware!
pros: Excellent camaraderie with other employees, job security, excellent benefits, very ethical company.  I'm proud to work at FedEx.
cons: There are a large number of employees that aren't carrying their fair share of the workload.  While this is encouraging for some, because of job security, it is very discouraging for those that really want to contribute to FedEx's success.  It can be demoralizing to see other's that aren't contributing as much getting the same recognition and compensation as those that strive hard to do an excellent job.

review: Great company, challenging work, decent salary.
pros: Challenging work. Committed team members. Generous benefits. FedEx is a strong believer in positive reinforcement. They often make the top of best places to work lists because they treat their employees very fairly. Respect, diversity, and cooperation are heavily favored.
cons: Limited short-term promotion opportunity. Heavy workload. Politics. Employees come from all over the country to work here for the opportunity to work for this very well respected company and they tend to stay for a very long time. Most promotion is from within but opportunity is limited due to very low turnover and high satisfaction. Great opportunity if you plan on staying in Memphis for 10 + years. Hard to advance in shorter periods of time.

review: Perfect for College student who wants to earn fast cash or turn in to a career in the future
pros: Good Pay and Hours, advancements are available based on your performance, including time. In my facility, managers are awesome! treats their workers right. If you do not have a gym membership, treat this job as a work out! and getting paid at the same time!
cons: So far there are no Cons, other than people calling out and have to pick up the slacks. This is a very physical demanding job, so if you don't mind sweating and getting sore, this job is perfect! You eventually get used to it.

review: FedEx values their employees...Great place to work, Invoice Analyst
pros: The benefits are very good, lots of training available, clean and pleasant office, and all the necessary up-to-date tools to complete the work. Good work/ life balance.
cons: The workload was heavy and sometimes very monotonous.  There was very little room for advancement without going to Memphis.  Progressing to higher positions takes a LONG time. There is also very little regulating the management from nurturing and advancing their 'favorites' based on their relationship not the skill level.

pros: The benefits are great, the location is perfect for me very close to my home. I really like the team I work with great culture and establishing a living psp.
cons: Wish there was a little more room for development and promotion but I know if I work hard stay focused and get my graduate degree a new field of work will open up for me n

pros: FedEx Services is a great company and the perfect place to build a very rewarding career. Because of its size, there are a lot of opportunities to move up through the ranks. They also have really good training available for anyone who wants to take advantage of it. The benefits are pretty standard. The people are wonderful!
cons: They suffer from some of the same issues as most big companies: upper management is in the dark about some things; there is a lot of competition to move up; and although the benefits are standard they've become expensive.

review: Package Handler @ 8951 Yosemite Street Henderson, CO 80640
pros:
-You get paid every week
-Flexible hours
-Initial training program was nice (it's a shame nobody actually uses what they teach in these programs)
cons:
-They will work you until you faint
-Managers tried to stop me from hydrating myself on several occasions
-The job description is a lie, they will make you handle packages heavier than 100 pounds by yourself
-Coworkers have no respect for management and vice versa, show up late and under appreciate the work coworkers do
-Environment is dirty and unsafe, had a rat problem, trash piled up in areas
-Managers create an unfriendly environment with their inappropriate language and intimidating behavior
-Did not pay enough and sorely lacked staff
-Broken equipment and facility was falling apart
-Would not allow phones in facility (wonder why... could it be they don't want people taking pictures/recording video?)
-NOBODY FOLLOWED POLICY!!!! (stepped on boxes, sorted incorrectly, drug use, etc.)

review: FedEx is a good starting job
pros: Its a place that is usually hiring, and is a bit faster paced than usual, you'll have plenty to do with nice pay, compared to other entry level jobs. Applying for a position in early fall through winter is basically a guaranteed job, and if you work hard enough you'll have a good chance of moving up their higher positions.
cons: FedEx is usually hiring because its a labor intensive job, and requires actual physical labor on the workers end. Most of the time though your workload will be small, although this is no good if you need money, because at FedEx you work until all the packages are where they need to be, which means at whatever time all the packages are loaded is what time you'll be going home. FedEx cuts hours based on how much labor they need, so if the package count is low, then your hours will be low. The best time to apply for FedEx is right before holiday season; (I applied the last week of october and got my job on Halloween. ) although, holiday season has really high amounts of workload and you'll be forced to work extra hours at varying clock in/clock out times. You don't have a standard clock in/clock out time at FedEx, it is changed actively thoughout the week. If you're part time you might have anywhere from 15 to 32 hours a week based on how much work there is to be done, and how long you are willing to stay each day. If you aren't a work horse beware, because this job gets to a point where its not the physical effort you have to put in to lift boxes; (which, to be fair, are usually light) its about how monotonous the job can be, the work never changes, your job will be to take a box, scan it, and put it somewhere else for however long every day, so good luck with that. This job has more of equipment, sharp edges, and heavy lifting than usual, so becareful, and steel-toe boots could help out a lot.

review: I am proud of working for such a respected company
pros: FedEx is a company that most people recognize, and has an excellent reputation,  It is a company that has allowed me to grow professionally and allowed many opportunities.  The culture of FedEx is also very positive and inspirining, and I feel like I am selling a quality product.  I also feel very lucky to be working under a CEO with such leadership and vision.  I feel like I have many options in staying with FedEx, and feel like I truly am a valued employee.  They also provide excellent benefits, I think, compared to other organizations.
cons: I beleive other organizations have more competitive salaries.

pros:
People are treated decently - fair towards minorities and immigrants.
Race or color does not matter towards promotions! FedEx is the largest employer of immigrants within the state of Tenneessee. Certain groups have world class talent and it is a great experience to work with such people.
The benefits are great with discounted air tickets, good health insurance, great work environment, etc.
cons: Company is slow to move to market conditions and bit conservatinve. As a result if you want to make a change it will take time and at times could be frustrating.

pros: career opportunities - operations, sales, analytical positions available when times are good. If you are willing to move, your chances for advancement are greatly improved.  Compensation seems fair compared with competitors is fair, but variable compensation could be better for sales jobs.  Benefits are tremendous, still offer pension as well as half-match on 401k. Good health benefits and promote good work/life balance.  Must like a constantly changing atmosphere. Always keeping pace or getting ahead of competition means procedures never stick around long.  Management does a good job of reconizing good performers.  Overall good place to work.
cons: morale - can be negative with some employees, typical for most large companies.

review: I love working at Fedex, best company I have ever worked for
pros:
Excellent benefits and salary
Company tuition reimbursement program
Good work/life balance
Most employees have been here for many years and will retire from Fedex
Management cares and listens to us
Great location, parking, cafeteria, gym, etc.
Lots of training and opportunities 
No layoffs due to the fact they use contractors as part of the staff
cons: The only con I can think of now is the drive to the top of Fedex Drive in the snow.

review: Hard work but good benefits.  Advancing takes a while.  High starting pay.
pros: Good benefits even if part time.  Medical and retirement are included.  Lots of coworkers are friendly and work hard. A better than average work environment.  Only dont miss work and keep the fast pace.  It becomes easier as you go. Overtime is available to all.
cons: Aching body, early start, they always want you there no matter what, you will be tired a lot. Asking for advancing opportunities is not well seen if you have not been there for a year. Beware of the few people who will purposely give you bad advice or try to sabbotage you.  Some people might find the higher pay not worth it for the level of effort. If not athletic this will be your only job as you are left exhausted.

pros: Working for FedEx i learned about different services fed ex has to offer such as printing services such as over size prints which are posters, banners, rigid signs, business cards etc. FedEx specializes in signs ad graphics as well as shipping giving customers a variety of options to choose from.
cons: The downside of working for fed ex is, fed ex considers a full time position 30 hours a week never more, which i disagree with most employers i have worked for in the past 40 hours is considered full-time. Along with little to no appreciation for the hard work you provide in your center it sometimes is over bearing being employed there. It can be difficult to balance a job there and everyday life and you need balance  its very important.

pros: The people at FedEx are amazing. The company pays very well, even its interns. My higher ups did a great job of making me feel comfortable and included. The culture is fun and vibrant. Being such a big company they get to play with the other "big boys."
cons: There is a lot of red tape to get through at FedEx. Everything has to go through legal and brand scrutiny. Being such a large company, your field of work is very narrow, especially in marketing as there are several teams and multiple directors.

pros: Great Benefits, World Class Training that you won't get anywhere else but college! Generous Pay Great place to get a career started at any age. Generally Intelligent and Personable Coworkers. Your opinion is valued if you get it to the right persons.
cons: They'll work you to death in exchange for the good pay and bene's. Getting sick repeatedly will cost you your job....fyi I worked part time and left on a buyout. They own you during the holidays so get used to it right up front. Management appears to be driven by upper management to really crack the whip.

pros:
- Dev equipment was decent.
- Great bonus structure for top performance.
- It is really difficult to get fired.
- Decent benefits.
- Pay is on par with industry standards.
- The campus is really nice.
- Volunteer work for charity.
cons:
- It is really hard to get fired so you have to deal with dead weight. Sometimes there are "volatile" personalities who won't be fired even with workplace violence prevention in place.
- You are in a silo so you won't have an opportunity to touch technology outside your area.
- Your skills will also atrophy due to lack of new projects.
- Work life balance is a joke if you want a decent APEX score.
- Promotions are few and far between.

review: Almost like being self-employed, but with the security if a corporate position.
pros: The company is doing very well and the pay and bonuses show it.  As a Customer Technical Consultant you are left to plan your work day and training yourself. Usually, that is a good thing, but sometimes that can leave you feeling isolated and lacking support.
cons: It can be difficult to know where you should focus your energy and what direction to take your technical skills when there is no direct oversight. The position seems to change goals annually and is moving to a more verbal consultative role than actual technical work, almost blending into sales.

pros: FedEx offers a wide range of professional opportunities.  In addition, there is a very strong affirming culture within which those that work hard are acknowledged and given opportunities for professional growth.
cons: As a 24 year veteran, my compensation is not what it should be for the work I do - I chose to not  change companies frequently over the years, which hindered my compensation level.

pros: Friendly and positive corporate culture; reasonable work-life balance; respect for diversity; job stability; comfortable working environment. It's a great place to work.
cons: As with every corporate job, politics sometimes wins over the best solution, and favoritism can sometimes affect promotions and recognition. Most of the time when managers post a position they already know who they will choose. You can easily get stuck in one area of the company because of your assignments and find you are not able to compete for jobs in another.

review: Not all it's made out to be
pros: The people in my department were good people for the most part. My direct manager was one of the nicest people I've ever met that put family first in front of work even though the company does not.
cons: Compensation is awful for the work I was doing. Spent 10 years of my life there. Seven of those years I was stuck in one department trying to get out to no avail. I know the industry from start to finish but because it's divided into separate OP-Cos it's nearly impossible to switch to other positions. The corporate headquarters for ground is full of  nepotism. I would apply for jobs then later find out the people hired had little to no experience but were friends of  employees or family or attractive young women hired by male managers. Getting out was a great decision for me.

review: The best transportation Company in the world
pros: The culture of the company is unlike others in the industry. True dedication and involvement from the top down. Great pay and benefits. Career advancement and opportunities based on the a merit system. Respect and concern for the employees. Flexibility in your works schedule. Great perks such as discounts on air travel, retail stores and shops. Great Senior management!! Recognition for a job well done. Constant training opportunities to enhance your ability for other career paths. In closing this company has been around less than 40 years and is by far the best transportation company to work for in Sales.
cons: Some of the internal network issues can hinder the overall performance.

pros: I believe in the company's overall mission and values.
cons:
Managers must be managers and not full time package handlers. Managers need more training (people skills)
At the end of the day, you're so tired it is unreal.

pros:
Fed Ex culture is wonderful. The company gives to charities around the world plus they provide assistance when any disaster occurs.
They have team building activities a few times a year and casual Fridays for employees.
Health care is very affordable and local FedEx Clinics are discounted.
cons: Pay could be a little better and vacation should turn into PTO along with paid holidays and personal days plus sick leave. This would follow other like companies in PTO time instead of qualifying the time off you take.

review: You can be proud to work here.
pros: FedEx provides job security and good benefits to its employees and the majority of its managers encourage  maintaining a good work/life balance.  FedEx is excellent at providing its people with all of the tools necessary to do their jobs and for the most part, still operates by its People, Service, Profit model.
cons: Excessive administrative requirements;  Products/services offered have become a commodity

review: FedEx is a good place for a stable career
pros:
Job security - senior management is committed to protecting jobs even in a down economy.
FedEx is a leader in its industry, and has a strong brand.  This results in a strong & proud corporate culture.
My experience has been that ethical behavior is both expected and valued at FedEx.
cons:
FedEx is very bureaucratic.  Turning the ship takes time.
 Raises are pretty low - it is difficult to move up in salary without getting promoted.

review: Great place to work, not perfect.
pros: Great brand power, great benefits (401k + pension), easy to sell, management at the executive level is superb.
cons: Inconsistency on message delivered from the Director level down, each district does whatever they want. A lot of secretism about the direction the company will go. What I would say is not worry about what you know but about you don't.

pros: Great benefits, lateral moves are possible, pension plan that few companies have, job stability, once you are a manager you are bullet proof.  Equitable hiring practices. great company for ex-military people. Great brand recognition.  You are responsible for creating your own work/life balance.  Upper management has good vision and innovative ideas.  Never a dull moment.
cons: Terrible managers are never held accountable. Management is overwhelmingly white males. Raises never keep up with the cost of living so negotiate high when coming on-board. No real support for innovation.  Managing up is a huge burden on top of your existing work load.  Being nice or political is more important than being knowledgeable.

review: Great Company, nice pay, nice ppl.Great Company, nice pay, nice ppl
pros: Great training, nice compensation and benefits. low workload and vacations. Flight benefits great health benefits buddy passes traveling all around the world iota wonderful
cons: The pay was a bit low, and although management was very willing to give me more responsibility and more opportunities, they were not willing to increase my salary.Move around too much hard to balance family friends

review: Mid-management Position/Hard to get things done/Close Minded
pros:
- Tuition Reimbursement, decent pay,
- Some opportunities for advancement, but only if you know how to play the political game
- Active in the community
cons:
- Salary range just the average even if you are a rock star. 
- So many restrictions to avoid lawsuits often impossible to get things done and can't get paid what you're worth. I had a 'lifer' who would literally sleep at his desk and I still couldn't fire him.
- Reached a point that they were no longer innovative. After Amazon was on 60 mins saying they were looking at using drones to deliver packages in the future, the next day top leadership literally started a company-wide meeting by joking about how stupid of an idea it was (who's laughing now?)

review: A solid, employee oriented company with great work-life balance and good pay/benefits relative to other industrial orgs.
pros:
-Relatively good pay.
- Good benefits: 401K, pension, PTO, medical-dental-vision, discounted airline travel, other little perks.
- Work-life balance
- Stability and job security
- Reputation as a top 100 employer
- Mobility across company and divisions
cons:
- Slow and bureaucratic at times.
- Senior management more interested in empire building. Not much focus on efficiency.
- Slow to innovate- happy with status quo.
- Over-staffing (in some areas) resulting in bored under-utilized employees and fewer opportunities for upward growth.

review: Incredible benefits, fair and equitable manangement style.
pros: The benefits are 2nd to none. Compensation is inline with the industry. Management treats employees fair and equitably.  A very forward thinking and progressive company.  Not afraid to experiment with new concepts and ideas that can improve employee life balance.
cons: Call center customer service is very intense and can be very stressful some days.  Depending on your personality burn out can build quickly.  Call center turnover is high. Ideal for a part-time job but wouldn't do it full-time.  Call volume is very high with 200-300 calls in a typical shift.

review: Overall it is a good experience, the people I work with are really great and management takes care of its employees.
pros: A great environment where safety is number one. Job is easy to understand and perform. Team work is fostered at all levels and benefits such as tuition reimbursement are available.
cons: The job requires a lot of lifting and carrying of heavy and awkward objects such as tires and axles. It is in a warehouse type building where cold and heat can seep in. Working around hazardous materials such as containers filled with chemicals and flammable materials.

pros: Camaraderie. Everyone becomes like family. Some coworkers you will have longer than the time youve known your spouse or longer than your kids are old. very easy to get very comfortable.
cons: the silos run very tall, very narrow, very deep. You will do one thing and one thing alone. You will not have a chance to get into anything new. Too political to move around the company. Since the 2009 layoffs and the 2013 buyouts, there has been a complete culture change. no longer people first. thats a forgotten myth. Profit, Service, people. Stock prices are at all time high, because they are screwing the employee. 7 years ago, FedEx would have gotten 5 stars. Today, they get 2 stars. They have lost their vision.

review: FedEx is a pretty good place to work.
pros: It provides an excellent opportunity to use the communication skills developed over a career in the news business, but without the daily deadline pressure or hurried approach that can impact quality.
cons: There are many layers of management; and it often seems that these people can be working at cross purposes.  Also, because of the structure of the corporation into separate operating companies, communicators working in one area of the company may not be aware of things that are happening in another.  And even though communications and marketing fall under the same umbrella, it's rare to have complete communication between the two groups.

review: safe, stable and respectable job in a matured company
pros: work life balance, people service profit philosophy, job security, flexible hours. 360 ddegree feedback is institutionalized across the company and is taken very seriously around here. this keep management honest and committed to the employees.
cons: matured company offers limited growth opportunities. diversity is very visible but promotions are hard to come by. like any big company there is red tape to reckon with, things dont move quickly enough.

review: Not a bad place to work.
pros: If you did your work and the boss did not hear of any problems or complaints, you were fine.  Salaries for my line of work were above industry norms.
cons: Having to deal with the compartmented departments.  Groups that needed to work together and communicate did not have a direct channel between them and were under different management organizations.  Groups making decisions that affected others and not telling them or saying-well it's your problem now.

pros: Working in FedEx helps you to better understand the real corporate world. You will be involved in all the meetings of the on going projects in the team. Everybody is so friendly and the living PSP is everywhere around FedEx.
cons: Sometimes team members might be busy with the work they are already assigned with and so are helpless when you need to know something but that remains only for sometime. Later at some point of time, your mentor or your manager will help you finish your objectives assigned during your internship.

review: You can learn a great deal & work with great people but don't expect a decent raise or high pay based on job performance
pros: If you push to learn a lot, you will be given the opportunity to learn a lot. You will work with other very professional and dedicated people in a very complex industry. You will receive public recognition for a job well done. Good benefits, retirement and health care package. They actually do a pension plan and most companies don't anymore. You can move around within the company in different roles if you want to. They are rapidly growing and are at the forefront of technology used with US CBP. This attracts big companies that do international business to desire a working relationship with Fedex Trade Networks leading to increased business opportunities.
cons: Just because you learn a lot, or are extremely good at your job doesn't mean you will get a pay increase. You can be awesome at your job, do a ton of work and be extremely productive and the person next to you can be lazy and unproductive, you will both be paid the same. Even though you receive public recognition for achievements, that doesn't result in better pay or bonuses. Several years ago Fedex Trade Networks did this but now they do not anymore due to their goal of ORGANIC growth. I.E. encourage hard work in employees, pay them low wages, grow the company and pad corporate executives pockets with bonuses and stock options. The benefits are great but the pay won't help you pay down school debt any faster. Moving around within the company doesn't guarantee salary increases, just more work.

pros: Best reasons are working for a company that values there employees and as long as they are willing to move up. Depends how deep down and high spirited towards the job they appreciates. Will succeed within the company in any position.
cons: Not hardly but there are always an added improvements to provide FedEx the best in its field.

review: Fedex is a wonderful company to work for. The culture, the benefits, the people‚Ä¶ All make for a wonderful environment.
pros: Flexibility, benefits, work life balance, vacation days, nice corporate environment.
cons: Many of the processes at Fed Ex Are complex and need to be leaned out.  Getting anything approved seems to take forever. Managers still like to get involved in day-to-day work and many of them won‚Äôt allow the teams to shine, instead they want the visibility of the team success on them.

review: Responsible for product management, defining and implementing product/services initiatives
pros: Relatively slop-paced environment with adequate support and resources to define and implement new products/services.  Ample opportunities for a promotion into a management position.
cons: Too much inertia and bureaucracy that would frustrate someone who has worked in a smaller company and is used to fast product cycles.   Internal debates/resource allocation process takes as much energy as any project itself.

pros: Meeting people & building a close relationship with regular customers is a positive with FedEx if it lasts, however the company is constantly playing games with numbers and goals by micromanaging,  that seems to bump some people from there routes, then a few months later when the big ideas / plans fail to produce any gains it goes back to the same old way, but your no longer with your old customers because you were probably forced to move or bumped
cons: unobtainable goals that have been constantly raised for more than a decade to the point you can no longer make them unless you break all the rules set in stone, break most rules of the road including that you speed thru neighborhood streets, briskly sprint up to all the homes or bussiness, and work thru most of your lunch lining up the rest of the days work on your own time i might add, just to get close to your goal to avoid the daily NOID

review: Great people, growing company, limitless opportunity.
pros: Employee Benefits are good, management is good.  The company is growing like crazy so there is ample opportunity to move up within the company pretty quickly assuming you do a good job.
cons: I think they could pay a higher salary to the employees.  I guess the company makes up for this based on their employee benefits.

review: good atmosphere and people to work with
pros: always active. meet and get a chance to know lots of customers. Home Delivery drivers are usually motivated. work on your own.  pay can be fairly well in some cases.
cons: no medical benefits while working for contractors, hours (completion time) can vary from day to day.  pay can vary widely in some cases, depending on the route.

pros: Stable company that offers good benefits and decent pay. Upper management does a good job of making employees feel appreciated.
cons: Yearly reviews and how they are weighed changes almost yearly sometimes making it difficult to reach higher raise increases. Company mandates a lot of overtime (usually needless in my department) especially around the holidays. Usually the company offers to cut your OT hours but it makes it hard to plan things socially during this time because you don't know when or if OT will be cut.

review: FedEx is an excellent company to work for!
pros: For me, FedEx has been a fantastic company to work for.  I've been with FedEx for 2.5 years after running my own business and have really enjoyed the structure, pay, benefits and attitude with regard to work/life balance.  It has been a great move.
cons: FedEx is a very large corporation and you do run into bureaucray in your day to day work.

pros: Pay is great for only being a part-time job. Benefits are also very stellar for only being PT. Once you prove yourself, management is very willing to work with you.
cons: My only complaint has been of management lately at my facility. Someone was hired based on who they were and not what they knew. Now morale is down at our facility from being micromanaged by someone who does not really know what is going on.

pros: pride in the brand, benefits are good especially travel perks; should be more to say but cant really think of anything else; tuition reimbursement is great
cons: too metrics focused. not focused enough on the people; constant pressure to do more and they don't seem to value experience anymore. very focused on new people. definitely not interested in using the right people for the right jobs. continuing to downsize through attrition just to hide what you are doing is not working. Pressuring people by having them do 3 and 4 people's job is wrong.

review: The worst experience in my life
pros: The company have Good Benefits
cons: No Managerial support including human resources - Every departments have clicks and if you are not part of it, you will be cast as an outsider.  Most of the employees have been there    10 - 30 yrs, started in the hub or another lower paid position and think FedEx is the best job in the world. They feel if someone is hired from the outside, that person has not put there work in for the company; so the chances of advancement or slim to none  In addition, if management doesn't like you, they will falsify annual reviews, give inaccurate letters of warnings to make it look like an employee is not performing well, which are lies.   Also, managers are allowed to manage friends, so if you think about complaining, you better think twice and have you another job already lined up.  Pathetic!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

review: It could be worse, but it could always be better
pros: FedEx has the ability to pull up its bootstraps when times get difficult.  I have seen management continually cut costs, thus ensuring the workforce is spared from layoffs.  In a time when job security is somewhat scarce, FedEx has continually offered its workforce a safe haven as long as packages keep shipping.  I believe this is a testament to the overall management by our founder Fred Smith.  As long as he is around, I really do believe the employees will be thought about before drastic cuts are made.
cons: There are a lot of "old guard" employees left at FedEx.  The same benefit that FedEx has in providing a safe haven for its employees, also leads to a bit of a downfall in unqualified workers.  In the IT arena where I work, there are many folks still on the job, whether having moved to a new department or not, whose time had come many years ago.  Unfortunately, it seems neither they nor management has seen it that way.  It leads to discourse in some of the younger and hungrier employees who share the same titles as the older ones, but end up performing most of the work.  These "old-timers", whose vacation times now exceed 5 weeks in some cases, come and go as they please, and are allowed to reap the same benefits and titles as those of us with much more aptitude for the job.  This can be very discouraging and cause a lot of qualified folks to turn away from working at FedEx.

review: The place to work in Memphis
pros:
Every employee is treated as a vital and valued part of the organization. 
Outstanding opportunity for advancement and career development even for people lacking a college degree or traditional education.
Training readily available for carrer development.  
Company culture values military veterans and the experience gained in service to the military.
Very good benefits, even for part time and non-exempt employees. 
Company is a steward to the community and encourages employees to follow the example
cons:
Expect to work hard in the sort facility. It is tough work but strong teams are built to handle it. 
24/7/365 operation. Expect long hours and little time off in the Holiday rush.

review: Solid company- they expect you to want to build a career there.
pros: Stability- you won't make a mint but you can be pretty certain if you do your job you will continue to have one.  Good organizational culture with a sense of humor.  There are some people
cons: Lots of internal barriers to promotion and movement- some cultural some legal.  Things take time, and it can be difficult to see results from your work in the short term.

review: Better employer than most, old-style management
pros: Good benefits, good perks, one of the few companies that still have pensions, good bonuses
cons: Old-style management, emphasis on seniority, sometimes challenging to move up, non-union, H/R is elusive to employees by design, no open-door policy

pros: You are virtually your own boss as far as daily work is concerned.  Once you become familiar with your route you will have a shorter work day for the same pay.  If you are interested in advancing within the company , it is ground level and could be used as a spring-board into other positions.  It's a steady job.
cons: Some work days are never-endingly long.  Holidays are a time when this will absolutely be the case.  Weather and other driving irratations are part of the everyday worklife of this position.  Fellow co-workers with negative/whiny attitudes can be an issue.  Be aware you will likely be underpaid as you will be a sub-contractor.

review: Great benefits....the people policy is declining.
pros: Good pay, good benefits. Extensive training. Holiday pay, sick pay, vacation pay, and floating as need off pay days. Opportunity for advancement and transfers. Free air travel.
cons: Upper management has begun to micromanage since 2008. This has resulted in less teamwork and more focus on individual performance. Work hours can be long and there's very little flexibility to take time off in emergency situations...sick child, etc. You have to bid on vacation time once a year, senior employees get first choice leaving crappy options for newer employes.

pros: Good benifits. 401k. Pension. Non Union. Medical,  Dental, Vision available.  Most employees great people. They just want to do their job and go home to family.
cons: Pay increases should be on performance not years of service. How well you are treated comes down to your manager. Some senior managers are abusive and will use a willing manager to make all of the employees lives miserable and no one above will help if the numbers are good. Yes. They knew.
