pros: They make sure their employees are well taken care of. You work alone, the shifts are short. No micromanagement and the managers are laid back and easy going.
cons: The work is a little fast paced. It's not an easy job, but it's more of you having to get use to lifting heavy boxes and playing tetris. It gets really hot in the trailers and the pay is worth it. Not that many people to talk to.

pros: Good people work there. It‚Äôs a growing company in a growing industry, and there are opportunities.
cons: Too many to list all: Inadequate, outdated, poorly kept, and run down resources. When your competition runs a business better than the very one you started-You know it‚Äôs bad. Company founded by a marine corps pilot=company run like its the military-assignments with tons of responsibility-yet no, limited, or poor resources provided to get the job done.  Employees are expected to use personal cell phone as a job aid, yet the company offers no reimbursement for the use of a personal item for company business. Heath insurance is the worst. Provider is Cigna, which is also the worst. Vision is Davis Vision, again the worst-you‚Äôre better off going to drug store glasses-less brain damage.  Package cars are filthy. Drivers leave food in them and the rats come in the middle of the night and eat it. I‚Äôve seen droppings in the trucks.

review: I Feel Very Lucky To Work For FedEx!!!! Great Company!!!!
pros: Competitive Pay, Great Benefits, Great Opportunities Domestically and Globally, Selling the FedEx Brand, Job Security, Great Work Environment, Great Training and the way that your treated and coached by management (Developmental, Supportive, Fair and Objective)
cons: Working with individuals who don‚Äôt appreciate the company or who do not want to pull their weight. Negative people always bring me down. However, for the most part all of the Account Executives I work with are exceptional and very professional. But like every company/sales department there are always individuals who struggle and are negative because of it.

review: As honestly as I can put it.
pros: Every day is the same, yet different. Once you leave the building you can sucessfully manage yourself. Great at working with communities and charities. Your success is what you make of it.
cons: You're required to load your own truck so you leave the station and greet the public sweaty and nasty. Benefits became much more expensive. You're punished if you do well by getting your delivery stops per hour (SPH) raised. You're forced to speed in order to meet your daily SPH avg. You are a human resource: If you get hurt and can't work you're discarded like a bent paper clip. Management is never satisfied with ANY results, good or bad. Couriers and lower management turnover is very high. Management is verbally abusive at times. There is no work/life balance unless you fight for it. It can be a very high pressured job.

pros: Working at FedEx provided very decent wages. The company benefits allowed my girlfriend to give birth and choose which hospital to have our first child with all the advantages of prenatal care and provided "lifeworks" nurse.
cons: I have experienced unfair treatment that included several years of fighting for upgrade of my job title/status along with a pay raise accordingly. Workload distribution amongst team members was also problematic, with longer tenured employees choosing the easiest job duties with the "grunt work" assigned to the new/junior employees and still receiving comparable pay raises. All time off is scheduled on seniority basis which at times affords the longest tenured employees all the holidays and/or prime summer vacation weeks and leaves the new employees with families and kids the unappealing weeks.

pros: Nice people do work here
cons: Management has drastically changed in the last 5 years.   Fedex is no longer a company designed to take care of its employees.   They have fully endorsed moving jobs offshore regardless of performance or language ability of the contractors and have now in their new building for the DFW area shows how little they care about employees by putting in an open cube system designed to remove privacy and end any self worth of an employees that remains.   Fedex is now showing they could care less about their employees by refusing to allow hires of anyone but foreign contractors who cannot do the job forcing the rest of us to do their work on top of our own and open desk designs telling every employee that you are no longer an individual.   You are just a number to them.

pros: Company that allows growth, and easy to move up in the company. Have learned that your experience will greatly depend on your senior manager. Easy to transfer, or move to a different location and have a job. Benefits. better pay than retail. Get to be on the move. More often than not, management started same place as you.
cons: Your experience depends on management, if you don't like the company it's probably their faught and best just to transfer elsewhere.

review: Be on the good side of your superiors.  This will open opportunities down the road.
pros: benefits,  tuition reimbursement.  Great part time job for students.
cons: If you're out of shape, this will suck for the first month.   It does get a lot easier the longer you're there.

review: 12 years as a swing courier has been a constantly evolving experience.
pros: No chance to get bored at this job! Good pay and benefits. Physically demanding, so less time at the gym. No layoff policy (even throughout the recession). Many opportunities for career advancement and able to transfer anywhere in the world if there is a position open.
cons: Sometimes long hours and Saturday work required. Physically demanding. Productivity expectations are sometimes unreasonable. Fast pace and covering different areas is not for everyone.

review: Great company to work for as a pilot
pros: Excellent pay and benefits for the industry. Stable, no furloughs in the history of the company, as far as pilots go. First class operation, airplanes are well maintained, flight safety is top priority. Tremendous amount of flexibility for this kind of job, as far as how much you desire to work.
cons: Much of our flying is at night, which is very difficult on your body. Possible exposure to hazardous goods in a confined area. Don't know if they ever clean out the oxygen system for the masks, which could make you sick. These issues make me concerned about getting cancer.

review: FedEx is resting on its laurals, but is still a go company to work for.
pros: FedEx still has many of the benefits that other companies have thrown away, although not as "rich" as they use to be.  FedEx Express has never laid off an employee.  FedEx promotes very largely from within.  FedEx treates customers much better than others in industry and therefore has a brand that gives an employee clout.  Most employees get along with each other and work together.
cons:
There is the "FedEx way" and the wrong way.  This manifests itself in Purple-Correct thinking.  The company doesn't take serious ideas that come from "outsiders" who are hired.  Your opinion is valued inverse proportially to the number of digits in your employee number.  Except for Fred Smith, no one above the rank of Sr. VP understands the airline part of the company, so airline type issues do not get priority except in the view of eliminating cost.  Also, since the company has never laid off any workers, there are a lot of dead weight leeches entrenched inside the company.  Lot of people doing their nails in their cubes and taking 20 minute smoke breaks each hour.

Finally, if the company's salary exempt pay structure is near immoral.  No adjustment for cost of living.  Merit increases cap at 3.5% for a 4.0 employee.  This causes talented employees to leave while the leaches stay on.

review: Just  my observation - but shared by so many grunts who bleed purple.
pros: Flex Time and Bonuses were good.  But the greatest reason to work for FedEx is the people (non-management).  They are the most down earth set of people you could work with.
cons:
FedEx's Low Level Managment to the CIO lack vision and direction, despite management's propaganda.  Many of FedEx Services problems are the reflection of the leadership in the management chain.  It's not what you know but who you know.  But this mantra has caught up to FedEx as it eventually catches up to most companies.  Middle management is more concerned with climbing up the corporate chain than doing what is right for the company, the stockholders, or the employees.  The Executive Management is so out of touch with was occurring at FedEx Services because they rely on middle management to be concise, ethical, and to the point.  However, as most work places including FedEx Services, middle management tells senior management what they want to hear rather than tell them how it really is. 

If you don't believe my commentary.  Ask a FedEx Services employee how successful 6x6 or 6x6 Reloaded was/is (off the record) in Memphis, Dallas, Colorado Springs, and Orlando?  For the brave souls who bleed purple will tell you it was/is a joke.  The biggest joke is the CIO, the Senior Vice Presidents, and the Vice Presidents, the most useless executives that the FedEx subsidiary could have assembled.  This management team should be dismantled and rebuilt.   Managing Directors and Managers should be terminated for three consecutive poor Pulse Survey Reviews.

My respect lies with the Chief Executive Officer like Fred W. Smith and Chief Financial Officer (CFO) Alan Graf and the grunts (Software Developers, Network Operations, Technical Writers, Networking Groups) within FedEx Services.  Everyone else is expendable.

pros: There is minimal effort required to keep your job. There is almost no pressure to work more than 40 hours a week, and your peers are not generally terribly competitive.
cons: Very little room for professional achievement / advancement unless you are interested in management or a facsimile thereof. There are a few ("advisor") positions which might have been used for technical advancement, but as managers have been free to simply offload their own duties onto those positions, they essentially become political junior management positions themselves.

review: I loved the job except numbers were more important that customer service.
pros: You can interact with different people everyday.  You are in your own truck all day without supervision most of the time.  You get a good workout while you work.  Time passes quickly because your always running to meet deadlines.  I never got bored because your too busy.  I got satisfaction by helping my customers. Pay and benefits were excellent.
cons: There is too much micro management while your in the station unloading and loading the freight.  We were pressures do always do more with less people.  Too much paperwork and goal to meet in numbers on paper.  Getting 100% wasnt good enough.  Get written up for the smallest thing.  They had unreasonable expectations with delivery and pickup stops per hour.  without considering traffic or distance between stops.  Had to work over 12 hours a day but managment expected you to only put down 12 hours and not be paid because DOT laws.  Always had to work 10 to 12 hours without any break just to meet their unrealistic goals.  I was told to loose customers who were filling my truck up with freight and to replace them with 10 customers shipping 1 package because it made the managers numbers look better and they got bigger bonuses. They would promise us big bonuses to get us to work harder and faster and work thru breaks and on our own time but when the time came would make some excuse why the company couldn't pay it. They thought we should just be thankful to have the jib because other people don't,  But the managers would get 12,000 bonuses for our hard work.  If you got hurt they were out to get rid of you because they could lose some of their monthly bonuses. Managers showed too much favortism.

pros: Great company, believe in People, Service, and Profits.. In the order. Very active in the local community and throughout the world, I am proud too say that I worked for FedEx.
cons: They have high level of expectations and  create some stressful situations. Also moving away from remote workers, while the rest of the world moves towards remote workers, FedEx is moving away from remote workers

pros: Great Company to work for flexalbe hours good pay with no experience I've only been working with the company over 3 months but I hope to grow with this company.
cons: It is not the cleanest environment It is very fast paste I don't feel like I have been trained enough to do my job.

pros: The fedex health benefits are fantastic and is one of the two reasons I stay with the company because they offer fulltime benefits to part time employees like me. The 2nd reason I stay with the company is to be able to transfer to other states with the company and work and live in a new place.
cons: Communication is terrible and getting help with different parts of the job is next to none from my manager. The pay is not the greatest either...very demanding and can be a high stress job. Must be able to be quick and multitask.

review: Great place to work for people whp are not high acheivers
pros:
Work/Life balance You can work from home, come late, leave early, go to the doctor without wasting vacation
What it does for the community
Diversity
Perks
Benefits
Job Security
Fun place to work
People
cons:
Some people have been there too long
Not innovative enough in some areas
There are some poor managers out there
Very slow to get things changed
Adoption of open source.
People & leadership development in IT

review: Great benefits for part time work
pros: Health benefits for part time employees.  The pay is comparable to competitors such as UPS.  Stable company with great brand recognition.
cons: Managers lack training on how to effectively deal with employees.  Many of middle management has been with Fed Ex for a long time and may not have the best skills or managment tools, but a good grasp of the business.

pros: Loved my job for most of the 23 yrs I was there. It used to be a family now its not anymore. I was a Courier. Loved my customers.
cons: They don't care about the people its all about the numbers and micro managing. Its very sad...If undercover boss ever came to a station they would be shocked. Its not the company it used to be :(

pros:
Gym / workout facility
Popcorn/coffee
March of Dimes campaign
cons:
Work Life balance lie.  
50 - 75% outsourced development (India).
Complete accountability for failures (or successes) of a team 10 timezones away with a huge cultural/language barrier.

I was only there for three years.  The last 18 months were horrible.  My prior employment was 14 years with same company so I don't like to jump ship.  Our rather small team lost 11 employees in 9 months, some with over a decade at FedEx.  Two were asked to work another weekend and they unpinned their badges and left without notice.  I saw my manager and a Project Manager cry over the hours and abusive treatment of the team.  It's even worse for our Indian counterparts.  It was so bad I'd never ship with FedEx again if I have a choice.  Last, don't count on the bonuses they promise.  I found them to be much less than advertised but it's what they sell you on in the interview for their below industry average salary offering.

review: Worked as a package handler. Hot warehouse work but not difficult.
pros: Instead of paying for a gym, work at a package warehouse and get an overall workout and get paid. Hours are short, 3 to 4 tops a day but there is always a chance to pick up another shift.
cons: Very hot, sometimes dirty. Minimal pay and short hours equal small checks. Everyone begins at the bottom and goes up from there. Much better environment and culture than UPS.

pros: Friendly, quick and easy interview
cons: Hr department is useless. I was given less than 24 hr notice for orientation and after 12 weeks of waiting for an orientation I gave up. There is only one individual that runs the orientation process and she is unable to comprehend that I just needed a day or two notice to rearrange my schedule to make it to orientation. She would always say she will call me right back and never did. She also could never even tell me when the next orientation might possibly be. It would be weeks between the orientations. Overall they made me reapply for the same position over and over and could not schedule me for orientation. They also expected people to be able to make a 10am orientation on a Day during the week when I was offered a job for a 4am-8am shift.

pros: Excellent company to work and some of the people there are very friendly and helpful and kind. The peoples that work at Fedex are team work and we help each other.  Good company to work for.
cons: In one prtectler and one department call Input weekend shift, the teamleader she didn't treat some of the new employee fair and equal. And she treat one person better then other person better than other one in there. (Favoritiasom)

review: Could be a lot better, could be a lot worse....
pros: As a courier, if you put in some time, you might get a decent route. I do, and it gives me some flexibility, and I get off at a decent time most days. Managers pretty much leave you alone. Pay is not too bad. You won't get rich, but you can pay the bills.
cons: Takes 15+ years to top out. Unless you are willing to move around, no real opportunity for advancement. Even then you have to jump through hoops. It's a corp., so a lot of red tape and b.s. You are a number in the grand scheme of things. Macro-managed at times. Unrealistic goals. Profit outweighs people, and service.

pros: Stable , People oriented company. i would recommed this company to other people who wants a stable and secure workplace. Not much pressure at work
cons: Career growth is very slow. Management try to treat people, whether you are working hard or not working, the same, that demotivates people who works really hard. Management need to consider this much better

review: Work life balance non existent for leadership
pros: Good stable company, good 401 k & vacation benefits. Company is always working hard at been the best in the market, adding services and technology.
cons: If you are in leadership, you are expected to work a lot of hours over 10 and literally walk through fire to be able to get promoted. They talk about safety as a priority but put their employees at risk expecting them to show up for work with 2 feet of snow outside. Also talk about work life balance but expect you to work 12 hour days.  Healthy benefits are the worst they ever been in 15 years.

pros: Outstanding benefits, seasoned drivers understand new team members will require help to learn all the details to perform their duty and willingly do so no questions asked. Holiday seasons overtime is always available.  Once your route becomes second nature you become immune to the demands you do your best and that‚Äôs all you can  do.
cons: Hitting the delivery times are difficult to sustain per the system driven requirements ‚Ä¶ real life road conditions and out dated mapping is an obstacle in itself.

review: Be aware of working for Fedex,do your research. It's easy just stop a Fedex courier,on the street anytime,anywhere!
pros:
Fedex start wage is fantastic but, this is how the company suckers people in.
Fedex benefits are great as well but, beware that this is another tactic to sucker people in.
cons: The downsides to working at Fedex is simple, they are great manipulators. They tell people what they want to hear but, do the complete opposite. All Fedex cares about is their reputation, and BRAND. They treat their frontline employee's aweful but, keep in mind that these are the people that make FEDEX very rich. Overall the company has made alot of money throughout the years,  now they over work their employee's, and company expections/goals are just unreasonable to achieve.

review: FedEx is a great company to work for.
pros: FedEx is a company that is a leader in the transportation Industry. FedEx offers great career advancement opportunity. Very good training and preparation for other job opportunites. Management is fair, but there tends to be a lot of gossip floating around in the inside sales offices. Travel benefits and shipping discounts are awesome. You really can't compete with FedEx when it comes to these kinds of perks.
cons: Politics and the gossip that goes around, and since the corporation is a large one the pay is not very good initially. It is a sacrifice initially for a long term career success.

pros: People Service Profit philosophy, prestigious name and well recognized company to work for. The benefits are great and the service provided to customers is second to none.
cons: As with any large company, can become a little political when looking for promotion opportunities. Although there are many great promote-from-within programs the company offers such as Aspire to Management, HR needs to do a better job of ensuring that fresh talent has a fair shot at being selected for vacancies.

review: One of the greatest companies and work cultures founded on a people service profit philosophy
pros:
One gets to work for one of the 3 major transportation majors in the world
Get to establish a good work-life balance
One of the largest IT spenders in the world
cons:
Projects generally takes a long time to implement (think multiple years!)
Not a nimble and agile company in terms of getting things done...if your looking to achieve a lot, this is not a place for you
So conservative in approach (from a legal standpoint), it actually hurts business

review: Fedex Courier driver, hard work but feels good.
pros: You get paid by the day, the faster you finished the sooner you go home. If you take care of your customers and drive safely then its like your the boss and everyone is happy.
cons: Not too many, its not a job for someone out of shape, apartments and some businesses can be a pain in the butt to find. If your a cover driver you will do many routes.

pros: Absolutely love my managers, (Lambardo & Erica). Very family oriented and accommodating company. Lots of little incentives and little competitions.
cons: The weather outside is the weather you work in. If it's hot, it's hot in warehouse. If it's cold, it's cold in warehouse. Not enough full time positions. Very physically demanding.

pros: Even at Part Time- you have the ability to work additional hours through the Ahead system and often come close to or past a 40 hour week. Especially during Peak. If your willing to work they are willing to pay. If you work a day that's not on your schedule it's time 1/2.
cons: Very difficult to find an open full time position. When the jobs do come available, there's usually several people with more time in than you bidding.

pros: Fast paced amd my co-workers and bosses are easy to get along with.
cons: The heat is terrible , it would be alittle more bearile if there was a fan in my work area.

pros:
Great Benefits - one of the best insurance packages around, lots of incentives for taking care of your heath and discounted gym memberships
Stable Company
Growth Opportunities
cons:
would be great to have more opportunities to shadow and learn about other departments for tea members who maybe unsure about their next career steps
slow to resolve IT issues, even though we have an internal IT team it often takes a long time to resolve simple IT issues

pros: FedEx cares about their people and they make every effort to come through even in tough times.  FedEx is a large company with lots of opportunities and awesome brand recognition.  Amazing focus on work life balance!
cons: Salaries are slightly lower than market but the job security and people service profit lifestyle really makes up for that!  Satellite locations may have lesser opportunities.

pros: FedEx was a great company to work for, plenty of resources available to compensate their employees.  A lot is expected of you physically to work in this position, and it all needs to be done quickly, but you are rewarded for your hard work.
cons: Working at the ramp in Austin, TX, the summer months are tough, the warehouse is hot, working on an aircraft is hot, but your body gets used to it. Like with any work place, there is miscommunication that leads to extra work needing to be done which is often frustrating.

pros: Good pay and a fairly good bonus package.
cons: Horrible Management and dishonest Human Resources Department. They shared confidential and privileged information on a EEOC complaint that was filed against those who the complaint was about   Those accused Managers retaliated and nothing could stop them. Filing more complaints resulted in complete dishonesty and falsification on FedEx's HR Department.  This needs to be investigated by the Justice Department . Documented facts have now been given to attorneys in two other lawsuits against FedEx.  I will continue to pursue this as I am currently a FedEx stock holder and will take this public. In Utah it is legal to have a secret recording device. I have more than several recordings of FedEx Management making illegal comments.   I would suggest anyone having Management issues with FedEx middle Management take a recording device into any and all meeting with those Managers. Protect  yourself  and if you have issues file with the Justice Department.

pros: Company has provided extensive training and tools to help me become a better professional.  Great benefits and fantastic tuition reimbursement program.  Employer is great to provide flexible hours while getting your education.
cons: The pay is not the greatest.  Pay increases are minimal.  With a Bachelors degree and over 10+ years of experience, I'm getting ready to leave due to $39K a year.  Not meeting my financial needs, but I will certainly miss the company.

review: Great job if you just do it
pros: Absolutely love the job and the company. It is physically demanding at times and just mentally demanding enough to keep things from getting boring. Basically show up on time, do your job, and get paid without any of the typical BS associated with other jobs. Fantastic especially if you have another job during the day.
cons: Only con I have is some employees like to whine. Ignore them and just do your job.

pros: Health benefits are reasonable and inexpensive.
cons: FedEx managers sit in their air conditioned offices while the slaves work in 90+ degree heat in the warehouse; the use of 'Team Leaders' as their gestapo is demeaning. They are not management but think and act like they are especially with their radios on loudly they are intimidating.  The senior employees strut around like rockstars and don't work.  You can tell the slackers from the workers  by their weight. Most millennials love the job because of the short hours and 'getting paid to work out'' attitude...did I mention that safety is a joke; it's very easy to get hurt by fast moving freight coming down the chutes or by hotdogging forklift drivers... Sunday hours suck (8pm to 230AM) and you work your tail off from clockin to clockout.  You get one FedEx T shirt as a uniform.  Sort management easily gets overwhelmed if there are delays in the operation....which happens alot in the freight world.  Inexperience abounds. If you live in your parents' basement, this is the job for you !!

review: Frontline Employees are not happy at FedEx
pros: It's a steady job.All I can think of
cons: The numbers,you are inundated with numbers,go faster,work harder but the pay never catches up to the work. Different parts of the state make different amounts according to cost of living but the cost of living has drastically gone up but Fedex still hasn't done anything about it. You have satisfied employees but they are not front-line employees,no matter what you do at Fedex the public recognizes the Drivers for Fedex no one else.15 years it takes to get to maximum pay at Fedex,UPS 36 months. When the Unions come into Fedex which they will,Fedex will have no one to blame but itself.

pros: Great Benefits, Company provides good training to mean job requirements, FedEx has a reputation for having a no-nonsense work environment where performance is constantly tracked, measured, and available to employee during annual review. All calls are recorded and may be monitored and graded by managers of other call centers reducing discrimination or favoritism.
cons: Little chance for meaningful promotion, Some performance (matrix) measurements are contrary to customer service. A focus on call time (for example) pressures employee to get off call regardless if customer issue has been resolved.

pros: Decent pay and benefits plenty of flex on your schedule, ok upward mobility.
cons: They brag on how they never laid anyone off all the time, and its true they just offer you an impossible job in another state.  Office politics are idiotic the higher you go.  If you have a good upper manager then you are golden but if they don't like you they will give you jobs that force you to quit or go to another shift.

review: Another "used to be a good place to work" company...
pros:
Insurance but as of 2015 because of Obamacare that benefit is gone...
Company has a small pension...
cons: PAY!  I have been with them for over 8 years and only those who have been around 17 or more years have competetive pay.  In 8 years I've gotten one raise for over 2% and as a company we had gone for 1.5 years with no raise at all...keep in mind this company does quite well.  Raises are not based on merit.  The formula changes every year with the majority getting 2% if at all.  New hires make very close to what an 8 year veteran does.  Dangerous Goods reps get no extra monies for the responsibility and are held accountable.  The management training program, for couriers who want to be a manager,  is a joke and it is done entirely on the candidates personal time...Fed Ex will not pay for any training or travel expenses. They are expert at taking an excellent employee and destroying that employees attitude!

pros: Good pay, friendships were easily made, team leaders were always friendly and caring of there workers. Good benefits and room for advancement .
cons: fast paced heavy lifting  for long periods of time. Managers could have been more helpful and thoughtful of their workers. Weird hours and times that we would start and finish work. Never had enough help on the shift so the workers working that particular shift had to work harder and do more than one activity.

pros: Strong company with a world-wide known name and reputation; all in all - a great place to start one's career or reinforce one's CV with. Very strong operations, planning and IT units with a variety of internal development programs and training courses, shall it be required, highly professional teams.
cons: As often in large companies, decisions may take a while to be made, usually much bureaucracy involved into anything that has to do with back office operations. Career opportunities are not as high as expected - much tasks are now being shifted to India & Poland, outsourced.

review: The compensation and benefits package are very good, benefits better than most
pros: The compensation and benefits package are very good, benefits better than most.  The company has good core motives and does a lot for charity.   There's a tuition assistance program that can pay for almost everything except parking and books.  The mail order prescription plan can save you tons of money.  There are airline discounts for regular part time and fulltime employees as well as many other discounts available.   You can get a workout on the job while getting paid--because much of the entry level work is physical.  We call it being an industrial athelete!
cons: The current high oil prices have me considering other employ, because of the negative affect it has had on other airlines recently.  FedEx is heavily aircraft driven, which gives the cause for my concern.  Upper management can be out of touch with lower level employees.  The shiftwork can be demanding on family and social lives because FedEx is a 24 hour company.  There are opportunities for advancement, but it may mean taking part-time work for a while in order to get a better full-time job.

pros: Best location in Memphis, TN to work as an IT professional.  Atmosphere is very casual.  Basically, employees can do what they want, but that isn't always a good thing.  Employees never feel too greatly pressured.  Most management is very hands off.  Company offers a very good balance between work and life.  If you have a sick child, take off.  No questions.  If you have a family emergency, take off.  No questions asked.
cons:
Compensation is good for the area but not on par with other world class companies.
Benefits are sub-par for a company with 500K+ employees.
Senior/Executive Management is pathetic.
Lots of employees take advantage of the relaxed atmosphere and don't get their work done and it falls to other people.  The folks doing the extra work don't get compensated accordingly and the folks not doing the work don't get "punished".

review: Overall I enjoy going to work everyday.
pros: Great Pay, Great Benefits, and good people. Fedex Ground is one the best companies to work for in the world. Great chance for advancement if you work hard for it.
cons: Limited growth at some locations. Can be stressful during the peak season of Christmas. Long hours during the Xmas season. Filling in and being on call once you get higher up.

review: Great place to work...if you want to settle down for good
pros: The benefits and work-life balance is terrific.  The work environment is great.  Attrition is very low and hence job security is high.  If you are planning to start a family and want a secure job with good benefits and work-life balance, this is a great place to work.  Even though the salaries are not flamboyant, considering the job location is in Memphis, down South one can save a lot of money as the cost of living is quite low compared to the West or East coast.
cons: From a technical standpoint, if you are a software engineer and have aspirations in designing new technology and producing mind boggling innovations, forget it.  This place is terrible in software innovation.  To get something done, like getting a new laptop or even hardware infrastructure, it takes a loooong time....well, its down South :)  Like any job in the world, yes this job can also get monotonous.  But the opportunities to make it exciting and interesting....very little.  Lots of bureaucracy (which comes into picture with bigger workforce), lots of red tape and loads of meetings for planning other meetings....Yep, this place is just like Dilbert cartoons.  Sometimes I think Scott Adams worked in this place.  And if you are single or a young couple, trying to get a lot out of the city where you live, forget it.  Memphis has very little to offer except the Blues.

pros:
FedEx is a diverse company with a lot of opportunities.  My experience is at Express as a driver and manager for many years.  Couriers can make a decent living wage.  The job is physically demanding but rewarding for those who refuse to sit at a desk.  Couriers are not required to have college experience, but can make comparable wages.  The culture is good, though seems to be less customer centered as time goes on.  If you like to move around FedEx has the ability for couriers to transfer to any other available positions in other stations/cities.  Great if you want to see lots of places.  

As far as management, it was a good job as well.  Comp is fair, but not highly performance based.   It's the type of job that uses the same skills every day, but no two days are alike.  Managers have some flexibility as far as their schedules.  Once your team has launched and all is well, you can go on road and spend time one-on-one with employees, which is fun.  Peak is a pain and 2 straight months of 55 hours weeks, depending on where you live though, they great summers can efficiency of the FedEx machine make up for it.
cons:
Pay for performance is very poorly done at FedEx.  New employees likely start at the same wages their peers are making after having been there for several years.  Its not equitable and creates a lot of resentment in the workforce that's hard to overcome.  Due to route structures, bidding, seniority, there is a lot of entitlement among the employees as well.  Essentially they reward the most experienced, best drivers with the easiest routes and schedules pushing the harder work on the newbies (and even after 5-10 years, you might still be a newbie with the amount of tenure in the workforce).

As a manager, your roles are so specialized because FedEx is so huge, that you are constantly pigeon holed into positions that don't offer continued growth.  You have to be aware of that and work your way through it if you want to move up.  Too, there is a terrible misalignment of goals to hit unrealistic numbers.  What happens in the Company makes their plan, the EVPs divided it up (leaving a little in their back pockets)... then the RVPs hang on to a little extra... then the division guys do it, too so eventually the stations end up with FTE goals that are impossible to hit.  You burn out your people and everything is negative because your station cant reach the target, meanwhile the roll up numbers are just fine and your employees could have been celebrating their good work.  Just a lot of misaligned incentives at "good ol boy" FedEx.

pros: This company provides excellent benefits and retirement options as soon at your start state which is unheard of in this industry. They also have 401k and a pension, also unheard of in today's business world. The work expectations are reasonable and job support is there if you need it.
cons: There are not many options for upward mobility which is common in company's this size.

pros: Professional atmosphere.  Depending on the management, you are not micro-managed; however you do have to communicate well and often the status of your projects as you would expect. If you have a capable manager you will thrive. Somewhat flexible on start and end times and lunch break if your circumstances need some flexibility. Some allow you to come in a little earlier than others and leave a little early or come in a little later and leave a little later as long as it overlaps what most consider a normal day. Pay and benefits are good though maybe not excellent. Still have an opportunity to move up or around in the company (though not as easy as it was at one time). If you get on a good team (good managers and co-workers) it is still a good place to work and I would recommend it.
cons: True to most jobs, your manager and management team determines your success, or lack thereof, so pray for a good one! it is not as easy to move around in the company as it once was. Reorgs happen from time to time and can be ok or not depending on who you end up working for.   Need to be good at office politics.  Benefits are not as good as they once were but not sure how they compare with other companies. Out of pocket expenses can be high initially and for medical procedures. Pay is usually not as high because benefits were ONCE good enough to balance it out. Now that FedEx is so big and has been around so long the people philosophy it was founded on is not shown like it once was but it is still a good working environment for the most part. Incompetent managers look for scape goats but that's not something that just happens here....it can happen anywhere.

review: FedEx has blessed me with a rewarding career and opportunities I wouldn't have received elsewhere!
pros: Beyond a team environment, the culture at FedEx is like my extended family. Strong leadership and a management philosophy that puts employees first. Excellent healthcare benefits and college tuition reimbursement opportunities! And more importantly FedEx supports and provides employees opportunities to give back and support local communities!
cons: I don't have any complaints; after 23 years I still look forward to getting up and going to work every morning!

review: Loved the job, had issues with management styles
pros: Great part time job, enjoyed the different projects you get to learn and do. Good pay. Good benefits.
cons: Not crazy about the training process. When you hire 6+ people all at once and have different trainers, you don't actually know what they have actually been told. So you may not know something and they don't know where you are at in training until it's too late. Some of the trainers are also very angry and only know swearing and yelling.

review: Fedex Express is a great place to work
pros: Great benefits, good pay, and self satisfaction. I work with great people and they always find a way to help me out if I need it.
cons: This job can be stressful when it comes to getting your packages out on time. A lot of stuff to learn in a short period of time.

review: Great place for those looking for a good work/life balance and a reasonable benefits/compensation package.
pros: Someone looking for a company that strongly embraces a good work / life balance and is looking to be compensated reasonably.
cons: Compensation mechanisms are limited simply due to the sheer size of the company. Lots of red tape tends to get in the way of getting real work done and limits true innovation.

review: Great company that takes care of their employees.
pros: Very strong culture of putting employees first so they take good care of the customers after which profits follow so they can afford to pay for high quality employees.  IT uses the latest technologies and has strong vendor relationships for good support.  Senior management is very supportive of IT because they understand the company runs on IT.
cons: Most opportunities in IT are in Memphis, TN - especially if you want to advance in management.  Dallas, Orlando, and Colorado Springs offer good opportunities for first line managers.

pros: The training is very intense, you come into your job knowing FedEx in and out.  Flexible work schedule. Good starting salary. They put a lot of time and effort into understanding that you are an employee and not a number.  Acting as a consultant instead of a sales professional.
cons: Very limited opportunities for advancement without moving. Collaboration with different internal contacts can be difficult.

review: Despite the challenges, I enjoyed working there.
pros:
Will make you physically fit.
Feels like a real job; you are needed and your role is serious.
Straight forward. Get to work, do your job and leave at the end of your shift and you're paid extra if work is extra; no BS.
cons:
3am shift made concentration in class almost impossible no matter how early I tried to sleep beforehand.
work is actually very hard and tiring and will make you tired the rest of the day.

pros: A world wide respected organization, great benefits, fair treatment by management,  great team atmosphere, loved working there.
cons: Customer Service department can be ineffective at resolving issues and then the sales team ends up being the customer service team and therefore not selling. Payroll increases are kept in check and no one really gets ahead financially; however, benefits are great. Promotions are hard to obtain even if you are a high performer.

pros:
Very Flexible in just about everything they offer, including benefits, time off and other perks.  Employee Discount shipping.  

Everyone at FedEx from the top to the bottom is committed to pursuing the purple promise, "I will make every FedEx Experience outstanding".  Its that shared pursuit that makes this a great place to work.  Everyone carries their own weight and everyone is willing to lend a helping hand.
cons: Since its such a large company, it takes a lot of time and energy to amke changes.

review: Any CEO that takes a 20% voluntary pay cut for his employees and the company is doing the right thing.
pros: Great benefits, medical, and company culture.  401K match, and where else can you get a Portable Pension Account?  Most places after you leave your pension is gone.  The people and management are outstanding from the front lines up to upper management.
cons: There's been a few times that negative news has not trickled down as fast as I would have liked it to.

pros: The culture of "Living PSP", which stands for People, Service, Profit, has been revived in this company over the last year. There is a great sense of ownership amongst the employees, and FedEx is Constantly finding ways to keep it self on the "Best Places to Work in America" list. The opportunity for lateral job moves within the company is almost endless, as every Development is highly encouraged. work function is represented, and professional
cons: FedEx needs to improve its salary and bonus offering in order to retain talent and remain competitive.

review: The company is very involved, warm and personable with it's employees as well as it's clients.
pros: The company is loyal and an asset to it's employees especially with the economy climbing out of debt.  As long as you  give them your best you have a job.
cons: Patience is a must, must and a willing spirit to be successful on the job because you literally represent the company and it's reputation. If you look bad they look bad.

pros: I suppose there must be some. Most employees seem to be driven by the difficulty of finding another job in Memphis and a desire to stay there.
cons: Everyone I encountered at FedEx was kind and helpful and, with a very few exceptions, utterly inept. The FedEx version of innovation is to learn a new set of buzzwords, talk as though you were proceeding, and do absolutely nothing.

pros:
-awesome benefits, even for pt employees
-competitive pay when compared with industry rivals
-good balance between work and private life
cons:
-upper management seems to think they are very smart, in the case of the region where I worked, they were not.

-making changes that were detrimental to our operations and the equipment we needed.

pros: Great benefits and a great company that supports its part time employees. The part time employees in the Hub are the heart of the company and Fed Ex does everything they can to keep them employed.
cons: The greatest con to being a part time employee are the hours. The easiest job to get at Fed Ex is a material handler during the night shift. This job makes it very difficult to get college done which makes it difficult to further your career.

pros: Excellent group of people. Great teamwork . Opportunities to move up the ladder. Medical and dental premiums are very low. Very generous with floater days and vacation time.
cons: Very low pay. Isolated location. Not many celebrations. Most of the companies I worked for,  the boss would bring donuts or pastries. Treat us to lunch once in awhile. FedEx Trade very rarely does this.

pros: fedex has pretty good job security due to the fact it is in the transportation industry and therefore will always be needed to keep the economy gooing, also the pay is good for what I do
cons: working in a call center there tends to be a lot of micro managing going on, also I work in a high volume call center where I take in over 100+ calls per day

review: good place to work for with very limited upward mobility
pros:
great company with a good business model
great benefits in terms of discounted shipping and airline discounts
culture is friendly
cons:
opportunity for growth is very limited. You will get promoted based on who and not what you know.
performance evaluation is a joke. No real reward for being a star performer.

pros: Friendly environment, opportunities to move up, and many benefits (Ex: discount on cell service, shipping with FedEx, schooling, etc.).
cons: Training could be longer, but you will learn a lot in a short amount of time. Don't be afraid to ask questions once out of training. Time-off is based on a first-come first-serve request. Must travel to work even in harsh weather conditions (heavy snow storms), and work on major holidays.

review: What a great company to work for!
pros: The pros are that you can move up in the company if you really work hard.  Also the incentives of being able to get discount shipping, being able to fly on interline rates are wonderful.  FedEx offers a great benefits plan and its the ideal company for a young person just starting out!
cons: Company is outsourcing to vendors who do not understand English that well therefore it makes the job harder for their co workers...Ground contracts out to outside vendors who dont hold up to the standards of what FedEx used to be

pros: Great work environment with lots of freedom to make your own schedule. Managers were available when needed and I was able to shadow BSF employees.
cons: I really had no cons with the job. However, I would make sure you understand that this job requires meeting new people and knocking on doors. You have to be aggressive and not afraid of bringing in new business.

review: Co. needs to step up with pay increases
pros:
Tuition reimbursment
Opportunity to change jobs and / or careers within the company
HQ in a city with low cost of living
cons:
Salary increases very limited for those that prefer to remain in non-managment positions.
No apparent effort by management to retain effective employees (counter offers, vacation days, etc.)
Very bureaucratic - too much red tape in processes

review: It is a good company to work for
pros: FedEx paid a good and competitive salary, the benefit are one of the best I have encountered. It is definitely a place I will recommend others to work at.
cons: Our schedule depend on the weather; because the jet cannot land or take off during bad weather in the winter, we'll have to wait for hours sometimes. This shift our starting and ending time

pros: Flexibility, ability to move do various parts of the company and country.  Great people to work around and there is an ability to go places professionally that one normally wouldn't have an opportunity to otherwise.
cons: The shifts can be cumbersome and one often feels exhausted.  Sometimes there can be a lot of favoritism and nepotism.

review: Very good got fired 2 times but pretty sure if i were to apply again they would hire me in a heart beat.
pros: Great pay. If you in college this might be a great part time. Might be a lil too much for females. People is great.
cons: heavy work. You will come out dirty as hell. Not suitable for a girly girl.

review: Great for supplementary income if you're physically up for it
pros: Wages are nice. Hours are very early, which leaves the rest of the day. Excellent benefits if you're a student.
cons: Hours are early. Can be very physically demanding depending on the season (e.g. holidays). Buildings were unheated/uncooled, so it can be pretty brutal depending on the season.

pros: Paycheck is always in the bank
cons:
They tell you you own your routes.  Then a couple years later they tell you you don't own anything.
    They demand we make our drivers employees yet they don't give us money to cover workers comp insurance.
    The demand we put electronic logs in the trucks.  They didn't give us any money to cover the equipment cost or monthly fees.
     Now they want cameras in the trucks.  No money is being given to cover the costs once again.

review: I believe this company is an amazing company to work for. You are never bored and are always pushed to do better!
pros: Great benefits! I am never bored, love my job, and get great tuition reimbursement for my schooling.
cons: Very fast paced and challenging. If you aren't going hard worker and willing to get a little dirty, then this is not the job for you!

pros: there really arent any pros. Nothing is provided by the contractors except uniforms if you are lucky enough to get the right sizes, there is no weight limit on packages and most contractors make you deliver 75+ pound packages without help which in turn puts drivers at risk of injury and then by chance you do hurt yourself the contractor or franchisee gets mad and makes it seem like youre at fault despite it being recommended that for certain soze and weight packages there should be a "team lift". The terminals are a complete mess, nothing is smooth or efficient. I honestly do not know how this place hasnt gone out of business the CEO and owner/founder are your typical run of the mill greedy corporation. I left a well paying job because i hought to myself oh hey driving around all day and making decent money would be fun....boy was i wrong!! My advice to anyone wanting to do this job...DONT!!!
cons: Long hours, garbage salary, work in blizzards and hurricanes, no benefits

review: Was fired after I called that I couldn‚Äôt make it to a class
pros: I loved the job great company good pay great people great benefits just a fun place to work
cons: I got fired after I called and said I wouldn‚Äôt be able to make a tug class the manager got fired right after I got fired I don‚Äôt know why.

pros: From the perspective of a financial analyst who worked most recently at the World Head Quarters, managers were vary fair & balanced.
cons: The outfit is so big that it can be very difficult for talented employees to be recognized, and move-up the corporate food chain.

pros:
Full Medical Benefits PPO Cigna $80/mo for family no spouse
401K 107% Employer Match
I have not since worked for a company with similar benefits.
Paid time off and sick days were paid to you if not used at the end of the year, they were not taken from you with out compensation.
75%+ interline discounts on flights with most airlines.
Promote from within, you can take a test and attain a management position without a college degree.
Because they have many locations you can arrange internally to fill positions elsewhere, easy to relocate.
cons:
Like every work place you have to be careful of conflicting personalities. 
Manager spitefully mailed my final check after the check could not be cashed. I am talking about a year after I left. Still never got me payment, I have called them about it no return calls. 
Hard to find internal contact information.

pros: Good people to work with, good customers. Respected brand. Good benefits and relatively comprehensive. Decent training. Great dispatch team (courier support).
cons: Crap shoot on getting a truck for pm routes. More vehicles with 200-300k miles than not. Pay is okay. Management finds it easier to hand out 'demerits' than praise for job well done. Line managers overworked and perpetually stressed. Track all of our time but we're given a list of accepted times for each activity and expected to use those not actual. High turnover amongst couriers. Trucks maintained better than people. Use too many UHauls instead of company branded trucks.

pros: I am glad working in the FedEx Corporate. The work-life balance is pretty good. There are a lot of learning and growth opportunities. It has a good caring culture, very nice teammates, and a clear career path.
cons: I get mad on the bureaucracy, if you have any new ideas, you need to report to your boss, and he or she needs to report to his or her boss, and the boss's boss report up again. When you get approval from the highest level, your idea might loose the value.

pros: Very employee friendly, great culture. Employees are top-notch in their field. Competitive but friendly culture at the same time.
cons:
Since very few people leave, promotions are very few. For any positions that open, there are sometimes 20+ internal candidates for same position. This is inspite of the 'promote from within' policy that is followed for manager positions and above. 
Management of some of the larger projects can be done much better

review: FedEx is the size of a small country so has a bit of everything
pros: Truly embrace diversity. Never have to worry about senior executives doing something unethical or them blowing your pension. They actually do try to provide work life balance unlike some other corporations.
cons: Ginormous bureaucratic organization that takes forever to execute initiatives due to siloed approaches and focus on process instead of results.

review: Success is not a destination, but a journey! FedEx Ground has helped me pave a clear path on my journey to success.
pros: Competitive compensation, bonuses, tuition reimbursement, medical insurance, great stock options, Aggressive 401K plans, very diverse work environment.
cons: Long hours for salaried management.

review: A great environment with multiple opportunities to grow
pros:
They focus on individual development and recognition
Great team working environment.  Wonderful cross departmental collaboration
Benefits are first rate
Compensation on par with other major companies.  Love the yearly bonus!
cons:
Some management is stuck in micromanagement and strangle creativity.
HR does not really represent the employee.  They protect the interest of management.
Some employees were treated harshly when mistakes were made

pros: Flexible Hours, Good People, Interesting and Challenging Work, Fair Management
cons: Under market in pay scales (utilize wide, broad base pay bands that can result in massive differences in pay within the same job code), extremely difficult to move into management roles, and behind on diversity.

pros: Benefits are great. Training is provided through your career. The company is very competitive. You don't have to worry about losing your job due to outsourcing. The company grows year over year.
cons: The work is extremely demanding, very physical. Conditions are subject to the weather. You have to schedule all your vacation at the beginning of the year. The peak season is demanding.

pros: Reliable work, ok pay, cool co workers, no body breathing down your neck every 5 seconds.  You get to meet some nice people
cons: Too much work, no benefits, managers have no respect for drivers time.  I lose about 30 or 40 dollars a week waiting to be dispatch due to incompetent warehouse workers. Contractors as well. They dump responsibility on other drivers by adding more stops to your route because someone calls out.  When your salary pay, many things are in favor of wasting your time.

review: It used to be a fun place to work, not so much anymore!
pros: I enjoy seeing people each day and seeing that they are satisfied with the FedEx service. Some times that can be difficult.
cons: The fact that management will not allow us to take out  (2nd day and express saver)Tuesday and Wednesday Packages on Monday, but we are forced to take 2nd day and express saver packages out the rest of the week. This is all done to make it "look" like Monday is a light volume day!

review: Great people and place, just wrong time
pros: Everyone there in/out of audit were great.  I loved the work environment.
cons: After almost 6 years my salary was noty much higher when I started (mostly bc of economy) and opportunities seemed to have dried up.  Couldn't survive on that amount with a family and play the waiting game.

review: Strong Company, Great Culture, Will learn a lot!
pros: Work-Life Balance is great. Training is good, and continual. Flex time is available at most sales office locations. Strong Company with a great reputation in the industry,
cons: Sales is moving towards more of a customer service role. The control over your own territory is being removed from the sales professional.

pros: Initial support as expected.  Answers phones and attempts to resolve customer complaints.  Customer support at the front lines are really trying.   Protocol should work.... And does to a point.
cons: Support passes more difficult cases (property damage incurred by drivers) up to management for claims.   Claims are pushed to near fraudulent insurance companies endorsed by corrupt leadership within.   Customers with legitimate claims are fed to the nearest exit in an attempt that the customer will ultimate give up their claim.      More money for us I suppose.    FedUp w/ FedEx

review: Working at Fed Ex Ground as a package handler
pros: There are no customers in the warehouse so you dont have to deal with anybody but your fellow coworkers. Also, it is pretty much a paid workout and wS ill get you into shape.
cons: There is a decent amount of heavy lifting and you will be very sore. The warehouse is dirty so your clothes will get dirty and you will get black dirt in your nose when you clean it out after work.

pros: Great work atmosphere. Coworkers are helpful and it is a team environment. Good, physical workout, fast paced. Safety is first priority.
cons: Early morning shifts, as early as 3:45 to as late as 4:15. A struggle to get 20 hours a week.

review: Its time to start trimming the fat and go on a diet fueled by meritocracy
pros: Work Life balance and no lay-off policy
cons: It feels you are working for the Federal Government not Federal Express

review: FedEx is a great place to work
pros: The pay and benefits are great at FedEx. The employees are treated as the heart of the company and that is the way it should be.
cons: The handler position is hard labor. It takes hard work and a motivated person to complete this job correctly. Must know that it will not be a cake walk.

pros: Great company to Intern with. Intern Program is well put together. Software Development Teams are very knowledgeable and helpful. Interns are given Actual Important Software Projects to work on/complete. FedEx Services defiantly looks to hire their Interns first, for full-time employment (after college graduation). Everyone is very nice. Corporate Campus included Basketball courts, Volleyball Courts, and a Work Out Gym.
cons: There really are no cons from my experience. Interns were even allowed to take unpaid vacation days if they wanted to.

review: Great Company, good benefits, lots of changes
pros: The benefits are good, the company has a great reputation, the values are there. Currently undergoing alot of work force changes.
cons: The perks that were once available are not anymore.  Sometimes it feels that the company is beginning to forget the individuals and it is all about the bottom line.  The benenfits are declining and are not as good as they once were.

pros: Still one of the best employers in Memphis. Pay is not the greatest. Currently have a manager that understands work/life balance. Overall glad I am working here.
cons: Not much room for advancement. Hiring managers do not want to recognize your skills and talents that you have successfully proven at other companies.

pros: The pay is good, support is amazing.  Peo Pl let are always willing to step up to help in any way.
cons: Be ready to work insane hours.  And be ready to listen to every complaint possible.  And be ready to barely see your family.

pros:
great benefits!

Overall the actual job is not difficult if you're willing to work hard and can actually lift the 75lbs the say the require.
cons:
hours are minimal.. Part time and your lucky to get 20hrs a week during most of the year, the exception in the month of December.

no flexibility in the schedule. 

both of these tend to cause a high turn over rate so there for your short staffed A LOT.

pros: Lots of opportunity, tuition reimbursement, broad selection of lateral and promotion movement availability, excellent people-centered culture, only the best managers, competitive salary and benefits, job security.
cons: There is very little downside that I can articulate to working with FedEx. I have been with the company since I was 18 years old (am now 33), and they have continued to provide opportunity to growth and development, as well as support to my pursuit of higher education.

review: Overall, A Good Company to Work For
pros: Great corporate culture.  I don't think I ever met anyone at the company who didn't take pride in being able to say that they worked for FedEx.
cons:
The time it took to deliver new products and services to market was too long.  This was due in large part to a heavy reliance on legacy technology platforms. Seldom did we have a first mover advantage.
Plenty of opportunity to move laterally in your career, but to few opportunities to move upward. 
Compensation & Benefits: Base pay was good.  Bonus was up and down depending on the company's performance vs. the overall economy.  Retirement plan needed some work; company match into the 401k left a lot to be desired.

pros: It was a job and consistent
cons: I don't know where to begin!!!! I worked as a driver for "ground" and it was I'm a nut shell modern day slaverery. You are paid salary and work around 9 to 10 hrs daily but are only compensated for about 8 when you do the math... Giving the time you need to take to organize your truck and refuel/ wash which your contractor has you do... Management treats as guilty till proven inocent and with no benifits of any kind  being just some of the problems there yeah it's a $hitty place to work!!! But because the main post is someone a bit more up in the corporate latter of course things are peachy.... But I invite that same person to come work as a "ground" driver and see how great fedex is.... Oh yeah the "express" guys get everything you don't cause they're "real" employees and they're job is of "real" value..... Screw FedEx I'll never use their service!!!!!

review: Great benefits, but that is where it ends
pros: Great befits working for this company. Plethora of benefits including 401K match, pension plan, affordable healthcare, vision, dental and a laundry list of perks. All benefits are included for part time employees as well. There is opportunity for growth in other areas of the company.
cons: Time off is limited since it is based on seniority. So if you have a planned vacation for a specific week and someone else that has been there longer has chosen the same week, you are out of luck. Even when one tries to call out sick, management tries to push back to have you come in while you are sick. Compensation does not reflect the amount of work that is done. Employees are overworked.

review: Worst Job I've Ever Had In My Life
pros: The only thing that made working at this place worthwhile was the manager I had the first two weeks I was there. After he was permanently switched to a different shift things started to go downhill.
cons: Working conditions are absolutely horrendous. They stick you in a trailer for 4-5 hours by yourself while you struggle to lift 100 lb. boxes and place them on to a rusty conveyor belt because they're too cheap to get new equipment. The turnover rate is extremely high. Managers will get on your case for not emptying trailers fast enough meanwhile they're riding around in golf carts.

pros: Always changing to stay ahead and always looking to expand and buy other companies to compliment all Opcos.
cons: Salaried employees have no work life balance. Salespeople do not get vacation. If you choose to take days off, the time is not adjusted and you have to make up the  face to face calls.

pros: Excellent pay and benefits.  Very active training organization.
cons: Constant stress related to deadlines and making budget monthly.

pros: It is not the worst place to work in Memhis.
cons: Retirement package, vision, medical, dental, work rules, management team, corporate greed.........

review: Wonderful place to work and learn new skills!
pros: They help pay for up to $3,000 in school tuition. Also, there are many opportunities to move up within the company.
cons: Upper management isn't always around, and there are may times where workers are left on their own to handle situations.

review: Solid hours, not so solid schedule
pros: If you work here, you will start as a package handler like everyone else, and you will not have issues getting hours. There is paid vacation/holidays and medical benefits after a certain number of hours worked, as well.
cons: The schedule can change with almost no notice, so if you work part time you will need to leave time beforehand and afterward in case they decide to start the next sort as much as an entire hour early or if you are expected to run late.

pros: Great Benefits, co-workers were amazing. The mix of technology and customer service were the perfect blend to make all of our customers happy.
cons: The amount of work you have to do when covering for another is hard to provide what we promise.

pros: Working on or around aircraft was awesome. MD-10 & MD-11, Airbus, small engine, 727. Great group of men and woman, camaraderie was great, everyone looked out for each other slightly dangerous job, but loved every minute; who doesn't love the smell of jet fuel. lol
cons: Worked early hours, but it is expected and you get used to it. Working conditions, you know the saying rain, hail, sleet or snow the mail has to go. The only time we stopped production due to lightening.

pros: Not that many pros,
cons: I have worked at Fedex Trade Networks for 2 years, my customer performance reviews were excellent from the customers themselves which they have written to me that I have done a great job. However, internally, supervisors were not helpful, always blamed their own employees, a complete lack of teamwork, with low pay, and no growth for advancement. Everyone is to themselves. It is to my understanding that all managers should help their employees in creating success and a vision for the company. But ALL is absent, very tragic and shameful for the role as "Management", They claim "Fedex Cares" but to what extent? Is it only for a show to the public?? Out of the years that I have worked with Fedex, the work atmosphere is hostile, intimidating and gloomy for all the employees. Compared with the shooter from what has occurred in Orlando, I don't know who is worse.

pros: Benefits are great. I loved being able to utilize the college reimbursement program while I was in school. The team I was placed with there was very well managed. Bonuses.
cons: Work-Life Balance is off when working grave yard shift. Hard to work your way up outside from Handler position. Most of hire up  positions work solely by seniority.

review: Couriers take big financial hit with frozed traditional pension.
pros: Its a physical job and it keeps the body in shape and you are outdoors making the day go by fast.  You get to see different things every day.  It keeps you sharp with your driving skills.
cons: The pay is way behind the main competitor United Parcel Service.  The benefits are awful at best with very expensive medical coverage.  There is limited job security here as we are at will employees.  The company keeps takings benefits and pay away and we have no recourse and now they have frozen out traditional pension plan in favor of a portable plan that pays much less

review: Certainly is a best place to work!!
pros: FedEx is an excellent company that REALLY does care about their employees. If you apply yourself there are plenty of career opportunities available and plenty of professional development opportunities as well. Work/life balance is encouraged and supported by all levels of management. The people I work with are professional, caring and always work to get the job done right.
cons: It is a large company and does have a lot of complexity.

pros: There is a wide range of responsibilities that allow for professional growth within the company.  Management genuinely cares about the success of their employees, and gives you the tools to complete the job.
cons: The cons of working with FedEx are that there is CONSTANT change, and mediocre salaries.  It can be a challenging company to work for due to the high demand, but also rewarding to those that work hard.

review: Looking For A Sales Career~Do Not Work Here
pros:
Unfortunately, FedEx has changed a great deal over the course of the last several years. Unfortunately, the cons outweigh the pros.  If you are thinking that it is a blessing to have a job in this tight economy maybe you will look at the pros.  A sales career is not an ideal position for any college graduate looking to advance with this corporation. Let's look at the pros of a sales career at FedEx.

1) Flexiability - but this is true of sales professions at many corporations across America.

2) Stability- If you work for FedEx in a sales role (like UPS), it is highly unlikely that you will be laid-off.  Sales people are revenue driving force in the organization. FedEx and UPS (I have worked for both) recognize this; therefore, it is unlikely you will lose your job due to the economy.

3) Overall, FedEx has a good insurance package. The dental is not competitive. You can purchase a better dental insurance package from an outside company that offers a better plan and the same cost or a little less.

4) FedEx is one of the few companies offers their employees a pension. The organization is reinstating the 401K match. It was suspended during the recession.

5) FedEx does not like to lay-off employees. Unfortunately, the economy has caused some lay-offs. However, FedEx does so when the organization has no other option.  Compared to many companies, layoffs have been very low during the recession.  In this respect, FedEx does care about their employees.
cons:
Working as a field Account Executive at FedEx is a low-paying thank less job.   The salary would be fair if you were working a 40-45 hour a week job.  If you are going to be an effective sales person by hitting your numbers and closing new business, you will work long hours.  This might not be a problem if you are compensated for your efforts. 

Also, the job does not really require that an individual work as long if management allowed their employees to manage their time effectively to get the tasks completed to get new packages ‚Äúon the belt.‚Äù  There is a lot of administrative work. The FedEx internal systems are low and outdated. If the sales employees were hourly, I am certain that the organization would work on streamlining many of their internal processes to save their employees time and to make the job easier. 

FedEx does not believe that their sales people are intelligent individuals who can make business decisions.  This can be seen by how they manage their people.  Your focus is not just sales.  You are the customer service person for every account in your territory even for account that you do not receive commission for‚Ä¶ FedEx has the practice of giving the Sales Executive cell phone to everyone‚Ä¶ Any person who finds your card will be calling you.  It was ridiculous.  The list of problems with this position goes on and on. 

If you want to have a life outside of FedEx, do not apply here. If you want to spend time with your family, do not apply here. If you want to spend your evenings watching television while working on FedEx pricing contracts or responding to e-mails almost every night of the week, then this is the JOB for you. 

I do not mind hard work. I was an effective sales person‚Ä¶ BUT PAY ME FOR MY EDUCATION, PROFESSIONALISM, TIME AND EFFORT! This is truly the JOB from HELL!  For those you read this post, I was not a poor performer. I always had good reviews and brought on large accounts.  I attempted to give this company my best during the time I was employed there and make the best of a BAD situation until a new door opened.  It is not worst it!  

In addition, to all of these problems, the promotion process is nearly impossible within sales department.  As an account executive, you can only be promoted to a sales executive (which is the same position with a new title). Your pay increases significantly, but the requirements change almost yearly and the company makes it almost impossible to get promoted. There are a very limited number of corporate and worldwide account manager positions. People who have those positions rarely resign or quit. When one becomes available everyone is trying‚Ä¶ promotion regardless of work ethic is nearly impossible.  UPS promotes their people fairly; FedEx does not. I have worked for both‚Ä¶ At UPS, I was respected and treated like the educated individual that I am. At FedEx, I was a robot without a brain.

pros:
-Early morning shift allows for more daytime available for school or other jobs
-Great pay for a student
-Multiple shifts and different facilities around the country
-The quicker you learn, the better you will be
cons:
-May experience sleep deprivation until you find a good balance
-Electronic issues can cause a great deal of stress
-For people banking on seniority as an automatic job advancement, don't, if you work hard and learn, there will be opportunities for you

pros: Great company to work for! Management is great & wants to see you succeed. Plenty of opportunities for advancement. Great training programs and work life balance. Very enjoyable work environment. Competitive pay & great benefits!
cons: There are not many cons with this position - work can be repetitive at times and some processes are too complicated, but all in all ... not a big deal!

pros:
Mostly set pt schedule to go with a FT job. 
Fast Paced Environment. 
Management was appreciative of work done. 
Had meeting before day started.
cons:
Very early mornings. 
Physically demanding. 
High turnover. Hard to keep good people.

pros: I loved that it was not an stationary position able  to move around and enjoy the outdoors, no one looking over your shoulders not that you can see anyway. It's a fast pace job and you have to bring you A game.
cons: Working in the snow and you stay out there until your done. I did not like walking around in the dark with a flashlight attached to my head in the middle of the night.

pros: Job security, great pay, best work/life balance and A lot of PTO
cons: IT - a lot of changes to internal systems for sales and doesn't seem to enhance the life of AEs.  Sales has plumeted and doesn't recognized it has anything to do with all the IT changes that are HORRIBLE!!!

pros: Get to work with the latest technologies, good heath care plan, the culture supports a Living (PSP) or People, Service, Profit mentality.
cons: As with most large organizations sometimes you can "feel" like a number.  It is important to move around on a regular basis taking on different responsibilities to keep everything fresh

pros: they have never had a layoff in their history. the are a good solid reputable company to work for.  my managers have all been great and fair. the review process is totally fair and it is not possible for any favoritism.  i feel that i am given free reign to be the best that i can and dont have to depend on a managers opinion for my review score.
cons: the job is very complicated. and stressful. the criteria is hard to meet

pros: FedEx cares for it's people, is investing in maintaining a healthy/positive culture, and provides good job stability (almost never lays off people - reduction in force is typically voluntary). Work life balance is great. Management is very supportive. Employees usually have a great deal of flexibility (although it varies by team.) Strong leadership team. Great product.
cons: Few promotional opportunities, mature industry (specially in the US),  top performers have to wait long time to benefit from their efforts.

review: Good Pay, Hard Work. If you can do the work it's not a bad place.
pros:
For the hours you work, you can make a fair amount of money.
Most Managers started as a package handlers themselves.
cons:
