While there are clear goals that you know you have to make, it's focused on almost entirely as a way of rating work. There are general barriers such as the flow of work that isn't taken into account.

The company prides itself on safety, but one of the reasons that safety ends up being overlooked from the package handler to the manager, is that it can get in the way of reaching the numbers expected of them.

pros: The best parts about the job is that I start at least a.m. and that its only a four to five hour work shift that pays well and then I have the day to myself for other tasks, other opportunities lie within working the night shift for extra hours.
cons: if you work at the night shift then you really don't have much times for a night life. Other sides it can become a bit overwhelming if you let the stress get to you.

review: Safety,proper load/unload,monitor metrics,timely dispatch,engagement,Recognition, Etime,data entry,accountability
pros: Opportunity for advancement within 2yrs or less. Great benefits 401k, very engaged weekly staff meetings, Rewards &  Recognition.
cons: Work life balance, Training,

pros: Great co-workers,Great customers!! Great work Atmosphere
cons: Employed just 8 months- My Managers give  me Olcc as a train tool, I was never explained certain scenerios using the time clock. Example, power pad locks, I punch out,  no time card prints, so I grab a different power pad, to key my time, I get Olcc, then my maanger  explains what and how I need to perform when this electronic error happens....

pros: Strong leadership, Service Driven and great employee benefits.  Job security due to lack of layoffs.  Advancement opportunities are unlimited if you're willing to work at the Headquarters location.
cons: Large company issues such as it's hard to move quickly on decisions and slow to implement new processes due to complex global business model

pros: Since the day i was called to come in for an interview to where i am today working for FedEx. I really enjoy my job.  Plus the company rewards their employees. Really great company to work for.
cons: The run around on customers who deal with customers service and the printing centers. Information can be misleading the wrong intention of our company.

review: Best place to work in Memphis, TN
pros: FedEx offers extremely competitive salaries and benefits.  Funding and resources are allocated sufficiently to meet the needs of critical projects.
cons: Politics and personal agendas can get in the way of progress at times.  There are not many promotional opportunities, especially for management and above.  Some areas have to pull the weight for others.

review: Great place to work.... slow career progress
pros:
Takes care of employees through benefits (though this was pruned heavily during 2008/2009).
Training to learn the tools of the trade (and beef up the resume!).
Challenging projects.
Very good work life balance!
cons:
Slow career progress unless you are a "chosen one".
Hard to get into Management.
Some projects take so long to complete - so if you are a go-getter this could be frustrating.

pros: Great benefits. Great pay but too many management changes and management going in different directions. No room for growth once you get in an analyst role. I felt like I was on a dead end street.
cons: Lot of changes and reorgs. Severance buyouts. Getting rid of a lot of the tenured employees and opting to bring new ones in for minimal pay,. No longer people service profit philosophy. Now its a profit, service, people.

review: Great company. loving ppl,and flexible but needed a pay raise.
pros:
The company is full of ppl who are caring and considerate
Family environment
Great Benefits
Management is very understanding
Great work life balance and flexible
Pay raise and bonus for everyone as long as company meets objectives
cons:
In a down market opportunities dried up and pay raises were cut as well as salary
Wanted more opportunities as job was not too diffucult or challenging
Hard to move around than previously thought

review: I had a good experience at FedEx but was disappointed with the dishonesty in management.
pros: i had freedom. Not in a sense that i can do whatever i wanted, but the fact that i was told what needed to be done and my supervisor did not hound me throughout the day. i felt trusted and reliable, instead of feeling incompetent.
cons: There is very little for promotions.

pros: This is a good place to work. The majority of workers are competent. The compensation is fair and the benefits are good.
cons: Titles are important, as well as, who you know.  There is age discrimination when it comes to first time managers.

pros: like being on a sports team. loved it. everybody had your back, my boss was great and even was greater after I got injured on the job. when i was leaving the company, he told me that he would welcome me back should i ever want to come back,
cons: long hours for full time drivers. scanning, loading in the morning to doing your route, to possible trips to the airport at the end of the day can make it taxing on your family.

pros: Part-time job leaves a lot of extra time for other daily things , good starting pay , a lot of room for advancement  ,benefits , paid holidays, paid time off
cons: lots of physical labor ,very early mornings , so your sleep patterns will change , very fast pace for slow moving people , very loud and dusty environment

review: If you are ambitious or career oriented person stay away !!
pros: You are employed and are paid decently. People around are friendly. Work is easy and relaxed. Lot's of time  for doing your personal work
cons: Work is mundane and uninspiring. You'll need to learn the systems which are pretty old, dated and don't interact well with each other. As a fresh graduate and strictly from a learning and development perspective, this is one of the worst jobs you could have.  Your learning is limited to making systems talk to each other.  There is hardly any strategic or analytical work going around.  Most of the people have given up learning or adopting changes and counting want to retire for the retirement package.  If you are seeking challenging quality work or seeking to develop your career, as mentioned by other reviewers STAY AWAY from this place.

review: Great place to work but a lot of red tape
pros: Very enjoyable place to work, lots of training opportunities and ability to move up if you are willing to.
cons: There is a lot of bureaucracy with anything that needs done.  Any project that would take a week to complete will take 10 weeks due to all the paperwork associated with it.  Medical insurance is expensive and bad.

review: One of the Premier companies to work for in Memphis area
pros: There is a defined career path for most positions in the company. There's opportunities to move within the different divisions as well. Depending on which area you work in, there's decent work life balance.
cons: Sometimes moving into different roles in the company is based on who you know, networking is necessary to advance. Therefore, having a strong skill set may not get you into a position you may actually be qualified for.

review: FedEx cares about employees and there families.
pros: The benefits and the career advancements.  QUALITY DRIVEN MANAGEMENT.
cons: I really cannot think of any thing negative.  Will always live by the PURPLE PROMISE.

review: Challenging and physically demanding job with decent compensation.
pros: The physical and fast-paced work environment really push you, and the coworkers there are helpful and friendly.  Although repetitive, it does not take long to learn how everything works.
cons: The hours are minimal even if the hourly compensation is relatively high per hour.  repetitive work can become mind-numbing.

review: FedEx is not a people Company
pros: The benefit package is very good.
cons: This Company is run by robots, managers work is primarily to cover Fed EX liability right or wrong. Any and all mistakes, injury,accidents, customer complaint is dumped in subordinates laps. A lot of favoritism given to minorities. Pay for the work performed ( courier) is sub standard and pay raises move at a snails pace.Safety in the work place is said to be paramount however you are expected to work at break neck speeds in order to save every minute of time on the clock and service needs. constantly understaffed.

review: Very well run corporation. Fred Smith is a top CEO.
pros: A leading corporation in its field. Very good corporate culture which provides employees with competitive pay, benefits and work-life balance. Employee recognition for a job well done. Opportunity for training and advancement. Stable work environment.
cons: A number of seasoned employees/managers have either retired or accepted the recent voluntary employee buyout offer. Shift to outsourcing in a number of areas with resources who don't possess the level of knowledge of the people they replaced.

pros: it worked with my schedule while I went to school. Saw some extra hours when I could make it. Good environment, good management and coworkers were fun.
cons: I moved about a thousand packages in an hour or so.  It was a physical job, which I prefer, but it happen to be pretty rough on my wrists. Took quite a few months for the aching pain to go away, but I enjoyed the job.
job title: Fed Ex Ground Package Handler Part Time

pros: Some of the benefits are pretty good. Our location's team members are also very dedicated. I enjoy working with them a lot. My management team is average.
cons: Work-life balance is definitely the biggest con. Not many initiatives have been taken to better balance the two. I'd like to see more attention paid to ensuring workers have the time they need to balance their personal lives. The job is important but there still needs to be better work life balance provided. For that reason, I think I should be able to leave only a half star in the work-blance rating category

review: Great place to work with slow career growth
pros:
1. Great work environment
2. Very good people policies
3. Low cost living
4. Great senior management
cons:
1. Low chances of growth
2. Exceptional performance not rewarded with exceptional career growth - little difference in mediocre and high performers growth/salary structure.
3. Memphis is not the most vibrant city (but has low cost of living)

review: Good place to work, employees come first
pros: reputable company, service sells itself. very open communication from superiors to employees. really put "people first". excellent opportunities for advancement.
cons: make sure  you have a good manager, makes all the difference... they expect us to  be "consultants" and they provide us with the tools and support to do so for our customers which is what makes us stand out from our competitors... all that's missing is the pay.

pros: Most of the people are easy to get along with and the work environment is friendly. The hours can be flexible but that's because you will likely need to put in 40+ hours every week, just not at a set 9-5 type of schedule.
cons: Work life balance doesn't exist much in the IT area. There are cycles but, more often than not, 40+ hours/week including nights and weekends is quite the norm. Salaries could be much better as well.

review: Good, but not exactly what I expected
pros: Very committed employees; many of the people I work with have been with FedEx for decades. For me, it has been a great opportunity for building experience and exposure to new technologies. Fairly flexible hours where I can take off for parts of the day if needed for various needs (dr. appointment, family activity,...).
cons: The work/life balance can be focused more on work and less life. The culture of the company, or at least the area I work in, is to put as many hours in a week towards work as possible and maintaining a life outside of work is not encouraged at all.

review: Stay away from the Express Division
pros: Easy job, they don't ask much from you in Express and Services divisions. Ground is very demanding
cons: In Express, there is no incentive to perform well. The company wants to shrink to keep costs down- to a point where service levels are at all time lows. There is no room for advancement as well as no job security in Express. Services is a great place for staff and Ground is where you want to be for advancement and reward.

pros: Great work life balance, Huge Company, Career Advancement Opportunities in places all over the US and Internationally, Great Benefits, Caring Executive Management (took pay cuts and offered buy outs instead of handing out lay offs), Very Understanding Management.
cons: Company as a whole leans more toward the older generation that founded it. Needs younger blood.

review: Good workout, average pay, great benefits
pros: Fast paced environment, room to move up internally, good workout.  Good benefits, 401k. And a pension plan
cons: Depending on where u work it is a lot of lifting.  Lazy people need not apply.  Hard workers are not rewarded like they used to be

pros:
Remote
2weeks vacation 
Pension
401k
Personal,sick and flh
cons: Taking sick time affects your performance review. They allow you to do shift bids but you'll never get the shift you want because everything goes by seniority. Can't take pto during Christmas holidays. No flexible hours. If you are hired on a certain shift, thats really it for a few years until they start taking of 15-30 mins at a time. Pay is low. No room for advancement, even though I was told differently during my interview process. You have ppl working for 10+ years just stuck in the same position.  Unless you relocate to Memphis. Managers also do not work with you to get you to the next level.

pros:
Very Ethical company 
Provides Best in Class service to our Customers
Opportunity with other outstanding individuals
cons:
Transportation industry currently has an excess in capacity making the environment very competitve
There is a large block of tenured (25+ yrs) that would have retired save for the great recession.  This group holds a large number of executive management postion.  This makes promotional opportunities very competitive.  This will likely change in the next 3-5 years

review: Perfect for extra income while still working a full-time position at another company
pros:
Great Pay
Excellent Benefits
Ideal hours for someone looking to work a full-time position at another company and have this as their part-time income
cons:
Physically demanding, although I don't mind, it can become strenuous at times.
Weather can be a factor as it is inside and outside from an airport hangar.
Part-time hours, although if you are looking for that, then it is a great source of income.

review: Senior Express Clearance Operations Import Coordinator
pros:
Pretty much impossible to get fired unless you are late or call in often. 
Above average paid time off.
cons:
No room for advancement and if there is the work load is not worth advancing. 
No rewards for employees, everyone feels undervalued and over worked. They do not care about quality- only quantity- which is why Customs is constantly threatening to return to paper submission for FDA shipments and a lot of extra paperwork is now needed for USGR. In fact if Customs looked into shipments more they would see that customers are constantly providing tariffs with lower duty to save money. Accuracy is not a factor at all here. 
In 3 years I've gotten a total of 16 cents in raises- that's $332.80 more than what I was hired at- after 3 years of above average work. There is no motivation to be an exceptional employee.
Most managers are lazy or mean and deserve to be fired. 
Health insurance is terrible.

pros: Challenging work, days off because I worked at night.  Good Management team at my location. Opportunities to advance were present.
cons: Warehouse work, dusty environment however that comes with the territory.  Management can make all the difference, if you have a good team, you are good to go, a bad team, well you can fill in the blanks.

pros: Always have work available when I want.  Overtime is time and a half over 8 hours per day or 40 hours per week.  Social interaction with most of the public in their workplace.
cons: Extreme pressure when delivering.  This job will age you prematurely and will make you weary when you find it hard to meet the increasingly greater expectations placed upon you.

pros: Great community, good pay, with a good opportunity to be promoted inside the company. Everyday cardio workout for those who need it
cons: Working out everyday, this job can take a toll on you mentally and physically. More physically than mentally. And it's very dusty in the trailers from time to time

pros: Short work days, food on occasion, good benefits, and nice pay
cons: People call off or show up late often, no drug testing, no repercussions for lazy workers, unappreciative drivers

pros: They have excellent top notch benefits for full time employees.
cons: Very pro man. Instead of showing corporate how things really work when they visit they put on a dog and pony show so that corporate is not aware of changes that need to be done to benefit the company.

review: Great job but not a career
pros: Great pay for a college student. Full benefits even for part time employes.  School incentive programs.  Availability to move up in the company.  Availability to move around the US within the company. Paid vacation.
cons: Lots of promotions are based on seniority  rather than who is the best candidate.  Can be very unorganized at times.  Met my ex-girlfriend there.

review: Safe and secure in a job I adore
pros: FedEx is true to the work-life balance methodology.  They support all decisions based on family because they realize family comes first.  As long as your work is getting done in a reasonable time frame, no request is unreasonable.
cons: As with all salaried positions, sometimes it is required to work longer hours every now and then, taking home your laptop to work from home at night or on the weekends.

pros: Excellent company to work for lots of opportunity for advancement. Company on very solid ground no lay off worries.
cons: Very unhappy with pay progression. I have been an ops manager for 8 years and I am only 9% above what a new manager would start out and our bonuses that they hang over you like a carrot have been terrible. Also our medical benefits every year have gotten worse and more expensive.

pros:
* Work life balance
* Competitive Salary in Memphis based on cost of living (not so much elsewhere)
* Good perks especially the 5% of salary pension match
cons:
* Wide Career bands (i.e. your pay can increase significantly from one end of a job band to the other end, but the title may not change)
* Limited career growth
* Salary outside of Memphis is not competitive

pros: Great Benefits even for part time, tuition reimbursment, not at a desk all day, people were good and regular customers became like family
cons: weather could be harsh ,esp in south, dog bites hurt, stepping in and out of truck all day wears on your knees. Christmas, Mothers Day and other high quanity shipping days your not going to see your family much.

pros:
It gets you in shape,  in less than 6 months you will lose a great deal of weight if you put enough effort into it.     

pay is higher than most companies offer

They value your safety to the up most extreme

If you are part-time then you may request to work an extra shift to earn more money
cons:
Physically tolling

If you live on your cell-phone,   expect to leave it in your car for your shift,  NO recording devices allowed ( as per notifications on the security check-in station ) ,   so if you need to keep in touch with the outside world,  you'll have to ask management for permission to dial out ( work/life balance a 2 star rating )

pros: Working hours are what I was looking for.  Access to benefits.  Paid holidays, 2 weeks vacation 1 week of sick pay
cons: They can change the time you some in on a week to week basis.  No Union.  Be ready to work in all kinds of weather conditions.

review: I LOVED working at FedEx as a Customer Service Research Asst.
pros: Awesome insurance, tuition reimbursement, family leave, military leave, vacation and sick time, professional culture, stability, and promotion from within, several awards and tokens of appreciation, a family culture, and very professional company to work for and retire from!
cons: This position is meant to be a stepping stone to a higher position. Please have a plan to move upward, soon after you are hired.

pros: Enjoy working in any environment. Very fast learner at anything and complete all my tasks in a timely manner. Very easy to get alone with.
cons: Don't like to be distracted when on the job. Like for my job duties to be explained to me as correctly as possible. Don't like working in an unhealthy environment.

review: FedEx has a culture that focuses on people,  service and profit. Individuals are responsible for their own development.
pros: The company is respected in the industry and the world. Good benefits and culture.
cons: It's a very large company. To progress, relationships matter. Under the FedEx umbrella are various operating companies with different policies and procedures that may be confusing for new employees and customers.

pros: Good benefits, good training depending on station and manager opportunity to learn and advance. Open door policy with your manager and promoted from within
cons: Sometimes lack of management follow through can result in an environment without team work and lack of acknowledged for the hard working dependable members of the team

pros: The biggest benefit to this job is it's flexibility.  A good place for a person just starting in sales out of college.
cons: If you are a professional sales person, you will find the money will never be here; no matter what big accounts you bring in. The commission off the margin made is based off what the operations team can cover the loads at. Not a lot of opportunity for growth; only the chosen few seem to get it, no matter how well or hard you work.

review: Worked for this company for 27 years. Awesome company and great people to work with.
pros: Good salary and benefits.  You get great travel benefits also.  Fast paced. Great working hours. Company allows employee an opportunity to advance rather easily also.
cons: If you are not open to change the work may not be right for you. Could be an issue if you are not an outdoor person.

pros: Good pay. Decent benefits. Meet lots of people. Energetic job. Working closely with other couriers and making friends that last forever.
cons: Local mngt can make own rules and not follow co.policy. work some holidays. Gotta work in the rain and snow. Jumping in & out of the truck all day. Bad on the knees.

review: FedEx, a good place for single/stay-at-home parents, students, and those with disabled children in need of good benefits
pros:
- Flexible hours
- Above average hourly pay
- Yearly raises
- Fast paced, work can double as a workout
- 3 day weekends
- Seniority is valuable for promotion
cons:
- Cannot support self or family with this income alone
- Difficult to get a full time job or salaried position
- Hard to work more than 17 hours, must come in extra day just to get 17

review: Great Place to work but needs to be more diversity in upper management
pros: This is an awesome place to work. People are friendly, cordial and professional. Everybody works together as a team and towards common goal.
cons: Diversity in upper management can be improved. Diversity includes women and minorities. I think FedEx does a great job in putting women in upper management but there is opportunity for minorities to be included in that place too especially in IT and Marketing.

pros: The benefits are very good for a part time job. They also have a cafeteria where you can get some food to eat
cons: the managers yell at you a lot and can be mean. I don't think FedEx has a union so that could be the reason

pros: All depends on the contractor you work for.   Mine was excellent.  Worked with me if time off was needed.  Paid vacation (contractor dependent).  Your customers are almost always happy to see you.  Good job for young, healthy individuals, not a career path.
cons:
No benefits outside of the contractor providing paid vacation. No health insurance, no 401(k), nothing .  The contractors cannot afford to provide these things and still make a profit.  Ever-changing expectations from corporate.  Work is rain or shine. 
 Hard work, physically demanding and eventually will break down your body.

pros: Excellent benefits.  If you exercise a positive attitude, show up when expected, and do the work, they will return the respect and help you to advance as part time or to move to full time.  The benefits cost the employee almost nothing and are excellent.
cons: Must be physically willing to do the work. Almost everyone starts out doing physical tasks.

pros: Great benefits and very fair management and company policies regarding employee support and benefits beyond the excellent hourly rate.
cons: Training is a bit rushed.

pros:
great benefits
pension plan
well respected employer
job security as long as you perform
good people to work with and for at times
cons:
Politics when it comes to promotions some times
Nonexistent work/life balance in November and December
Pay could be better
contractor legal issues/lawsuits
Not enough career advancement opportunities

pros: Great benefits even for part time employees, shifts that allow you to work another job, good pay rate for part time work
cons: Lots of employees who do nothing, stand around and have to have help for their work to be completed because no one can leave shift till certain tasks are completed

review: A great transitional/in between career in preparing for something better
pros: Generally independent work, driving a company delivery truck and meeting customers through out the day. There are clear standards and expectations of efficiency especially in the number of deliveries per hour, time between departing the warehouse and one's first delivery, etc.
cons: A new courier is limited to only part-time hours. It takes a few years, and only when senior couriers retire or move up, for full-time slots to become available. In addition, even with a part-time schedule, sometimes it is difficult to get a second occupation because the length of a work day depends on several factors: personal delivery times, when a shipment of packages from the airport arrives, logistical issues at HQ, etc.

pros: There are some incredible people to learn from within the organization. If you want to learn how to sell and sell great, this is the company to work for.
cons: Difficult to get promoted into Management.

pros: Wonderful company, believes in People, Service, Profit... In that order.  Very active in the local community and throughout the world.  I am proud to say that I worked for FedEx.
cons: They have a high level of expectations and can create some stressful situations.  Also moving away from remote workers, while the rest of the world moves towards remote workers, FedEx is moving away from remote workers

pros: Great people. The market leader in shipping and logistics. The CEO is fantastic.
cons: Low salary, tough to advance.  Recent erosion of great people programs. Senior management has lost touch with the employees.

review: excellent company that cares for it's employees
pros: Collaborative environment with learning opportunities and challenging work. Every employee has a direct impact on the bottom line and are able to see how their individual contributions help the growing company take it's place as a top competitor in the market. Competitive salaries, great benefits, and employee perks make this a great place to work.
cons: with the slowing economy and not as much natural attrition, opportunities for advancement are lacking

pros: You always have an opportunity to move around the hub once you been there for 3 months.  If you work offload on the planes you will make a lot more money.  You will find yourself hitting overtime or there.
cons: The weather is very hot in the summer and very cold in the winter.  Be prepared.

pros: Lots of opportunity for growth, small teams that foster collaboration, intelligent people, cafeteria onsight, decent parking, great neighborhood
cons: Heavy politics, mistakes can haunt you, cutthroat competition, some managers are not available to support their team, can be difficult to be mentored, silo environment with heavy walls that are blocking against success.

pros: FedEx is a good company with good benefits, good salary, and good advancement opportunities. I highly recommend working there. Go for it.
cons: FedEx is a large company, so sometimes you feel lost in the crowd. Management is military is style, top down directed, with not much opportunity for employee recommendations.

review: Secure company, it's not going anywhere.
pros: It's secure at FedEx. Hiring all the time. Don't necessariy have to perform above average, being liked is most important.
cons: It's a male centric company. also management will convey one message but reward employees for something completely different.

review: Great company, great culture, but a slow-moving giant!
pros: Positive Culture. Flexible Management. Cafeteria/Gym in Building. Pension. Free Parking. Lots of Opppourtinity.
cons: Lack of Resources. Lack of Young Talent. Too Structured of a Pay/Promotion Scale. Lack of Work From Home Options / Flexibility. No Free Coffee. Tenured Employees / Political Enviroment.

pros: When I needed to move closer to my parents hometown due to their health issues, FedEx  moved me back where i needed to be. I am thankful to those that facilitated the move and to FedEx for the opportunities and for working with their employees.
cons: Tight staffing model for smaller stations. Never enough time

review: Not paid enough for such an overwhelming amount of work
pros: Mindless work; you don't really have to think much or deal with customers
cons: Packager handlers are rewarded for unsatisfactory work; weak links are expected to be subsidized by everyone else; some employees handle far far less volume than others (I average 700-900 packages per day, others handle 80-10); Managers worry too much about efficiency without knowing how much more difficult they make the job; instead of listening to employee concerns, manager rattle off platitudes about "positive attitudes", and "slow and steady wins the race", without actually having the experience of handling such back-breaking work; they say they hire and promote from within, yet as an employee, you are still required to go through bureaucratic online application process rather than being directly promoted; TERRIBLE electronic equipment; favoritism and inability to properly discipline employees; everyone speaking Spanish

pros: Great benefits all around, for most part, great management team depending which company and/or division you work at, but overall great sense of appreciation and value of employees.  Multiple opportunities to grow and they do try to hire from within.
cons: Politics instead of talent and abilities/capabilities in enabling one to move up the corporate ladder. Pay not always competitive.

review: Fedex is an impressively well run company
pros: The management is well selected; the facilities and concern for employees is a priority; and the work is variable , constant, and fast paced.
cons: There havent been any major cons in my experience so far. Like any industrial job, there is constant noise (belts running, etc), but I couldnt see it leading to even slight hearing damage unless one worked full time for years.

pros: steady job, great on the job training and great support at your finger tips on the computer as well as the teams if you need questions answered.
cons: due to the nature of the business your days can be very long and not much chance to move up and advance your career unless you have a degree

pros: Good health, dental and vision insurance, nice 401k matching, great people, decent pay and opportunity to be outside meeting people. College degree not required and generally easy work for a manual labor job.
cons: Seniority policy makes it difficult to move into a decent full time position or get a vacation on a week you want. Part time couriers will likely work in the evening which can be a strain on family life.

pros: Love the people, love the job and the environment. The company as a whole fostered a great sense of comradely and purpose. While the job was sometimes difficult, it was always worth it to be part of something that large.
cons: When you deal in time as a commodity, the expectations can often feel more than a little daunting

pros: Good benefits, career opportunities, good pay, convenient hours to work around the clock, diverse work environment, team work is mandatory! Safe environment
cons: Different personalities like any place , when weather is hot it's hotter on building and voiced versa. When cold several layers needed, months where can go over hours (peak season) during the holidays

pros: Great team atmosphere. Smart people, who work on good interesting projects. Tasks are dependent upon management direction. Excellent work life balance
cons:
Kinda slow. New technologies take time to get so people leaving the company might take time to adjust to the fast paced life outside. 
Health benefits are definitely wanting and other perks are non existent.

pros: Pay was $13/hr and you could work over college breaks. Managers were super flexible. Co-workers liked you because you were seen as temporary employment and didn't pose a threat for promotions/bonuses. They feed you food weekly. It's a basic position but employers always wanted to talk about my time there.
cons: There's no AC so it's hot in the summer and freezing in the winter. It's hard labor.

pros:
As an IT analyst, I had opportunities to change career direction and specialties every 3-5 years.
Management has re-focused on PSP Philosophy - Take care of People, people provide great Service for customers, leading to Profit for shareholders.
Recent voluntary buy-out offer will provide more opportunities for remaining staff.
cons: Downsizing from voluntary buy-out may result in a dynamic environment for a while.

pros: Pay and benefits. Good supervisors, employees, security and staff. Very good sturdy employment, and supervisors are always willing to assist you at any given time.
cons: Very strenuous work with certain aspects. Can be a dangerous work environment if not taken with caution at times. A bit stressful. I would not recommend this job with anyone who has a health problem in regards to stress either.

review: Excellent company, excellent employees, leading-edge projects for the best and the brightest
pros: Good compensation, better than average benefits, historically long term job satisfaction and most people stay at least 10 years, but many stay much longer
cons: There are not a lot of levels to advance through promotional opportunities.  You cannot come in with an expectation to advance at the rate some other companies have ... be patient, wait for your time, repeat if necessary.

review: FedEx Services has many opportunities throughout the company
pros: Large company with many opportunities for advancement, learning, and growth. Small-company culture and atmosphere - everyone is extremely genuine, nice, helpful and down to earth.
cons: Few cities with corporate job availability; large company so sometimes it's hard to get your ideas out there; sometimes technology could be more advanced

pros: FedEx was a great company with great benefits. Flexible schedule and weekends off. Paid vacation and holidays off . Great part time job
cons: I really enjoyed working at FedEx. The people were nice and helpful. Really my only complaint was there was not enough hours

pros:
Good working environment, decent pay and will afford you time-off  as needed. Plenty of overtime.
Great opportunity to learn and get exposure other governmental agencies.
cons: Work with US Customs and have to be flexible to the various changes as they occur. Overtime is required and limited growth within sub-company.

review: overall its been a pretty good company to work for. Very secure work place.
pros: Great pay. Friendly atmosphere. Have enjoyed for the most part, working there.
cons: Too much OT for me. They need to have a more level work flow throughout the work week. Instead of having certain days with a heavy volume. Also,have an even number of people to work every inch of warehouse, functions.

review: Senior ECO Coord. @ FedEx Trade Networks
pros: The benefits and vacation time are great. If you are favored by upper management it‚Äôs a decent job to have but the skewed office politics and ‚Äúwitch hunt‚Äù mentality that the site manager cultivates does not create many pro for most employees.
cons: There is no sense of community at this office. The site manager is sexist to put it simply and will absolutely pit her employees against one another. For some reason her management team seems unconcerned with dropping productivity at the this site and her ability to hire capable people and retain those people. This trend will continue until she is relieved from her position and a more forward thinking person is allowed to step up.

pros: Fast paced. Great benefits. Motivating atmosphere. Paid vacations. Surrounded by Honest, hard working people. Managers are fair and will help you move up as long as you work hard and are responsible
cons: Can get stressful if you can‚Äôt handle multiple tasks at once. Until you get a routine going. Not for everyone. Must be able to keep up with time/task expectations as Their logo is ‚ÄúThe World on Time‚Äù

pros: Work exposes you to all types of marketing and event coordination as well as other types of business interactions with prepares you for the corporate universe
cons: Very competitive there are thousands of employees that you will have to fight against to make sure you rise to the top

review: FedEx-no longer a good company to work for.
pros: Benefits are fantastic.  That's it.
cons: Used to be a good company, then things changed, now the company no longer cares about its front line couriers in the least.  They want to squeeze blood from a stone and work couriers to death while showing favoritism to friends.  Management is an utterly useless group of fools, disorganized and incompetent.  Perhaps if the company would stop strong-arming anyone who utters the word "union" and let us organize, we would have SOME rights as employees, instead of being complete slaves to their foolish whims.

review: Great Company but Career Growth hard to come by
pros: Pension eligible after 3 years, 14 working days off, unlimited sick days, great "brand", free range on inet use at the office, nobody monitors you, like to do a lot of out of office events, get interline travel benefits, corporate perks, great discounts pretty much everywhere you can think of
cons: promotions are so hard to come by unless you are willing to relocate after working in inside sales for 18 months, working in inside sales for 18 months until you can look for field sales jobs sucks, and then its up to the manager to help you out which doesnt help out at all!!!

pros:
The company does provide stable employment (they only lay off team members in extreme financial situations).
Benefits (while slowly being reduced due to health care costs) are competitive and better than normal.
Working atmousphere is fairly casual.
cons:
The process and bureaucracy is very overbearing, very similar to working for the government (old school style management)
All of the leadership and upper management is centered in Memphis.  You cannot expect to progress within the company without moving to Memphis.
The company has grown by acquiring other companies and has a challenge integrating those companies together (both systems and process).

pros: Executive support and hard work. Extremely dedicated work force that keeps customer first focus.
cons: Long hours at times. Very rigid work process that is at times difficult to get exceptions when needed. However, at organization this size the standardization is needed and exceptions are being considered more frequently than in the past.

pros: Fun job, got paid for a great work out everyday! Employee benefits weather you are full or part time which seemed to provide generous time off even working part time.
cons: Usually would have to work early early mornings or evenings at the airport. No real day jobs and not much opportunity to go full-time unless you moved.

pros: Great pay and great benefits. Great christmas tips
cons: expectations were very unrealistic. Its impossible to do 45 stops in 35 minutes all spread out in the snow. Theres no concern for your safety just get it done. And if you dont kiss up to the managers get ready for alot of uncalled for write ups that you see other people get away with on a everyday basis.

pros: The envirmonment was positive. Great coworkers. I enjoyed my time working for such a great company.
cons: A lot of pressure to make sure packages were on time and customers were treated with ultimate respect. Not negative pressure, mostly pressure you put on yourself to not let anyone down.

pros: 1. Great employee oriented company, consistently in the best companies to work for in the US and world 2. Competitive salaries 3. Cost of living in Memphis suburbs is low, quality if life very nice including good/great schools. 4. Excellent work-life balance 5. Pension plan
cons: Big company, not many people want to give up excellent quality of life - the end result being not many growth opportunities.

pros: Great environment, i learned alot in the short amount of time that I was there and hope to be working for them full time when I graduate
cons: Very strict working hours.  Alot of work to handle on a daily basis.  Can be very stressfull

pros: They invest in their employees and promote from within.  The have a people, service, profit motto that they live and breath-if you hire the right people and treat them well, they will give exceptional service to the customer which brings in the profit.  Some of the best mentors in my career were at FedEx.
cons: For most sales positions you will be required to move to a new state.

pros: decent insurance, lots of vacation and sick time
cons: scheduled to work every holiday (decent compensation for this), actual pay isn't that great, the heat has been broken on and off since I started in 2015, a lot of inconsistency in policy and procedure application,

review: A great Company that is doing so much right.
pros: The upper level management is making great decisions.  The company is working on and developing great new opportunities and strengths for itself.  In the future I am confident that the growth and market share will increase for FedEx.
cons: Everything boils down to how management impacts you.  I can say that most of the managers I have had at FedEx have been great.

pros: Very family oriented company. Truly take care of their employee. The management does think of families their decision affects. Team members are very friendly.
cons: Technology is not cutting edge. Changes are very slow. The salary is not keeping up with the market. In some department their is lack of innovation.

review: Thankful for the experience and knowledge I gained as well as the relationships
pros: Good benefits, training, and opportunities for career advancement
cons: Hourly employees work extremely hard but are not paid wages that reflect their worth

pros: Decent benefits, great work/life balance, good training opportunities. Good opportunities to change to another team depending on where you are located.
cons: They use outdated technology stacks, too many people have worked at FedEx for too long and resist change. Focus is on cutting costs and use offshoring as much as possible no matter what the impact is to the quality. Many in management think they are agile because they have daily standups. The development / deployment lifecycle is very long and the velocity is low and the defect rate is medium to high.

pros: Fedex has great employee and insurance benefits. For material handler, this should only be a part time job unless a part time job is all you're looking for
cons: You will only only get about 4 hours per day/ night if you are lucky. Christmas is about the only time you will get more hours. You can always ask for more hours, but odds are, it's only going to be on the weekends.

pros: Good way to earn money part time.  Especially if you are a student or you have other requirements of your time.
cons: uncaring management.  Sometimes, situations happen that are beyond our control and prevent us from coming to work on time.  Although, I do understand that reporting to work and on time is a requirement of the job.

pros: The name and the history of the company are inspiring.  It has grown very fast.
cons: The leadership and management below Fred Smith need to get their heads out of their butts and realize the unnecessary stress that they put on their Sales folks.  They do not put their people first, they do not care about their customers.....all they care about is their Stockholders, Wall Street and where the leadership is going to go for President's Club on the backs of their sales people.  The company has grown too fast and the wrong people are in charge and too many good people have gone.

pros: Great working environment, fantastic experience with the coworkers, and fabulous management style.
cons: You have to work overtime usually in order to complete since the job is extremely heavy and there are tons of stuffs you have to do in order to complete the daily task.

pros: Flexible hours, tuition reimbursement. I like that it is a fast paced environment. It is great place to work for a part-time job. Excellent benefits!
cons: The work can be very physical. The weather can sometimes slow down the progress of getting the freight out on time.

review: Hard to move up and promote.
pros: Great benefits and and retirement plan. The hours are ok. With the right schedule you don't work weekends and you get paid holidays off.
cons: Never more than 20 hours a week. You have to give up your personal life for overtime if you are picked.

pros: Benifits are great and flexible for students.  Tuition reimbursment program is an excellent benifit.  When the economy was down FedEx still provided a secure work setting.
cons: 110 Degree warehouse in the summer.  The holidays are non-existant because we are providing a service that is stressed during those times.

review: Overall a good company to work for
pros: Good Benefits, Job Security, able to transfer to other sites, able to upgrade from part time to full time, Good people there,
cons: Very busy during holiday season and overtime is mandated. Very strict about attendance and tardiness.  You are marked down on your review if you use sick time.

review: Great company, good benefits, forward thinking
pros: Good company, strong focus on IT, very forward thinking.  Strong focus on delivering helpful information to all users through progressive use of the web.
cons: FedEx sometimes loses focus on their goals and chases the competition.  At times it drives its people harder and longer than needed.  Upward mobility is usually limited unless you are in Memphis.

review: Great company, great culture, decent pay
pros: Pay is below market level for the area. Great company with great and true people-first culture. Career advancement opportunities are available, especially on international divisions
cons: Challenging financial conditions which impact pay. Very low turnover. Some people that have been with the company for years perform poorly and still get a chance to stay in the job.

review: They take care of their own.
pros: You know exactly what you'll be doing every day. Not a whole lot of surprises. Easy Money. Lots of room to move around in the company.
cons:
Don't plan on getting any more hours that what you come in at.
Poor leadership on the floor.

pros: Great benefits, paid a minimum of 17 hours/wk as long as you show up and work. Managers are kind and listen to suggestions.
cons: Not much opportunity for overtime, work can be monotonous, grueling and repetitive; exposure to extreme heat and cold.

pros:
Great brand
Actually has a pension plan that is funded by the company
Loyal to employees
Lots of long term employees work here
Company tries to maintain work/life balance.  Usually successful, but work sometimes takes precedence
cons:
Pay may be lower than market for similar positions
Constant changes...which is sometimes good, but it's actually too common at FedEx

pros: Great coworkers, freedom, no micromanagement. Amazing benefits and pay, and the job is never boring. Work is stable and managers willing to adjust schedule for school, and work/life balance.
cons: Sometimes stressful, and extremely fast paced. Management sometimes play favorites. Politics come into play when trying to move up in the company. Some workers disrespectful and unprofessional.

pros: Great job environment and awesome co-workers and management. Have 2 trucks to load or less to work on.  Team work is the key to success.
cons: Unless its not peak season you won't get more than 5 hours a day. Also if you need extra hours maybe working on inbound 2 day a weeks max

pros: There are several pros. One of these is the excellent pay and a great team.
cons: Just like any job there are always some cons as well. One of the cons is the long hours during holidays like Christmas. Also you will probably be working with a contractor. If this is the case risk of being dropped if freight falls off is great.

pros: Working time is very flexible. People are nice and helpful! Wonderful working environment. Good culture.
cons: Memphis is not like big cities. There's no much fun activities or parties going on living here. And it's not very convinient to visit other states of the country (always need to transfer flight).

pros: Great Exercise, Promotes from within, Full-Time Benefits.
cons: Awkward Hours, Sometimes can be stressful to body. Make sure to always stretch!

pros: Great place to work with solid people and development practices.  The company has a people, then service, then profit philosophy that makes them who they are
cons: It is slower to have a career progression, sometimes more to do with seniority than merit.

pros: they offer great benefits, they are extremely fast paced, and I love that you get weekly pay there is much opportunity to move up
cons: the job is very physical in most entry level positions, in the warehouse it is not a climate controlled environment

pros: Get to work with great people, in a strong company with lots of different work to challenge you.
cons: Corporate structure has been set in stone. Not as much room for advancement upward if your goal is to get above first level of management.

pros: Nice job if you want to lose weight and get pay for it.
cons: Pay is very  low. Not even if you are retired.  It is pay check to check. Worse than third world country. But the CEO and other are fine. Workers very poor.

review: My experience has been a very good one
pros: The benefits are excellent, the hours are flexible around my schedule, the management system is fine - an all around good company
cons: The benefits package was just adjusted. Depending on your situation (married, single, kids) it can be a negative, but that varies by individual situations

pros: company culture foster collaboration, team work, personal connection. Philosophy of serving customer best.
cons: quite some overlap in projects/functions across various organizations. Management level can be too protective of its own org and lose the whole Picture. Tardiness in one team can cause costly delay in a big cross-functional project.

pros: Great work-life balance and people-service-profit culture.  Interesting work and people.
cons: Very difficult to advance in your career because of little growth or attrition in marketing.  Many parts of the company are very siloed.  Inability of management to make a decision can be stifling at times.  Very slow to react to the market.

review: Supervison is very informative  meet their goals , when we do a good job we are congratulated.
pros: I work for FedEx Ground Bethlehem,PA and we are best in our divison.  It gives you a sense of pride.  The benefits they have are excellent.
cons: Fast pace and  a lot of lifting which I dont mind.

pros: Only have to work 40 hours. Can work 4 x 10 schedule as long as keep numbers up.  Can move up if able to relocate. Have lots of positions open at all times. If can't relocate May be waiting years to change positions.
cons: Constant changing territories. No control over numbers. Either you have a good territory or you don't. Things don't always work like they should.

pros: Good place to work. Treat employees well. Attempts can be made to make it feel personal but it can be too much
cons: Not too much room for growth without deciding to move out of the area.  If you decide to switch opcos expect a pay decrease for more work.

pros: Very helpful and professional people that i got to work with. Nice, well kept working environment. Decent opportunities for advancement.
cons: The pay I received was pretty low and no shift differential. Working the night shift was not the best. Needed equipment to do the job was sub-par.

pros: Benefits start the same day you do, Regional manager at the time was very personable, Family like atmosphere at times
cons: Limited room for advancement, Favoritism is a problem, Lack of appreciation for hard work can cause employees to feel undervalued

review: Mail Sorter / Ramp Agent (last Year at Employer 2009)
pros: Fast Pace, Enjoy working with others, they really take care of their employees, they provide uniforms, they give overtime, they post job opening, they recognize their employees and their pay is great. Overall, I love working for this company.
cons: Hard to get a full time position and their breaks are short.

review: Has it challenges but it's a fast growing company with opportunities.
pros: Company is always looking to improve life style which you get a incentive and bonuses during the peak season for working on Sundays.
cons: Sometimes long hours and work on holidays depending on the volume for that week. Some upper managers are old school which your opinion doesn't matter.

pros: Good hard work.  Excellent fellow employees looking out for one another. Not bad pay but wish it was better. Accumulation of PTO. Get to work in all areas of the warehouse.
cons: Wish the schedules were posted at least a week in advance instead of the prior day. Not much of a chance for advancement.

pros: Part-timers are eligible FULL benefits after 90 days. I don't work weekends. Great hourly rate. Great training. Definitely opportunities for quick advancement.
cons: Not a lot of hours in the beginning. But, I started at the end of the summer, at Grand Junction, CO.

review: I have had my ups and downs. One of my 1st jobs... in my 6 years a lot has changed within the company it self ...
pros:
Pay .
Uniforms are stylish.
Peak season $$.
401k
Medical benefits 
Paid vacation 
Sick time 
Floaters and personals 
Opportunity to grow and move up within the company
cons:
Corrupted management ... it's who you know  ... lots of favoritism . Part time hours suck!
Slow season sucks work gets slow.

pros:
Good job security
Great health benefits
Excellent‚Äã work life balance (almost to a fault)
Opportunities to work international
cons:
Fixed vacation time policy (non negotiable)
Complex organizational structure
Risk adverse mindset

pros: Benefits package and pay are competive
cons: The company no longer follows its core values. The company treats its employees like a number. Management has zero accountability, so you do not ever speak with the manager who is actually writing you up. Courier employees are expected to do the jobs of managers. Later start times are encroaching on about a 3 month basis, giving you less time to do your job. Employees are being written up for not taking a full hour break, for being 99% on their numbers regardless of experience and conditions they had to deal with. Operations managers are being threatened to be written up by their managers for not writing up employees.

pros: I love to work and make sure my job is done and helping other makes my day.
cons: I don't like working with people who don't treat other the way they need to be treated.

pros: Constantly busy. Proud to be a part of organization. Not a union company.
cons: Not always knowing where couriers delivered packages until they return request of delivery location. Too many seniority status attitude to work as a team.

pros: Good people doing hard work.  Takes a few weeks to get acclimated if you are not use to a fast pace work environment.  Good benefits. Opportunity for advancement, flexible shifts.
cons: Fast paste. Heavy lifting, pay under $13.00 an hour

pros: Good Environment and People, always felt good going into the work place. Maybe my co workers made it all better but I always enjoyed. I only left to move to another company and higher up.
cons: Upper manager needs to listen to lower employees, and there input. They are out in the field and understand the dynamics of what is going on.

pros: Good workout and get paid at the sametime. And you can move up very fast...
cons: Part-time  job  position  no more the 4 to 5 hours  a day but you can get full-time if you want.

review: Good Stable Company, Nice culture, Better to work at the Main Hub in Memphis
pros:
Great sales training
Interesting industry
Nice people that work there
Good Benefits
Decent pay
cons:
Career paths are not very good, I was Promoted and had to take a pay cut because of lack of bonuses
Surprise quarterly goals that consistantly change, one quarter super high the next surer low
Alignment of accounts is horrible and very little control over what accounts your aligned to
No HR representative on the West Coast, most all important roles are in Memphis
If you want to get promoted you have to wait a long time or move

pros: It has been a very good expierience working in the enviornment. Everyone should expierence how working is.
cons: dont get caught up in the things you do. being friends with too many coworkers. Using to much nonsense to solve problems.

review: Great work/life balance in most depts
pros: Competitive compensation in a low-cost metro area, opportunities for individual contributors to move around corp., job security, sufficiently complex processes and techology to keep you interested, visionary leadership at the top.
cons: Politics, reluctance to hold people accountable, policies belie an extreme aversion to risk taking especially in HR matters.

pros: The starting pay is good for the area. In the first year alone, an employee gets 4 pay raises.
cons: There's no air conditioning in the warehouse so the summer months are hot. The winter months are cold.

pros: Advancement opportunities are more than most companies provide. A lot of different ways you can move up in different areas and learn.
cons: Favoritism seems to be a big thing in upper management. It was ultimately the reason why I left. Didn't feel like dealing with all the politics.

pros: Good hours, good environment and great benefits. Promotion takes time but are fair. They go by seniority. So be patient. I love being on the road and enjoy working here.
cons: Hard to communicate with management unless they need you to do extra hours or pick up an extra shift. But in the, as long as you're doing your job properly, nobody bothers you.

pros: Open communication about things that are happening within the company at any given time.  Senior Leadership is focused on the employee and their happiness, but they are too concerned with paperwork.  The environment is awesome and the comraderie next to none.
cons: TOO MANY FORMS!!  It seems like there are four hundred forms to fill out every time you want to make a change to your employee account, or your benefits, or your schedule.  Nothing is easy.  There are also rampant conerns about acquisitions and the opportunities afforded by them.  Too many chiefs and not enough indians it would seem like.

pros: The People are wonderfull. They really care about one another, and management gives you the flexibility to balnace work and home life.
cons: It's big and confusing. They don't seem to have their ducks in a row. Processes get in the way and everyone does the same task differently.

pros: theres a lot of room for growth and job advancement, theres a great and friendly environment, regulars made work very enjoyable
cons: some co workers made it difficult to enjoy work, because its so easy to advance there were some people who were not deserving of a raise/ promotion.

review: Was a good experience just wish it could have continued on to be a permanent job.
pros: Loved servicing customers and interaction with them.
cons: I have no cons except would love to remained as a permanent worker. I was disappointed that I could not have a route. Would love to have stayed on.

review: The experience at FedEx is hardwork and challenging because some days can be light and some days can be heavy.
pros: The people you meet there and the experience is definitely one to remember. They show you how to do everything.
cons: The hours aren't that good but the pay rate is good. The work is also hard and can ware on your body.

pros: Promotes from within, work life balance promoted, diverse workforce, provides necessary training, supplies, equipment and support to  get the job done and succeed. Good benefits
cons: Skills and Talent often overlooked by bias and favoritism when promotions come around. Salaries in some markets could be more competitive.

review: Could be great, but too many old heads at the helm
pros: Great benefits, good pay, decent bonus, excellent resume booster.
cons: Extremely antiquated systems (I mean, they don't even teach the programming language anymore), tenure is valued over innovation, too many in leadership who refuse to retire which creates a bottleneck for younger people who want to grow with the company. There is a reason that millennials and generation X'ers are exiting the company en masse; look at the root cause and DO something to address it.

review: I enjoy driving and being on the road.
pros: Good pay, early work. I enjoy meeting new people everyday on different routes. The people and energy around me is great. Im looking for a permanent position.
cons: Working in the rain could be difficult. Working late hours its hard to see the house numbers in dark areas. And sometimes the traffic can be frustrating.

pros: Great brand, easy to get customer meetings, product easy to sell because we can genuinely help small businesses improve and save, overall good company culture, good expense accounts for customer entertaining
cons: Underpaid in a bull market --  new bonus structure (rolled out in 2017) cuts quarterly bonuses by thousands,  internal partners are mostly incompetent making getting admin work done very hard, not enough reward and incentive for selling, sales salary is very low compared to sales job averages, SO much customer service on the shoulders of sales  - hard to delegate.

pros: Great pay, great benefits, awesome management (at least where I was), room for growth, regular raises
cons: Can be physically straining. You should definitely follow company advice and stretch properly before you start the day

review: People First? I don't think so!
pros: Benefits! For employee and family are quite good.
cons: Policy is KING. Even when policy is irrelevant, out dated, or diminishes the "people first" policy. FedEx also, just took away the company matching contribution on the 401K!

pros: Fairness towards employees.  Provided training for every position.  Any problems you could go to management to resolve.  Wish I never left!!
cons: Not too many downsides.  Employees always complained about pay compared to UPS drivers.  We didn't have to deal with the Union.

review: The pay isn't the best, but it's honest work...if you're willing to do it.
pros:
- Great co-workers. All of them were friendly and hard-working, and willing to help out. 
- Pay was higher than expected.
- Very relaxed atmosphere.
cons:
- Grueling requirements.
- Unreasonable requests.
- Dark and cramped spaces
- Very biased. Expected me to do more work than others due to my gender/age/etc, even though all of us were getting paid the same. 
- Too much favoritism. They would deliberately pull me off my assignment to load someone else's truck, because it was a girl and she couldn't load 150lb. tires, which I totally understand, but the favoritism was just too much sometimes.

review: This is a magnificent company to work for!
pros: They care about their employee.  You are recognized for great work.  Great benefits.
cons: My department was not a 24 hr operation.  Backup systems may cause delays in getting the job done. Your breaks and lunches are assigned.

review: FedEx is an old fashioned reliable company to work for.
pros: Great work life balance. Nice managers and colleagues. Family like atmosphere. Everyone takes care of the other
cons: Not a lot of growth prospects. Not a lot of incentive to go above and beyond as not matching incentives. Moreover health benefits have really become curtailed now.

review: Everyone has been very nice and they are all very helpful to new people.
pros: The people are great and the benefits are really good.
cons: The job requires sitting at a computer for 8 hrs & your raises are based on how many shipments you can key.

pros: Corporate benefits. Corporate backing. Corporate benefits. Corporate backing. Corporate benefits. Corporate backing. Corporate benefits. Corporate backing. Corporate benefits. Corporate backing. Corporate benefits. Corporate backing.
cons: Corporate bureaucracy. Corporate bureaucracy. Corporate bureaucracy. Corporate bureaucracy. Corporate bureaucracy. Corporate bureaucracy. Corporate bureaucracy. Corporate bureaucracy. Corporate bureaucracy. Corporate bureaucracy.

pros: It's great to show up to work and simply work until the job is done. Small but hard working team. Not having to deal with customer service. Paid work out!
cons: Definitely hard work. Must be aware of surroundings and body movement to help prevent injuries. Pay could be a little better so the labor involved.

pros: Solid company with long-term growth and increased market share.  Supportive of employees. Good pay, benefits, dedicated to customers.
cons: Keeping poor performers on too long and task of managing these employees.   Very long process to terminate for subpar performance.

pros: Excellent commitment to career development.  I have seen management encourage employees to maintain updated Individual development plans.  The programs offered by HR department enable employees to pursue different careers.
cons: A bit slow to make decisions due to consensus culture.  In this digital age need to be faster to respond to market needs.

pros: Very good health and dental benefits, including mental. External benefits, like discount travel. Good first job for young people (20's). Room for growth if working in key markets.
cons: Very hard on the body as it involves lots of manual labor. Sometimes last minute long hours which makes making plans hard.

pros: The benefits are impressive and promotion opportunities are there if you're willing to wait. There are not too many companies that offer full health and dental insurance to even the lowest level employees. The continuous assessment of performance can be either a positive or negative.
cons: Stress. Promotions are based mostly on seniority. The hours required to actually meet standards far exceed a normal working week. Employee turnover is especially high if you work in the logistics department. Some of the employees seem to be barely conscious neanderthals or are super gung ho military types who get far too excited about getting a truck to Memphis on time.

review: IT was a good experience for me.
pros: Great company, great benefits and good people to work with. I enjoyed working there but I needed more hrs to support my family.
cons: I needed full time hrs and it only offers part time. I could not support my family on part time work only.

review: Small part in a very large organization with somewhat limited scope, but many good things about company.
pros: Work conditions.  Safety.  Facilities.  Adequate tools to do the job.  Convenience.  Sufficient flexibility.
cons: Limited income growth.  Pay scales not rationalized.  The real inside track is not always known.  Very challenging competition.  Lots of outstanding talent and intelligence, but sometimes lacking in real and broad experience, especially experience in Transportation.

pros: Great benefits, salary, management and company. I don't have anything to complain about.
cons: If you have a hard time being on time this job is not right for you. A key part of the job at FedEx is punctuality and responsiblity. Not necessarily a con but something to think about if you have a hard time getting up in the morning or being on time.

pros: Good pay, meeting interesting people.
cons: Delivery drivers seems to e the only ones who are held accountable for doing their job. The freight drivers that travel between statio can show up as they  well please, which cause us to be dispatched late( sometimes as late as 10 oclock). Station manergers and their sidepieces (women) are not in anything but their bounuses. And working for a contractor sometimes means lack of flexability to take time off in an emergency.

review: Great culture, but it is changing
pros: Respect for employees, internal grievance process, good benefits, promote from within, financially sound, top executives, great chairman
cons: Pressure from Wall Street is reflecting on People Service Profit culture. Bad apples are hard to let go. HR processes can be convoluted. Career progression has been limited. Top professionals are leaving quickly. Memphis is not the most appealing city

pros: If you are not the type of person who wants to get a four year degree then start from the bottom, but rather, join the workforce at a reasonable wage, Fedex is a great place to work with great job security
cons: It is a physical job and you are outside 90% of the time so weather conditions must be considered before accepting a position

pros:
-Good salary.
-401k, pension
-President's Club
-Ability to move up (if you move)
cons:
-Bonuses compared to other sales jobs are small.
-Some managers micro manage but depends on who you have
-Upper management gives you "sales pitch" and you feel like you are being sold
-Have to move to get promoted
-White male= hardest to move up

pros: They really got to know you and allowed me to move around to different jobs when I wanted to.
cons: It is very fast paced so if you cannot handle continuously working for 5+ hours then it probably isnt for you. First two weeks were the worst but after that you get used to it.

pros: Keeps you in shape. They will give you benefits after a year. Education benefits. Other company benefits listed on the websites. Struggling to think of pros.
cons: I don't enjoy getting hurt and receiving cuts and bruises on my body on a daily basis. No matter how safe I try to be, It happens. I don't care if it's minor cuts and bruises here and there. I didn't like this job because I didn't like the lifting, as a former UPS employee, I found that working at the unloading area at their "new state of the art building" was more difficult than the much older UPS ups hub.

pros: Great pay and benefits.
cons: Teamwork is not always there, managers are just working for their bonus, if  you have to go through GFTP process it is a joke, don't waste your time. Just move on. HR representative never there for you.

review: FedEx Great Company to work for
pros: I love there culture I so regret leaving. Management was always great and there benefits where above any company i have worked for.
cons: If your looking for full time hours with part-time position this might not be the job for you. This position is for a secondary job or part-time job. Some employees want full-time hours since its there only job

review: Give credit, where credit is due.
pros: After 15 years, I can't think of one!  OK, maybe one?  The benifits are pretty good.
cons: Quit and never go back.  If, you do, you will be treated as IF you are a NEW employee.  However, you can climb up the ladder faster with all that knowledge, but the pay will NOT!!  The best job within FedEx where the pay is ok was a courier.  After so many years on the road, my body couldn't keep up and so, i chose to quit instead of working as a CSR in the call center or in a BSC (pay cut to go in doors at FedEx) and at that time was not an option being a single parent.

pros: Overall it was a great place to work. The management was great. For an internship, the assignments were challenging. People are real friendly and easy to meet. In particular the managers in different departments. Once you get your foot in the door there are a lot of opportunities in many different areas of the company. There is job security.
cons: Corporate environment that was a little to process oriented.

review: An amazing company and premiere transportation company working to evolve
pros:
Great reputation and amazing service
Flexibility and supportive management
Opportunities to learn and grow within the company
People first culture
cons:
Compensation imbalances are not corrected overtime
Need for more specific, organized professional orientation
Innovation needs to extend internally
IT infrastructure needs to be completely rebuilt

review: Great company that balances strategy and culture
pros:
Great team members to work with
Growing culture around the Purple Promise and Living PSP
Challenging responsibilities and assignments
Ability to learn so much about business strategy and how FedEx affects the world economy
cons:
Movement up the career ladder not as straightforward
Relationships between operating companies could become more integrated

pros: FedEx is a great place to work if you are looking to have high job security and work towards an education in business management as you work part time.
cons: The hours are sometime ridiculous and there is no way to plan out your day, as there is no telling how long you will be at work.

review: Working at one of the main hubs, such a neat and unique job loading and unloading aircraft
pros: Great work atmosphere, Excellent experience! There aren't too many people that work on and around the airport all the time!
cons: Sometimes there can be too many Chiefs and not enough Indians.

pros: FedEx is a solid company to work for.
cons: They have a fair share of office politics you have to work through when trying to get promoted into various OpCo's.

review: Excellent working environment, for the patient
pros: Your always kept up to date on new technologies, promotions, and production materials, the pay is pretty good to start off as well
cons: Customers can be difficult to handle at times, requires a lot of patient

pros:
Relativly easy work. Clearcut and simple. Safety is a top priority. Team focused on the bigger packages which are too heavy for one person.

The schedule was great for a college student. Allows for growth opportunities while still being able to attend school.
cons: Every once in awhile you get a hazardous materials package, which can be somewhat difficult to cleanup. Overall this is not really a con though.

pros: very fast paced and intense. People that I worked with were great. 401 k and health ben ifets were great.
cons: cold weather, stress, management at certain locations. Had to move to get promoted. Not much days shift management

pros: The managers were very professional and friendly. They kept the work environment positive. There wasn't much to complain about so work went smoothly.
cons: Being a package handler is not an enjoyable job but as far as the company I have no complaints.

pros: I  got the opportunity to work an scanner and just to know it was my responsibility to make sure the clients got their gifts.
cons: Making sure that safety came first and don't let night time catch up with you.

pros: It is a good workplace if you are FedEx hired,managers are really good to you,I was in the headquarters of FedEx and the view where i stayed was really good,it was a short-term assignment and i had positive experience
cons: If you are working as a vendor they see you as guests who are not paying,they treat you good but there will be a difference.

pros: FedEx is an excellent company to work for.  Employees are very loyal - many have worked there for more than 25 years.  It is a very family-friendly company that encourages employees to have a good work life balance.
cons: As with any large company, there are some things that can be frustrating to deal with, but they are fairly minor.

review: Great Place to work, but very little opportunity for advancement
pros: Stable place to work with a culture that values work life balance.
cons: Just like many other large enterprises: risk averse and political for project funding or promotions.

pros: The benefits are great. Great coworkers plus I love satisfying customers and you great raises yearly. This company loves to promote from within.
cons: Very unsafe you could get injured  very badly. The work is very hard on the body for such little pay.

review: Worst place I've have worked in my career so far
pros:
Opportunity to work with a large number of systems
Job Security
Average Benefits
Nice Facility
You can get buy doing the bare minimum and not get fired
cons:
Required 24/7 attention to job, no disconnect
Pay well below industry average
Job Titles mismatched to allow for lower pay
You are not a person, only a number.
Lack of empathy or compassion from management
People can get buy doing the bare minimum and make more than you
No real incentives for performance
After 3 years I made less than when I started

review: good job but will not get rich
pros: good job but will not get rich. work at your own pace. excellent services to sell and everyone knows fedex.
cons: you are only as good as your last goal attainment quarter/year.  a lot of computer busy work that does not help you in the sales process.

pros: Company offers great career opportunities, advancement and training. Work-life balance is generally good.
cons: Pay is good for certain career areas and mediocre in others. Benefit costs have risen significantly for employees over past 4 years and bonuses have decreased. depending on job, holiday time is stressful due to nature of business

review: Great company to work for, financial compensation  could have been better.
pros: Benefits, diversity, management support of employees, work-life balance is very important to this employer, tuition reimbursement.
cons:
Some positions, especially in IT have limited growth opportunities. 
Large corporation so at times policy and corporate wide decisions seem like a government bureaucracy.

pros: If you work hard enough, management sees that and helps you move up!
