cons: Only cons are that it's difficult to become full-time, and when you go to bid out, the competition is brutal. You just have to strive to be better than the competition!

pros: I really enjoyed the freedom of working on my own during the day, good money for hard work, enjoyed most of my co-workers
cons: Tough long hours, no social life, expecting a ton of work from routes not going out, micro managed

pros: competitive benefit packages , long time job security, strong public company, excellent training resources, tuition reimbursement, competitive salary, work form home opportunities
cons: rigid work rules, slow advancement opportunities, work from home set up is isolating in the work force, pay for performance metrics can be overly detailed and petty making salary advancement  challanging

review: Great place to work for but very hard to move up
pros: Diversified place to work at. Very flexible. Very good benefit package. Lots of opportunity to learn by taking courses.
cons: Very hard to move up. Most people will stay in their position for their entire career. If you are good at something, you will continue to do it day in day out.

pros: The team environment was great. Easy to get feedback. Great culture. It is easy to explore the work of other divisions.
cons: Some projects are more organized than others. There is sometimes a disconnect between employees and their supervisors.

pros: The office atmosphere is great!  Most people in the office are very friendly and professional.  The work is interesting and the pay rate is decent.
cons: Not everyone is in the same office building, so at times, it is necessary to commute a few blocks away to attend meetings.  It's inconvenient.

review: Good pay and benefits but job can be very physically demanding
pros: Great pay and raises, room for advancement, benefits are pretty good even for entry level workers and advancement isn't too bad
cons: Can be extremely physically demanding at times as a package handler, hours are weird and you cant really take many days off

pros: Customer Interaction, Great Team Atmosphere, Great management, Management willing to share and give advice, training systems in place to make one more knowledgeable.
cons: Outdated Systems and programs, not the most effective scheduling, not to much room for new ideas, can be a lot of work for a little pay, takes very long to move up.

pros: The company pillars are People, Service, Profit. FedEx cares about its team members above all else, then providing the utmost service levels possible, and lastly profitable. This should tell you a lot about them as an employer and I would recommend working with FedEx.
cons: Sales - Senior management currently struggles with providing a clear and concise delivery that is consistent with their verbal message.

pros: Great Benefits, Good People, Decent Pay. I have worked there for a couple years now. There are opportunities for advancement as well.
cons: When you accept the job, you need to realize that it‚Äôs hard work under sometimes extreme conditions.

review: FedEx is a great place to work.
pros: FedEx offers a broad range of career opportunities providing for lateral and promotional moves.
cons: There are no downsides of working at FedEx.  All companies have a culture and personality and the key is to find the right environment and the right fit.  FedEx is a great place to work.

pros: Benefits and job advancement opportunities. Work/ life balance is really good. FedEx is a great stepping stone to gather experience and move on.
cons: The job itself is not very challenging and therefore not really rewarding. Compensation is not there and the bonus system is a fraud.

review: i am satisified with my career at fedex
pros: it has been a good place to work for. i really like the atmosphere there and the managment are very nice.
cons: it can be very demanding at times and the hours can be very long and sometimes last 10-14 hours.

review: The interview provides falsehoods about the actual job and the job is very high stress for little reward.
pros: Decent start pay but next to nothing on raises. OK benifits when I started but have reduced to a very high cost for all.
cons: Management talks to you like a child and makes every attempt to make you feel inadiquate no matter how good of a job you do. Even though many new oppertunities open up if your not a blood relitive of Sr. empolyees you will not get the job. Not enough parking for employees and you must park blocks away on the street with tractor trailors almost running into your vehical. They have been advertising for hiring  nonstop sense I began there in 2006, this high turnover in workers should tell you something about the enviorment.

pros: Good pay for less hours compared to other part-time jobs
cons: Intensity and heat along with sweat is hard to deal with

pros: Fair pay.  Great benefits.  Good opprotunities for advancement if you work hard.  Good professional development to further your sales skills.  Overall a great company to work for.
cons: Too many internal procedures to follow.  This causes you to work more hours per week than you really need to.

review: I left FedEx years ago and Came Back in 2005 because I missed working at a GREAT company!
pros: Benefits, People First Policy, Great work environment
cons: Pay could be better but that is made up for by all of the other great aspects of the company

pros: the benefits are good and free uniforms also  bidding on jobs is a great way to promote from with in. new equipment helped me do my job better
cons: pay not in line with with the fast paced work having to work split shifts in order to get enough hours was very hard to do

review: Work environment and culture is great, but salary is low and not enough growth opportunities.
pros: One of the most admired companies with global reputation and strong C-level leadership.
cons: IT side growth opportunities are few and far between, especially in Dallas.

pros: I enjoyed building software to solve business problems.  There are lots of opportunities to do great work.  Great work-life balance.
cons: Constantly changing customer needs drives need for constant change -- not necessarily a CON.  Management will practice PSP, but you need to look out for yourself, as with most companies.

pros: Limited supervising and easy to learn hands on skills.
cons: Hours based on work load.

pros: Great American story.   Lots of teamwork and comrades..sometimes you run across lazy employees but good manager address this accordingly
cons: The job is very physical if you work in the hub. Also the weather can be extreme during mid summer and winter...dress appropriately

pros: Good pay, tuition reimbursement, benefits, upward mobility, diverse, relocation all over the world, culture, fast-paced, high quality service, proud to work for
cons: Industry by definition warrants a lot of micromanagement, always more with less, work/life balance, traditional management not interested in changes/new ideas

pros: Excellent team like atmosphere; work with some really good people. Managers are accessible and willing to provide new opportunities.
cons: Must keep rather odd hours. Depending of your particular role during a sort the physical labor can be pretty depleting.

pros: Out on my own and get work at my own pace.  Can get the job done quick.
cons: Can have too many deliveries in one day and get off late.  Or if there is not enough stops not have any work that day.

pros: The pay and benefits were pretty good for a part time job. My managers were pretty cool and respectful. There's room for advancement as well.
cons: The facility that I worked at was constantly under-staffed. The turn over rate is really high. The work is really intense. Some employees get burnt out really quickly.

pros:
Large Company with seemingly unlimited resources
Changing positions is a simple as applying and being sent off to training
Want to move to another city or state? Just apply for a new/later position.
cons:
EVERYONE is overworked.
Management is understaffed and usually frustrated as a result.
Senior management is far removed from the operation and doesn't have a clue what goes on daily (Although they think they do).

review: My experience at FedEx was good
pros: Friendly environment pay increases easy hours not really much for over time if u like to work it the kind of job for you
cons: Sometimes people don't show and it more work on others holidays are really busy and at times you may not get the work done fast enough

review: Ehh. Workload high, manager showed favoritism, didn't care about your personal responsibilities.
pros: Got alot of overtime. Insurance was good and cheap. Can't really think of anything else to say about pros of the company.
cons:
The workload was entirely too high. Impossible to complete the work in your 8 hour day and even with overtime, it was still impossible unless you stayed till 8-9pm, sometimes later. 

Manager didn't care if you had a child that needed to be picked up a certain time. But she always ran out of the door to pick up her pet dog by 6. 

I can go on and on.

pros:
Truly care about their people
Stability
Longevity
Mobility
cons: Too Stable for a young person like myself. I am looking to relocate and it is exceptionally difficult. Not the company's fault exactly, but frustrating.

pros: Horrible place to work.
cons: If your under 10 years with the company you have no seniority.  When you turn in your vacation forget about summers. You get split days off. No balance with work and home life. If you call out sick your manager for sure will ride you when you return. If you get into an accident and you hurt someone your fired. If you have 3 related vehicle accidents, or any ocurrence with your vehicle your fired.  Managers reviews don't mean a thing. If your part time you can be sent home after 3 hours. people transfering in your department from other department will bump you after six months so if your new forget it.  Managers are uneducated locker room mentality idiots. No continuous education for upper level staff. Trucks are terrible and unsafe. Tractor trailers are old seats with terrible springs and air. Lots of problems with back and knees.

pros: As secure a job as you can get in todays environment. Opportunities exist for internal job movement when things are going good.
cons: Ironically, some of the positives outlined above - job security makes people complacent and examples of seat-warmers are abundant.

review: The best "big company" to work for!
pros: World Class projects on which to work, a company with which you can be proud, and good people with whom to work.
cons: Complex company that takes a while to learn and is challenging to navigate.

review: Yard Jockey,  looking to promote to management.
pros: Fairly easy to get hired due to big turnover rate. Best insurance I have seen in a long time.
cons: I seam to have been passed up over and over again due to being over 40. Takes about a year to qualify for the medical insurance. Wages were OK. Not the worst but surly not the best.

review: Good company, antiquated in someways, unlimited upside potential for employees
pros: Pension AND 401(k) match, health insurance, ok wage, minimum hour per week pay, can work anywhere in USA, good training program
cons: Crazy hours around Christmas, must take vacation days in week long increments until you're there 10 years, some favoritism, cannot transfer to international jobs, pilots have incredible benefits that other employees are denied

review: Good organization, but vulnerable to market conditions
pros: When business is good, life is great. Excellent teamwork.  Worked at both UPS & FedEx.  FedEx is less $, but you are treated as a valued person
cons: Slow business activity leaves you scrambling to get enough hours in to live & puts you at odds with co-workers competing for available hours.

pros: full benefits and vacation time, start off as part time and become full-time very quickly, always overtime available, good raises
cons: start off as part time depending on open full time positions

pros:
Many opportunities for growth 
You learn about 
Depend on what you do the task will be easy to handle and a breeze to master in. Package handler
cons: Working on the doc in the hot weather or cold weather

review: Good Part Time Job, Difficult Full Time Job
pros:
Guaranteed hours based on Full or Part Time (35 vs 17). 
Usually much more available if you are flexible. 
Always work, especially mornings to help full time routes
cons:
Incredibly slow pay progression, you will never top out  (29$+) 
You will be stuck in 17-22$ range per hour for 10 or more years. YES 10+ years. 
Strong likelihood of injury
Not nearly enough training for full time routes . You WILL learn on the job.

pros: I am a quick learner and am able to excel in a fast paced environment and under extreme pressure. Working for FEX EX, I will be able to multi task and continue my amazing customer service experience and would quickly become a huge asset to your company.  I am neither a current or former employee.
cons: None I am aware of.

pros:
Good money for unskilled labor
The hours were perfect for a night owl like me
Very quick advancement at first. Within my first three months I had been trained on Forklifts, Tugs, and had become a material handler.
cons:
Very hard on your body.
Creepy cult-like brainwashed mentality is widespread among the workers... Seriously, these people take company loyalty to a whole new level.
I'd go home caked with dirt and dust every night.
So many people quite because our manager was incredibly short tempered that we were understaffed for quite a while. 
Almost impossible to advance very far because nobody retires anymore.

pros: It is a very laid back environment and the coworkers are very friendly.
cons: There is a lot of red tape to go through for any project that you want to work on.

pros: Great Environment! Great Management and terrific career opportunities. Senior Management clearly directs the company and sets the vision for the company. Work/life balance is important.
cons: There are not any Cons working with FedEx. The company in fantastic place to work. The only detraction is Memphis is not the most desirable place to live.

review: Work is difficult, challenging but employees are well compensated.
pros: They try to be fair to the majority and overall good of it's employees.
cons: Rely too much on outside consultants who do not fully understand areas they are consulting. Sometimes drives bad decisions.

review: PSP is just a slogan -- it's the same as other corporate cultures
pros: The corporate environment at FedEx is not demanding if you are a reasonably adept politician.
cons:
Little means of long-term advancement other than management, and little value given to skilled performers. Leadership is just plain greedy. 

Just this week there were 2 separate stories about FedEx in the news:
1) FedEx earnings estimates were down (due to weak global economy)
2) The CEO, Fred Smith, nearly doubled his salary, and Rob Carter, CEO of FedEx Services, accepted an 80% raise.

Does this sound like they care about you the worker, or you the stockholder?

pros: Good experience for someone just coming into the job force. You will learn how to interact with customers and deal with the general public. You will learn some basic sales techniques and how to up-sell products. You will also learn some basic computer skills and project management skills to put onto a resume. There are also pretty good medical and 401k benefits.
cons: There is a large learning curve and allot is expected of you as you will be filling many roles without allot of time to learn all that is needed to do your job.

review: Experience as Import Agent And Import Coordinator _Indianapolis location
pros: Good continued training opportunities amd free broker licenses.
cons: Can move up the ladder but takes time for it to have open positions.  Then when you get closer to the top the managers in charge have "favorites" that usually will get the position over "experience" or "knowledge".

review: good place to work overall. i recommend it
pros: good benefits like pay, health care, retirement programs that are easy to join and provide lots of benefits when you are old
cons: all roads lead to memphis. there is a chance to make moves up if you are willing to move every two years to lots of large cities around the world

pros: No Pros. U will b treated like u work in a sweat shop. If u r injured it will b deemed preventable and b yr fault. Mgt expects u to wrk xtra hrs when others r off.  Yr hrs will not b consistent and will be cut when mgt doesn't need u.  Training for yr job is terrible or doesn't happen.
cons: Fedex is doing poorly but employees shouldn't b treated so badly.  FX needs to return to offering psychological incentives, treat their frontline employees better. U only hear frm mgt. when u make a mistake.  Very stressful, very low morale exists and it impacts yr personal life.

pros: Not many companies provide FULL benefits for part time employment.
cons: If you are working outside of corporate in one of major hubs be prepared for current weather conditions, can be extreme due to the season.

pros: FedEx cares about the employees. There are opportunities to work in various areas and bits of training to be had. Layoffs are not a part of the culture if possible.
cons: Slow to adapt. Enterprise-sized bureaucracy prevails. Difficult to get newer techniques and technologies in-place. In some jobs you can feel lost as a gear in the machine.

review: Hard work, good part time pay
pros: Fun work environment, great part time pay, good for part time work and college classes, tuition assistance is a great plus
cons: Early hours, only 20-24 hours per week, no chance for overtime, hard physical labor, can be stressful but rewarding, manages really stress timeframe.

pros: Active job, meet new and interact with people. Great benefits to include tuition assistance. Great part-time hours and hourly wage.
cons: Can be overwhelming at times trying to meet pick-up times. Holiday season can be tiresome and expect to work late hours.

review: If only they gave enough hours
pros: Positive atmosphere, stress on safety, flexible hours. quick pay raises
cons: Not enough hours 11-14 a week. You can get sent home after an hour and a half of work. this sucks if you have to wake up early in the morning (like 4am). You have to wait a year before you get benefits.

pros: Very people focused, a really stable unique industry. The intern program is top notch
cons: Its a huge company that has all the bureaucracy of it. They don't let you do jumpseat like in castaway anymore. Salary is not competitive for entry level developers

review: Working at FedEx World Tech Center.
pros: Working as a team with on-call specialists and other co-workers at the office. The environment was very stress-free.
cons: 12 hour shifts can be exhausted during 3 day work periods. Only getting an hour break for a 12 hour shift.

pros: Great and affordable insurance for individuals or for family, career advancements to move up in the company and great management that listens and tries to help there employees.
cons: Lack of full time postions. If part time is your thing this is the place for you. Would wish they offered more full time positions.

pros: In my area, you get paid about twice minimum wage. Not bad for unskilled labor.
cons: Unreliable hours. Unreliable managers. Unreliable Equipment. More often than not, I was cut due to lack of work. More often than not I couldn't get my boss' attention off his tejano music video to do more than point out what chute was 75% or 100% full.  This is not a place for the slow, weak, or those easily bored. There's  no room to advance as they hire outside. They never ASK anyway.

pros: FedEx is a solid company with a great reputation. There is/was a wealth of talented individuals from whom you can learn. As with any large company, some people are extremely easy to get along with and some aren't. Good pay and benefits.
cons: Afraid the People-Service-Profit philosophy is being replaced by Profit-Service-Profit.

pros: Teamwork was incredible,  support and promotes employees from within first, I ended up with a great, supportive, kind manager with great leadership skills but most managers there were just concerned about getting the packages delivered only
cons: Work schedule was crappy, and not healthy for good consistent work performance. Not favorable work hours you have young children

pros: Allowed to take chances to make improvements in operation. Several opportunities to work with customers and sales people to increase business for building and district. Opportunity to earn different certifications to help improve employee skills.
cons: Some district managers did not provide opportunities for local management talent and only used out of area people. Lacked support for local team

review: Mostly positive, rough at times, but that comes with any job.
pros: Pure corporate structure with an emphasis on business. Great place to excel and make a decent paycheck.
cons: Not for the feint of heart, can be extremely cutthroat at times. Lots of pressure to meet deadlines.

review: Great company ethic to it's people, customers, and value proposition.
pros: Ethical company with a work life balance.  As a professional staff member you have give and take on both side.  Balance, not perfection is the goal.
cons: It's still up to an individual to set boundaries to maintain work life balance, but in my experience this has not been an issue.

review: A really Frustrating experience. FedEx don't value your qualification and expertize
pros: No pros. It is totally a mess.20 % people will work  like donkeys and the remaining 80 % are enjoying  as they are manger's pets/ relatives / friends. If you don't have any hold with mangers your life and future is gone.
cons: Very  low salary .I have worked for 26K for almost 4 years with nominal increment of 20 to 40 dollar yearly. After having  a masters and couple of years IT experience failed to get a decent job within Fedex. and ultiamtely end up in quit and I have landed in a IT job with  a staring salary of 70 K.I truely wasted my valuable 4 years with Fedex

pros: Great company benefits. Raises are minimal at 2 percent a year so you are there for the benefits not the pay.
cons: Since raises and pay are minimal job is not for someone who needs to make the money for the head of household.

pros: The teammates are all friendly there is a great work environment. The HR staff is the best anywhere and are very knowledgeable on all aspects of employment.
cons: While employed there I did not find any cons to speak of. Others complained of lack of parking space close to the building.

review: A company you truly want to retire from.
pros: This is a wonderful company that's culture is driven by its people. People first, the purple promise, worklife balance. I've never worked for a company before that cared so much about its workforce.
cons: I truly cannot think of any cons in FedEx it is been a wonderful experience.

pros: The job is relatively high paying for a position that doesn't require any prior experience. There are also solid benefits if you work there long enough.
cons: Depending on the location of the facility and time of year, your hours can be cut drastically at my position. The labor is also physically demanding

pros: Great technology company, full benefits, retirement pension, pays very well.  Freedom to perform job with empowerment to execute as needed.
cons: I honestly don't have any cons.  I had an amazing job with the best management.  You have to be flexible and handle stress well.  That's corporate America.

pros: Good flexibility with Work and Life Balance, great salaries, friendly diverse work staff.  Flexible in allowing some work from home.
cons: You will need to try to have as much education and experience coming in the door.

pros: Company culture is great, they really care about the employees and it shows. The benefits are fantastic. Good work/life balance.
cons: Tough to find answers sometimes. Different messages from direct management and upper management. Internal systems and processes need work.

pros: Great benefits, food was catered by Chic Fila and other local businesses,  2 weeks paid time off.
cons: Alot of older people who can't pull their load of work. Too many stubborn and lazy people.

review: Great people, slow development and corporate processes
pros: ewarding work, free training, free travel, great people, desire to modernize and advance
cons: Very slow processes, large code-base is hard to change, pay is slightly low

review: Hard to advance past this part time job
pros: The pay is pretty good. There will be some form of benefits after one year. The work is not too hard and  some of the managers are sympathetic since they worked as part time package handlers.
cons: Hard to pin down  when there will be career advancement. Not just more hours added to the shift but a full time job with benefits.

pros: various opportunities career changes within the company. strong "people first" culture. Laid back culture, business casual, strong commitment to community service. Flexible work schedule and family friendly environment
cons: Limited levels of promotion for professionals, very little upward mobility and growth, performance management very subjective, even in new system. Maternity leave only 5 weeks of partial pay

pros: FedEx is a great place to work.  They have many people in the department working many exciting projects.
cons: There are many people in the department who may not add much value or benefit of the goal of the department.

review: A great experience with opportunity to grow
pros: Talented peers, good work/life balance, challenging projects, fair compensation, and the opportunity to transition into other fields.
cons: Being this large has its disadvantages such as the burdensome project approval processes, coordination problems, and politics.

review: great company, not much negative to say
pros: Fantastic corporate culture, wonderful brand, ability to interact and learn from senior mgmt
cons: Promotional opportunities are not plentiful, just not much turn over from those above.  And yearly salary increases are ok, but nothing that will change your life

review: FedEx is not a good company.
pros: Good Benefits and 401K match was decent. The brand is well known and a common name in the industry.  There are many locations to seek employment.
cons: Health Insurance is not what it used to be,  Insane amount of hours and no lunch allowed if you are in management and the pay is peanuts compared to the amount of work you do. FedEx has a habbit of understaffing to hit operational metrics but never shows it's employees the truth about if their operation is making or losing money. They are rude to customers, overcharge them for anything they can and damage alot of shipments. Additionally, their is poor top down communication and little to no cross communication from the different departments.

review: Fast pace work place with a fair amount of responsibility, and work ethic learning experience.
pros: Good leadership, and management, everyone is friendly and knowledgeable about what needs to get done for things to operate smoothly in a timely fashion.
cons: Significant amount of volume for only 4 employees (one manager) included trucks full of tires, boxes of paper, and heavy axles

pros: Stability and opportunity to advance
cons: Senior leadership with antiquated view of management and sales philosophy. Pay not inline with market value. Advancement opportunity ends at district manager unless you REALLY become a sycophant and play the game.

pros: Great pension plan for all the old timers, if you got hired after 1990, not good at all.   Pays very well compare to UPS or Ontrac.
cons: Its all about the bottom line and the new 401k plan is not as good as the old pension plan.

pros: Lots of internal growth, creativity to try your own processes and solutions in the market.  Lots of upward mobility.
cons: Company is making more money now than anytime else in the history of FedEx, yet driver, operations, sales, and manager salaries have remained stagnant.

pros: Nice, friendly people. Learning opportunities. Lots of opportunities for career advancements like P2L (Lead roles), L2M(manager roles), Purple Pipeline(Director role) and so on. Great salary for the location.
cons: Laid back culture, low performers can keep the job, few holidays (no black friday, only one day of Christmas), old technology stack (many systems are still legacy)

pros: Well i've been doing it for quite a while despite all the other jobs and offers i've had. This is one i can't seem to bring myself to leave. Therefore, it must be a good place to work
cons: If they outweighed the pros, I would have left a long time ago.

review: Great place to work while in school or seeking a second source of income
pros: Excellent way to get paid to "workout". Superb tuition re-imbursement program along with employee benefits even though all the positions are just PT.
cons: Minimal career advancement oppertunities unless you are willing to relocate within the company. To focused on the negative rather than mixing in some positive. Makes everyone fear for the potential loss of their job.

pros: Power of the brand.  Great reputation.  Pretty much leave you alone as long as you produce.  Full sponsored pension as well as 401K.
cons: Only downside is they don't always pay you on what you sell.  Health benefits aren't the greatest.

pros: I was with FedEx for 6 years and worked with a great team of people.
cons: I started after one of the last cost of living increases, and pay rates were frozen for a while before they were decreased. It took the rest of my time with the company to get back to where I'd started when I was hired.

pros: Great benefits, good amount of vacation time. Interesting work with the opportunity to meet people from all over the world.
cons: Working all holidays except Christmas and New Year's Day. Long hours with mandatory overtime. Not much room for advancement. Pay is low but overtime helps.

review: A great company to work for. Great benefits and very good personnel policies
pros: People friendly, great team spirit, Good benefits. Management is serious about keeping employee morale up. One of the best companies to work for.
cons: Medical benefits are getting less attractive. Reflects a general trend though. Memphis has limited options and aside from FedEx there are not many great employers in this town.

review: My expirience at FedEx was a good one, I learned the value of hard work.
pros: Flexible schedule. Weekends off. Payed every Friday.
cons: Hard work with no help. The harder you work the more they will take advantage off you. Takes a long time to move up.

review: Worked for a great manager in a busy hub, a good part-time job for someone looking for a little extra spending money.
pros: Great manager, decent training.
cons: Incredibly fast-paced work environment, sometimes overwhelming. Very low pay, only good as supplemental income.

pros: Employee importance takes the top position when talking about FedEx. Team work is the key here. Recently started adopting new technologies on board. Teams are more like families.
cons: Still some old technologies are being used. Advancement of personal career is not fast.

pros: Pros: Very easy job considering it is manual labor. FedEx does a great job of staying up to speed on technologies that help improve employee efficiency
cons: Taking off work is a hassle, no cohesion between management, Very few cons, but it is an overall decent place to work

review: It's a great company to work for.
pros: Always busy which I like. Promote inside the company. Night shift isn't as bad as everyone makes it seem.
cons: When it gets backed up the 12 hour days come in. Weather weather and weather again.

pros: Great Time off, transparency for the most part. Well respected company. Room for growth.
cons: If you are a great worker additional tasks (mostly managerial tasks that they don't want or cannot handle) will be thrown in your lap.

pros: Give you great hours if wanted. Not on a point system . Give you opportunities to bid on a different job description to work your way up with the company. Offer car insurance .
cons: No 401k plan an less your management . Work becomes very physical becomes hard on your body.

pros: Benefits are awesome and enjoy working at Fedex been there for iver 10 years always communicate with your manager and lead people. I work part time
cons: Working out in mother nature rain snow ice heat is a part of fedex that you will have to get use to a lot of people can not with the environment

review: FedEx is a Positive environment to work in and a CHANGE company that manages through the tough times effectively!
pros: FedEx is a CHANGE company and manages through the tough times effectively!
cons: the constant chnages can make it difficult for employees to stay focused

pros: Work is not hard and there aren't a lot of deadlines. Flex time is standard and there isn't a clock to punch.
cons: The industry is aging & shrinking and the company will have to shrink with the industry. There are silos in work areas that contributes to duplication of work efforts.

review: It is a good place to work if you are in school or to have as a second job.
pros: If you want, you can learn a lot and move up in the company. Everyone starts at the bottom, so they can relate to at all levels.
cons: Everything is on you. You get what you put in to it.

review: It was a challenging but great place of employment.
pros: The team was great. Everyone helped one another. There were always opportunities for advancement. The environment was extremely fast paced leaving very little moments of down time.
cons: When the conveyor belt malfunctioned, the overall workflow came to a sudden stop. There were times when it shut down for hours.

review: Wonderfull job if the investors weren't trying to soak every dime from the company and take it away from the employees
pros: The benefits are still good for the employees. Every year they cover less and cost more.
cons: Upper management not being realistic about work loads for hourly employee

pros: Easy, laid back, just some days their are some trailers full of heavy items then it get hard like that time goes by fast
cons: Some of the supervisors their like to just stare at you for long periods of time while you are working it's like they think you going to steal something it gets very annoying

pros: The incentives awesome people very friendly
cons: Really none every employer have rules that must be kept and follwed

pros: Good work life balance, salary, health and retirement benefits. Also, wage increases are provided each year based on performance.
cons: Lack of retiree health benefits so will need to work until at least 65 to be eligible for Medicare.  Also, training is poor at times.

pros: All of the people that I work with are very friendly and are a pleasure to work with. I also like that it a a fun job to have
cons: It can be a very stressful job at times, but the cool thing is that you have a lot of people that are able to help you

review: Good for a part time job
pros:
Good hard work for exercise, don't need a gym. 
Work time was just enough that you are not too tired by the end.
cons:
Little unorganized and can get confusing at time.
Kind of throws you into the job with little time to fully grasp but also help learn it fast

pros: Work\life balance, benefits are good.
cons: Some mid-level employees are not as competent as they need to be and should have been let go during the recent lay-offs.

review: Is great working at FedEx Services, but  could do better with salary at the mid level career.
pros: Good health care benefit, excellent work balance, and potential for upward movement if you really work very hard.
cons: Entry level and mid career level salaries are behind the industry level for IT professionals.

pros:
Very friendly Enviorment to work for
Company pay 100% Pension
Good Technology used in IT
Work Life balance is very good.
cons:
Medical Insurance is not so good
Growth is stagnant
Pay  is OK but not good as compared to other companies

review: not a best place to work for any more
pros: internal job transfers, customer focused
cons: The company lost its charm during the recession. Reduced compensation, most of the employee benefits were removed, suspended 401k, laid off employees. All these happened during recession and then immediately hired lot of contractors. HR and senior management has to do a better job of keeping employees happy. If not it will be just another company and employee attrition may increase as the economy gets back to track.

pros: The benefits were very competitive. The work load was constant, so the oppurtunity to get hours was always there.
cons: The pay doesn't match the work. Workers there have a very demanding job physically, and the pay that the get is on the lower part of the pay scale.

pros: Fedex has really invested  a lot of their resources (i.e., time; money & energy) towards creating a postive "employee centerd" work environment  & culture that puts their people first & actvely invests in programs that supports employee growth &  development.
cons: The company has a lot of politics...

review: Great place to work ... bureaucracy can be frustrating
pros:
- Super people-oriented and family-friendly
- Large company - quality benefits
- Nice work location and campus
cons: Takes forever to get anything done due to multiple levels of approval, consensus-building

pros: Amazing work culture. Really care about you and will support you and will expect same in return. Sometime need to work extra but also will see understanding of you need to come in late one day due to sick child.
cons: Large company beurocracy. Sometimes hard to get decision on cross opco projects

pros: Since we are contracted, we have a lot of freedom. It is nice to be able to focus on the job and not have someone breathing down your neck.
cons: You buy your own benefits. Although the income seems good, the expense of insurances can add up quickly

pros: You have an outstanding reputation, my family & friends trust this company with their most sentimental treasures.
cons: I've hear this company only have temporary positions. I don't personally no anyone, but when I told friends you guys were hiring, their responds was, don't get to comfortable.

pros: great work life balance, great atmosphere, lot's of opportunity to move upward in company
cons: micro-management, a lot of focus on non-job related activities, may take a while to move up because so much competition for positions with such a large company. Becomes a hierarchy waiting game.

pros: There is Insurance is available . There are Sick days. They do hire veterans. Not much else is good unfortunately.
cons:
Long standing , make sure your shoe are comfy. You make not much more than minimum wage even though u are responsible for manager job task anyways. 
Customer at the Chicago river north location are rude and too demanding  most of the time except for a few. ( "I need this yesterday ") well then you should have gotten it done sooner, not my fault you procrastinated. 

You're often by your self even though it's "rush hour" 

The other fedex sents us their work order too so it's even busier than normal locations

Too much work that I can not justify with too little pay. Moving on to next job.

review: Great job, but it wasn't what it was advertised as.
pros:
It's honest, straight forward work
For an entry level job it pays fairly well
During peak season you get a full 40 hours a week and plenty of overtime
There are some pretty neat incentives
Periodic raises
cons:
Hours are poor and inconsistent when it's not peak season
I was lied to about benefits and my 401k and it took me over a month to get a straight answer
PT can make as little as 8-10 hours a week and FT averages out at about 28-30 hours a week
Not allowed overtime when it's not peak season
We don't always get breaks when we should

pros: FedEx has an excellent culture. I could see the people service profit theme revolving around the entire workplace.
cons: As an intern they were fairly helpful to me, but my project was not well defined when I came in.

pros: You can learn a lot . Good company to work for . Employees are very nice . Management is well organized .
cons: I didn't find any cons. They just need to hire more people for getting jobs done on time . Some locations have heavy work load .

review: Two years at FedEx while going to school
pros:
Great shipping discounts. 
Very on top of employee rights as far as pay and pay benefits went.
cons:
Very quickly lost much of its culture. 
Demanding and stressful. 
Very little or no fun as a team off-the-clock. 
Not a good part-time job, they want lifers.

review: Easy job the only thing about it that is hard is dealing with the elements.
pros: Easy decent pay no micro management everyone is helpful now I have to get to the 20 word minimum s
cons:
In Texas it's hot and the trailers feel like small ovens so you get slow roasted for 8-10 hours
A

pros: work life balance, strong management to help foster development, multiple opportunities to get involved in different programs, assistance with promoting to sales positions
cons: difficult to manage territory given resources,  continually pushed to make calls, responsible for unnecessary admin work. Easy to move in company IF you are willing to work in Memphis TN at HQ

pros: Great Ops. Manager couldn't ask for a better one. Good benefits after a year. Steady work and its early enough so you can work another job easily.
cons: Only about 7 out of 22 PH actually care enough to help whenever you're station gets slammed, but they're usually not around. They want you to do the work of at least 2 ppl where I was doing the work of 3. It gets old really quick.

review: People friendly .... a little too much.
pros: Full time pay for part time work. Good benefits. Strong focus on work / life balance.
cons: Tenure is valued over talent. Performance is not rewarded in the compensation system. Mediocrity is encouraged. There is no accountability for results. Management is weak and unwilling or unable to make decisions. Resources are scattered across hundreds of meaningless efforts instead of focused on the critical projects. Nepotism is rampant.

pros: Job security, benefits (401k, pension, health) Employees, Direct Report Management, Experience...learned a ton about an industry I didn't know existed.
cons: Slow to advance in the company b/c upper positions have low turn over.  Salary was not at market rates..they wanted to pay you like a customer service rep, rather than a customs broker.

pros: It's an easy job to get.  If you can walk and chew gum at the same time, the job is yours.Thats about the only good thing I can say.
cons: packages of all shapes and sizes coming at you a million miles a minute, managers barking at you like a drill sergeant that you're not moving fast enough, you will leave work completely drained of energy, very high potential for serious injury. In fact, when I started, everyone I talked to said they suffered an injury and they told me it's inevitable. One guy got heat exhaustion, another said he suffered a concussion.

review: It has been a good learning experience
pros: Started in college, that was the biggest plus.  Set hours and good benefits, specifically for students.
cons: After a while, you begin to feel not really wanted.  And although they say they hire internally it really takes quite a bit for any sort of relocation.

pros: Good teamwork is a great thing to look forward to on the job, but thats about it. Personal Growth is good on if you consider working their for a few years. Get into management all others jobs are a waste of time if your looking to make some serious money.
cons: Alot of negative things about the job. Peak season is highly frustrating and munch of the lack of effort. Peak season involves the heaviest freight during the city. Peak season is between october and january mostly the holiday season

pros: Driven by people first philosophy.  The benefits were outstanding and the leadership team were the best.
cons: There is limited advancement opportunities as one progresses through the organization.

pros: Good management. Flexible around schedule if you have another job. Fair pair and n√∫mero use opportunities to advance in pay and job position.
cons: I don't feel like there are any cons.

pros: You get to travel the world and meet new people. The majority of my coworkers are great people to fly with. I've made many friends over the years.
cons: I'm on the road for long periods of time so I am always glad to get back home. Jet lag really gets to you on those international flights.

pros: Great benefits and pay. Everyone in the company gets an opportunity to advance before the outside world does.
cons: Need more full time opportunities, but that's not a big deal for me.

pros: FedEx is a great place to work if you do drugs and just arent ready to give up that high. Theres plenty of potential to move up and most management is right there with you in the drug use catagory.
cons: Advancing is a long drawn out process (obviosly) because if you intend to show any ambition of moving up, you could be easily used solely for production purposes. They like to pass over people like that, basically leading them on. Its quite frustrating.

pros: Talented team members. Leadership is supportive. Pay rate is excellent. Benefits are ok, used to be awesome.
cons: Some people in management are actually technical people who were promoted into management without much training. A good coder isn't necessarily a good manager.

review: one of the best comoany i ever wored
pros: i would reccomended to everyone if your looking for easy clean nice.managers  part time job you never feelnit you worked managers friendly
cons: the only thing i preferredto work a compnay is if the managers nice all i care is that and they got the best ones

pros:
Good company opportunity to move up and plenty of overtime. I can work 20+ hrs in overtime per pay period. The most hrs I have work is 143 hrs in 1 pay period. That is my best paycheck to date. 
The more you work the quicker you accumulate the sick hours and personal time.
cons: too much responsibility for amount of money Fedex pay.

pros: Very laid back, but with opportunities for go getters.  There are lots of opportunities to go to different work groups.
cons: Lower salary, but there is education assistance.  Memphis has brutal weather.  The average age is very old as many people have been at fedex for 25+ years

pros:
Pay raises are Fair
Vacations & Holiday pay have improved the Package handlers life greatly
cons: Operations can be runned smoother at times.  Constant improvement will only change that.

pros: Really is a People First Service next Profit last company.  A real leader in Memphis & had great pride in saying I worked for FedEx
cons: Trying to move from hourly to salary is hard

review: Awesome place to work. Great benefits such as healthcare, good bonuses and opportunities for advancements .
pros: Flexible working environment. Work with people from all over the world.
cons: They pay more for an external candidate, than their own  internal employees.

pros: Great place to work, plenty of freedom, great employees, company culture and upper management.
cons: Don't expect to get rich here, and not much much opportunity for growth. Maybe in other parts of the US, but California is saturated.

pros: Easy to add to the schedual take time off and okay pay close to home and okay managers
cons: Low pay you can't ever get extra hours. They tend to always send you home early which is less pay

pros: Big company with plenty of resources and the ability to move around the company in different jobs.  Jobs at Express are posted internally first.
cons: Can be a bit of a monster and a beast.  Slow moving at times and very bureaucratic with policies for policies sake.

pros: Working in FedEx gave me great work life balance. I learnt new things every day. People here are really nice and are willing to help.
cons: Memphis might not be an ideal place for young people who wants to have fun in most weekend. Career Opportunities might also be less than other companies.

pros: They have a great benefits package that they offer their employees. Insurance is basically free since they give you an HRA account. They have flexible schedules. Great pay.
cons: Slow career advancements. Best employer in small town so positions usually don't open fast. High deductibles if you go to the ER or see a specialist.

pros: FedEx is a great company that instills loyalty with their employees.  All employees know that their #1 job is to take care of customers.  The company, in turn, takes very good care of their employees.
cons: Pay for low level jobs is good but not quite as good for higher level positions.

pros: Stable, opportunity for growth, lots of training, easy to sell, great brand recognition and a general atmosphere of caring for their employees
cons: commission is capped, promotions can be difficult, losing some of the culture as they continue to grow. it can be difficult to get something changed that is ineffectual.

pros: Benefits are outstanding... employees get full-time benefits even when they are part-time... vacation and health benefits are outstanding
cons: Most people start here as a part-timer. It takes a very long time to get a full-time opportunity. If you can survive on the part-time salary, this is the place to be.

pros: The job is easy - you can literally finish your day of work within your first 3 hours.
cons: You will get screwed out of literally every bonus. Accounts are aligned based on one person on Memphis and if you find that an account that shouldn't be yours is negatively affecting you, they don't care. You can fix it for 6 months from now but have to eat it for 2 quarters. Also, management is completely clueless.

pros: Mgmt for Fedex pls read
cons: Mgmt Fedex pls read employee scamming system CB.

review: FedEx - one of the best companies to work.
pros: Employee base is a group of wonderful people - people that care about their work, their coworkers and the customer.  Wonderful work environment.
cons: Sometimes needed to travel, which meant being away from family.

review: You too can be a corporate drone at FedEx!
pros: Great brand, decent opportunities for training.
cons: Very political, and a good ole boys club.

review: FedEx is a great place to work!
pros: FedEx has very competent management and executives, as well as providing the necessary resources to get projects completed. FedEx builds employee morale and focuses on employee satisfaction and work/life balance.
cons: No cons that any large company has to endure, such as a large amount of red tape and  in some cases.

pros: Salary, lots of unusual benefits, tech forward.  Reliable, solid company.  Don't believe in cutting workers unless absolutely necessary.  Profit sharing for those not on commission based salary is great when the market is up.
cons: Mobility is almost impossible if you don't live in Memphis, TN. Unless you live close to world HQ, or are very willing to relo, it's almost impossible to move up within the company.  Upper management is out touch.  Lots of RahRah management speak, but reality doesn't come close to what they preach.  Very much in the box....

pros: Pay, job security, pride of working for FedEx.
cons: Working in a cubicle farm is very irrating because of the noise level of others conversations. No one seems to care that you have work to do and need to concentrate. They talk loud as if no one else is around.

pros: Great Company to work for, easy service to sell.  Great Management benefits.  amazing perks that come along with the position and just working for FedEx.
cons: I have nothing to complain about.

pros: Great benefits, co workers, managers, etc. Felt like family. Every one knows every one. Decent hours. Great pay for the job.
cons: Can sometimes be hectic. Sometimes can be disorganized. There will favoritism depending on where you are. At times, some people are carrying a heavier workload than others.

pros: Only been employed for a week. I've went through the defensive driving class and I am scheduled for courier school next.
cons: No cons so far. Everyone I have worked with and met are very nice

pros: Great benefits program, the company has great incentives for travel and relocation packages to help employees elevate their careers within the company. Easy to apply internally for a position.
cons: Sales incentives are not very good, base salary is average or below average of what other employers in the area pay.

pros: Excellent  employee to work work with good work  enironment to work  in
cons: if you are a tempory employee their a chance you might not get hired and I personnal feel if  you have  worked at a place  for a year you should be hired

pros: People Care; they seek ways to solve problems. Very open to suggestions and solutions from new people.
cons: Huge, Self-discovery and learning is expected; can be arduous trying to understand the acronyms and processes.

pros: it is a fun job to work around aircraft and make a difference in the world by delivering packages
cons: with such a big work space it is hard to keep up with everyone working, so some of your coworkers will slack

pros: Health Benefits package is more affordable then my previous place of employment. I have Sundays off which is a plus because I attend church in Sundays. I enjoy learning something new about transportation and warehouse everyday that I am here. Not sure how much longer I will be working here because of the hours.
cons: Must work from the bottom for a year before you can advance to a better paying position coming in the door. The physical labor is challenging at 52 years of age.

pros: Great Team environment and learning experience on how to receive and ship packages.
cons: The company tries hard not to give overtime even if you worked over hours in a day because it got too busy. They will have you come in later or leave earlier so you don't go over 40 hours for the week. Upper Management is not honest and they will choose who to put in leadership position based on favoritism instead of experience or training. This had made me decide to leave FedEx in the near future and work for someone else.

pros: great company to work for if you do not have a life or a family. pay is decent and comparable to the competition.
cons: long hrs especially during the holidays. the supervisors are arrogant and pompous jerks. everyone is for themselves, so do your job and go home and have a drink.

pros:
You know what you're going to be doing all day, every day.  No surprises.  It's set up to be like a data entry job.  If you are content to turn yourself into a robot for 9 hours a day, then this job is perfect for you.  After moving to a position involving wildly varying pace, uncertainty, and anxiety, I miss this sometimes.

Good vacation benefits.  Medical benefits used to be good, but were getting severely cut around the time I left.
cons:
Boring isn't a strong enough word to describe the work.  I had days where even after 9 hours of sleep the night prior, I would still have to struggle so hard to stay awake that it was physically painful.  The environment is horribly stale.  Quiet.  No decorations.  The work experience is a drudgery grind.

And this would be fine, if employees were allowed to engage in periodic distraction.  A glance at something on the web now and then is enough to keep the brain awake.  Consider also that you're given hard metrics on productivity, so it really shouldn't be a problem if you stay within them.

But no distractions of any kind are officially permissible except for listening to music through headphones.  Doing absolutely anything else with your time while in the office provokes politics.  You could produce the highest numbers in the office and then get in trouble for being unproductive for 10 minutes - not exaggeration, this literally happened.

The regional manager is also horribly obsessive-compulsive - once demanding that my co-worker put his monitor in the same position on his desk as everyone else on the cubicle block, even though doing so aggravated his carpal tunnel.  

The politics are ridiculous.  Favoritism runs deep and rampant.  Upper management will create rules just to bully and micromanage certain employees they don't like, while nothing is enforced on others.  Most of the favorites were people who were barely productive, and spent most of their time trying to get productive employees in trouble for sport.  And the excessively detailed rules created the perfect environment for bullying to take place.

There was one clique in particular who produced the lowest numbers in the office, worked several hours of overtime every day even during periods where anybody else would get written up for clocking out 1 minute past 8 hours, and they would pick on people relentlessly.  They would rotate targets for harassment, and take turns walking past their target's desk periodically to see what they were doing.  If it was anything other than focusing exclusively on work, they would immediately complain, and that person would get written up.  This was an ongoing state of affairs for all 7 years I worked in that office.

Also, any communication regarding pay or the value of your work from corporate was always extremely insulting.  Best example:  there is a fundraising drive every year for United Way.  Every year they show a promotional video.  One year, they had one of the company's top executives introduce the video by saying "We're all feeling the effects of the economic recession", while wearing his immaculate suit and politician's smile.  They then proceeded to show a little documentary bit about how *one of our own co-workers* didn't make enough money to take care of her kid, and how United Way helped her to make ends meet.  And then asked us to donate...

pros: FedEx is a great company to work for compared to other companies because of the higher pay rate and the decent benefits. Now they do expect hard labor and favoritism is around but it's like that at all jobs.. They off better pay than most jobs around now so I would say it is a win.
cons: The hours of work would cause me to stay asleep all night simply so I can make it to work on time. You have to be disciplined at managing your schedule and your work life.

pros: Great place to work and start your career. Everyone is friendly helping you all the time
cons: No cons to provide, one suggestion is try to provide some training classes for interns

pros: The hours are in the morning if that is what you are looking for.  Pay was respectable.  Nice benefits with tuition help for college students
cons: No cons for the company.  The hours were not what I wanted to work but they could be perfect for someone else.

review: Great company - pace of change slow
pros: Excellent job security and exposure to all modes of transport, including aviation. Excellent benefits, nice people. Challenge is there, if you want it.
cons: Slow pace of change. A lot of employees unwilling to change/grow.

pros: Enjoyed working for the company. Have to have social customer service skills. Interact with individuals throughout the day.
cons: Have a better fleet of trucks to prevent downtime for company and driver. Customer will always receive package on time if trucks don't break down.

pros: Its ok pay in concord CA move up fast if you no how to use jcat. Excellent group of employees and managers. Health care.
cons: Need more full-time routes and can uses a majer upgrade to their technology  systems. Could use a higher top out for 5+ yr employees.

pros: Amazing company with caring leadership.  Benefits are incredible, solid career, definitely above the norm and continues to win awards which are well earned.
cons: Holidays are busy, competition is there, but FedEx wins service so the brand is outstanding.

pros: Some of the best reasons to work at Fed Ex are you get to meet a lot of people. And you get a lot of experience dealing with material handling.
cons: Some of the downsides of working at the location where I work is that you have a lot of down time.

pros: i like to work in Fedex trade Network because it is a name brand company in the world.
cons: they don't like to pay more which is very bad in view of me

review: Great place to work, with limited advancement opportunities.
pros: Great people, decent benefits, lots of opportunity for development. FedEx is a great training ground to learn and develop skills.
cons: Old boys club, limited opportunities for advancement, not very progressive with maternity/paternity leave or vacation. It is hard to advance in to management. Management seems to take for granted the high performers and don't seem concerned about providing opportunities for high performs. To much focus on seniority.

pros:
1. Low stress work environment and good work-life balance. People treat each other with respect (for the most part)
2.  Certain departments are open to hiring H-1B workers
cons: 1. Career becomes stagnant unless politically savvy (kissing upwards)

review: Working Experience at FedEx LATAM, Miami, Florida
pros: Great corporate culture.  Everybody works well together and there is a great deal of respect, admiration, and consideration among employees. Great team and individual contributor environment!
cons: Need to have succession planning that mentors and considers local talent first.

pros: this company offers great benefits. The pay is average and the atmosphere is friendly. After training is complete you are still able to ask questions
cons: the hours can be aggravating when you have to work on weekends. It can be tedious to sit in front of a computer all day

pros: Flexibility. It is a privilege to be able to telecommute. Benefits are decent. P-S-P --> People, Service, Profit.
cons: Career path is lacking. Over a decade and I have not been promoted to advisorship. There are a few groups where women, I feel, are not given the opportunities, promotions men are given.

review: It is a great inviroment with a lot of room to grow. LAX aircraft maintenance base.
pros: Easy hours 5-1:30 monday through friday. As long as you do your work efficiently management does not get on your case.
cons: No complaints from me at this time.

review: Good place to work in Memphis
pros: Great work life balance and generally competent nice people.  Executive management treats workers with respect.
cons: Because it is such a large organization there is a ton of bureaucracy.  Knowing who to call and what to ask is one of the most important skills at FedEx.

pros: The benefits and hours are awesome. People stay here for years and there is a reason why.
cons: The only challenge was on my part. I thought I could do two part time jobs, this being one of them. For a part time job, it can be a little demanding than most.

review: Currently working as a part time courier
pros: Great benefits, enjoy working out doors, family environment and descent pay.
cons: Can be Stressfull during a p1 cycle also is very hard to get full time also there is a new system called DRA that has screwed up some routes

review: A good place to work and have fun.
pros:
Fun, fast-paced place to work
Training involves a couple weeks of classes and passing a drivers test
Vacation and hours are pretty flexible January-October
cons: Long work hours from Thanksgiving to Christmas but better pay

pros:
- Stability
- Competitive pay
- Ability to transfer with seniority 
- Promotes from within
- Benefits
cons:
- Nature of the job (i.e. unpredictable work days, working a lot around the holidays)
- Physical nature can wear the body down after a number of years

pros: man!!! this is the best job at fedex express.
cons: the time it takes to get into this position varies greatly, and the pay is on the low end for the responsibility.

pros: ever changing environment as far as job expectations, duties, how to do the job
cons: workload expectations sometimes very stressful.  Multi tasking is a common word, but is often hard to do with an eye for detail and an ear for the customers needs

pros: Excellent company, benefits, and brand.  A true people first corporation.  It just needs to make things less operational and more customer centric.
cons: A little too bureaucratic.  Things need a lot of convincing to upper management to happen.  Budgets are tight.

pros:
- room for growth
- lots of busy work, especially during peak times
- decent pay for what we do
- LWOP option if it gets slow
cons:
- treated as just a number at times
- favoritism between supervisors and employees
- incompetent supervisors

pros: Not as physically difficult as they say. Meet some new people. Pretty good pay.
cons: Told me that wearing hoodies were against the rules. Not many English speaking associates. Just the managers spoke English. Management never gives you a location to work, you have to find it yourself.

pros: Great paid time off and cheap health insurance.
cons: Bad management, poor communication, HR doesn't do HR functions, turnover is at an all time high, morale is at an all time low, new people don't have a desk to sit at when they get out of training, there is nowhere to park, brand new employees start out making more than employees who have been with the company for more than 5 years.

pros: The boss, Phil is super cool and it's overall just a great place to work.
cons: It's a little bit stressful in the morning but once you're out on the road it's a cakewalk.

pros: Always keep you in the loop in terms of company performance and goals. FedEx invest in the company‚Äôs success. Promotes Positive Work Environment
cons: I don't think you will get along with my boss or colleagues. Having a boss you click with can really make a difference in your on-the-job happiness.

pros: One of the best reasons to work at FedEx is that it is a Fortune 500 company that provides each of its employees a chance to make a difference.
cons: One of the downsides of working for FedEx is that it can sometimes be a challenge to balance life and work.

pros: Decent pay, especially if you‚Äôre topped out.  The hourly pay depends on where you work.  Higher cost of living areas pay more.  As long as people shop on the internet there will always be job security.   Shipping discount.  Ability to transfer to other cities.
cons: Sometimes erratic hours as operational needs are foremost.   Long days not good for young families, as you will miss all after school events.  Your pay and progression is based solely on your seniority, not by your efforts or merits.

pros: Fred Smith. Confident that FedEx will be a leader as long as he is at the helm.
cons: Long hours and things are always changing.

review: Kinko's is off the name and sadly it looks more and more like a sign of things to come
pros: Decent pay, great shipping discount, many locations worldwide, opportunity to learn a great deal about printing, computers and shipping.
cons:
Systematically they have removed all the old Kinko's upper management.  
Way too focused on immediate profit rather than growing the customer base. 
Stores are understaffed and employees are overworked.
All of the creativity and innovation has been quashed and replaced with corporate mandates.

pros:
You're rarely expected to work long hours, unless something blows up.
Fairly competitive salaries in an inexpensive location.
Keep your head down and your mouth shut and you'll likely stay employed, unless you just happen to be selected in the next layoff lottery.
Great place to work if you're female or a minority; corporate policies are very vigilant about discrimination due to race, gender, sexual orientation, etc.
cons:
Morale is pretty bad these days, given recent layoffs (which seemed pretty random) and last year's pay cuts. Lots of corporate Rah! Rah! marketing programs, emails, posters which for most of us actually are very counter-productive. For the 12th time in 13 years FedEx was voted in Forbes' Top 100 Places to Work. The primary reason given that FedEx is so fantastic: this year we get back half of the 401K match they took away with our pay cuts last year. They had just beefed up the match the year before to compensate us for ditching the pension!

Depending on where you work, you may be plagued with endless meetings. Very often meetings are held not to get input from participants but to disseminate information that could be easily distributed with an email.

There is little room for advancement, in particular technical advancement. The Advisor positions which were created years back might have been used for a more advanced technical position, at least in technical groups, but they are primarily political in nature. Every 'Principal' position - the highest level non-management job - was filled by the buddy system, which is rampant in my particular org.

There is a bit of a hivemind here, and individual thinkers are unlikely to prosper. Incompetent and toeing the party line will get you farther than making waves for improvement. Mediocrity is rewarded, while innovative thinking is a crapshoot.

There are way too many corporate initiatives, and the company is forever paying some consulting firm gadzillions of dollars to recommend one or the other course of action, but we rarely have follow-through. It keeps these initiatives from doing any real harm, but it wastes a lot of resources along the way.

pros: stable place to work, systems work, great name, founder is still CEO
cons: very unhappy people working here.  management has gone down hill and could care less if you stay or go.  not supportive....  overall, the work isn't bad or very complicated.  a little mundane and there is NO room for any outside the box thought.  nothing fun or progressive going on here

review: Overall good company to work for but depends on who your manager is.
pros:
Good work balance
Flexible hours
Job security
cons:
Only 6 paid holidays
Deadlines
Not all management are college grads so dealing with hourly mentality
Pay raises are minimum

review: good place to work very stable company
pros: salary, low-cost health benefits; good people overall and management styles
cons: lots of long-time employees with seniority makes it harder to move up; some of them should not get away with some things they do; career titles still important there and hierarchy

pros: Flexible hours and the pay is fair for package sorting and handling. Overall it is a good way to get exercise and make extra money
cons: The work area can be loud at times and the heavy lifting can leave you sore at the end of the day, but that is to be expected

review: FedEx is a great place ti work
pros: Overall, FedEx is a great place to work. There are more opportunities at FedEx on a bad week than there are in Memphis on a good week.
cons: Some managers treat their employees like children.

pros: Fun Environment, Can wear whatever you want to work, fast paced, great benefits, decent pay, great management, good room for advancement, daily work out.
cons: Unsafe environment for those who do not pay attention to their surroundings.   High stress sometimes.

pros: Has some of the smartest people I've ever met working there. Large IT campus in Memphis has walking trails, a nice cafeteria, wooded grounds, secure parking.
cons: They drive the better people so hard that all but the most masochistic leave. Many that work there do the bare minimum to keep their jobs. Management is more political than Washington. Projects are a morass of constrictive processes involving lots of departments and meddling, yet you are expected to deliver big.

pros: Challenging career, face to face customer service, those who buy into the Fedex way of life will do well.
cons: Long hours, high pressure, little room for error.  Say good bye to the month of December.

review: Great to get your foot in the door
pros: The hours are great if you are a college student like I am.....Also this provides me a chance to move up...
cons: People will not give you advice for possible employment after graudation...

pros:
Benefits are very good, especially for part time employees: tuition refund, health, dental and 401k. 
Service FedEx provides to its customers is bar none.
cons: Upper management's ability to prioritize projects is lacking. Projects are added to the list, even when the business justification is not there to support it. This causes projects to have schedules that last years instead of months because there is not enough staff to complete the work in a reasonable amount of time. Additionally, scope creep is an issue (again at upper mgmt level). Company culture has changed. FedEx, at one time, really valued their employees, unfortunately this is no longer the case.

review: Good first step on the career path
pros: Good total compensation package, when benefits and vacation time are considered. Good training and experience that is sought after outside of FTN.
cons: Rapid growth about a decade ago led to many underqualified/borderline incompetent individuals being promoted to middle management positions. These individuals are now in a career parking pattern and obstructing the advancement of many very talented and motivated individuals below them.  Things are beginning to sort themselves out, but in the meanwhile the company is bleeding talent and slowly filling itself with the wrong kind of "lifers."

review: People First, great company to work for.
pros:
-High Profile
-People First Philosophy
-Leadership Interaction at All Levels
-Education Reimbursement
-Health Benefits
-Great Experience
-Challenging Work Environment
-Contribution Acknowledgement
cons:
-Peak, strains resource availability
-Equipment doesn't meet standards for the job

review: I learned a great deal here.
pros: The benefits are outstanding and there are many ways to move up.
cons: Management can have a difficult time dealing with the stressors of the job, sometimes taking it out on employees.

pros: Pay was decent, good benefits for a part-time employee. Extensive training, fair job evaluations. Easy going and friendly co-workers. Management was fair and stern.
cons: No flexibility in the schedule, no opportunity for advancement to become a full time employee. Difficult and strict daily performance measurements and standards.

pros: good job with real value on team work and good benefits to go along with training new people along the way,must be willing to work hard and fast.
cons: job can be trying at times with fast pace environment but you get use to it.

pros: Good benefits, excellent management, flexible hours, and sometimes breakfast.  Management has learned the art of respecting their employees personal lives.
cons: Compared to other companies that I worked for in the past, none.  I wish they had better food in the vending machines.

pros: Strong leadership and employee focus. Managers are empowered locally. The service and product offering are the best in the business.
cons:
Long hours and days for managers.
Tough business, weather , diesel exhaust, some f their facilities need upgrading badly.

pros: Very diverse, very fast paste. Require hard work from its employees but will also help u build character. If u can make it here u can make it anywhere
cons: Sometimes working in bad climate. A dangerous place to work if you don't pay attention.

pros: Flexibility(days or nights) ... Always postings to advance... Great atmosphere... Benefits are pretty much as good as your going to get... Easy money
cons: Work in a wear house setting...ie...cold and heat... You have to work weekends on days and some holidays on nights... During the busy season you work long hours

pros: Challenging; competitive; good work/life balance. Great advancement opportunities. Respectful environment. I have worked with many knowledgeable individuals who have motivated and pushed me to excel.
cons: Politics often comes into play. There are frequent changes and reorganizations can occur. Depending on areas, advancement may be limited in some promotion options

review: Good company to work for overall.
pros: Good job security and benefits.  One of the largest employers in the area.  Also offers good work/life balance to employees.
cons: Competitive salary and benefit package, but not necessarily the best in the market.  Also offers less paid holidays than other employers in town.

pros: Lots of room for advancement, locations throughout the us for transfers, management willing to work with you
cons: Pay and raises could be better

review: A good place to work; but compensation is falling behind other companies.
pros:
- Used of new technologies.
- Great benefits.
- Respect for employers.
cons: - Salary compensation is falling behind other companies in IT.

pros: Relax don't do anything environment
cons: Baby boomer management should retire by now but still driving technology and still believe in storage using tapes. Too many offshore faces who can't even speak understandable English. Only way to become a manager is either you cook good Indian food or know how to boot lick your Director. Project Managers are the most incompetent jerks and marketing team can only sell used cars.

pros: Good, friendly technical oriented environment. Managers appreciate and tend to improve further your skills
cons: You always need to upgrade your profile constantly. Training is once issue i see in the company.

review: Working at World HQ (corporate office) in Memphis
pros: Although it's not what it used to be before the company became so enormous, the culture here is generally very good. People are friendly, teams generally work well together and upper management works hard to reinforce the importance of collaboration and team spirit. Pays very well for Memphis--- it's so cheap to live here that you can buy a house on pretty much any salaried position. World HQ is a pretty campus next to a golf course with trees, a lake, a walking trail, big cafeteria overlooking the golf course, and a fitness center. Employees receive discounts on shipping and with certain companies like Dell and AT&T. Health benefits are competitive, there's a 401K, and there is still a lump-sum pension benefit as of 2014.
cons: FedEx is actually not just a single company--- it's a group of operating companies that "operate independently, compete collectively". Despite efforts to overcome it, there is still a tendency toward "silos" and being territorial at all levels. Having personnel headquarters in Memphis has become an increasing liability since it is a decaying city with a lot of crime, ineffective leadership, high property and sales tax rates, terrible traffic and failing public schools. The great majority of employees are here because they're either from here or they have ties here (family nearby, etc), they are careful about where they buy a home, and they are willing to fork over the money to send their kids to private schools. This could be a good place for a young, childless person, especially someone interested in the arts, to put in two or three years but overall, this is not a particularly innovative or nimble company; there's a lot of "this is how we've always done it".

review: I'm trying to get back in!
