cons: The raises are ridiculous. They start you out good and it takes you 4yrs to make a $1 raise. If you do not move up you will never make money. But they do put a lot of stress on you.

review: ok starter job but do not plan to stay!
pros: Shipping discounts.401k with match up to 500.00..group health and dental..weekly paycheck
cons: Antagonistic managers..doesn't  honor parttime schedules for parttime employees..piles on work on top of an already full day...micromanages daily..doesn't  recognize retiring long time employees and has no exit interviews..constantly changes schedules without consulting affected employees..

pros: Benefits, 401k, multiple shifts available. Uniforms are available and reimbursement for protective footwear. College tuition reimbursement is also available once a year.
cons: Demanding Physical labor. Communication between management and work groups are none existent. Weather working conditions can be hazardous and  cause late working hours.

pros:
Great Brand Recognition.
FedEx Name gets you in door.
Benefits are Industry Standard.
Company Car.
Company Cell Phone.
Company Computer
cons: No formal development process for those who want to advance career. Definitely a "good old boys" culture. Not very diverse.

review: Great pay, used to be fun place, now focused on "outstanding financial returns" as mission statement vs PSP
pros: Great benefits; great place if you are politically connected.
cons: Very demanding, expect you to always be accessible to the job 24/7.  If you choose not to, you are an underachiever.

review: Hard work, low pay, good exercise
pros: This job is great if you are looking for extra money and need to get a good workout in.   I lost weight doing this work
cons: The warehouses are not air-conditioned.  So we would work in the hot sun or the cold winters.  If you are fine with that, then this job so work for you.

pros: Steady work, the work was super easy. Everyone that worked there were extremely friendly. The managers seemed to know what they were doing.
cons: group think, and workplace gossip and drama. the management told me for a year that they were going to promote me because of my work ethic and the promotion went to someone else.

pros:
Health insurance
Annual bonus
No clock watching
cons:
Load you up with more work than possible to complete
Manager brags about loading workers with more work than they can handle
Due to work load, have no time for continuous learning
If you take a day off, expect to get far behind

review: OK, with a side of average
pros: Nice facility, superb health care benefits, work from home priveleges
cons: Zero career advancement opportunities within the company, slow moving management team, minimal compensation motivation.

pros: Better benefits than most companies, promotional opportunities if you're willing to relocate, direct management is good for the most part
cons: Annual pay increase barely paces inflation, your territory assignment can make or break your career, your work isn't reflected in your territory's performance

pros: Was a good company with focus on doing the right thing. Protectecting the employee and the company by following practices and polices
cons: With Fed Ex taking over there is no security what so ever.  They are not professional. They don't even follow their own or Fed Ex's polices.  A sad day for GENCO.  Hopefully they will just change the name to FED EX something and GENCO can retain the great reputation they are know for,

review: It's an OK job to work at
pros: The Pay as well as benefits are good. Depending on what area you are put in, might affect how happy you are with the job.
cons: The Physical stress put on your body. It is a lot of heavy lifting and if you don't lift them the right way, or not stretch right, it's very easy to get hurt.

review: good job, managers just need to manage not micro manage.
pros: Its difficult to manage people, but you must trust them to work HARD.  Remember they are adults so give them some space. They will work hard if you let them evolve.
cons: The down side is turn over, try keeping them  for awhile

pros: Name recognition - everyone knows FedEx and will be a good resume booster
cons: Mundane job with little room for growth and opportunity

pros:
Nice people who would help you rather than pulling your leg.
Manager won't ask you why you need a leave
Good for introvert people as employees are mostly busy in their work so very less social life
cons:
Less salary
Only work and no fun
No eagerness to appreciate employees for good work
No casual conversations
No teem lunches and activities

pros: Benefits are above industry average
cons:
Most of the managers are lazy jerks who treat their employees like mules.  They don't care about work/life balance, and will make you wish you were getting paid by the hour.

Inter-departmental rivalry is out of control, and senior management doesn't care.  At no point did I ever hear someone say "We all work for the same company".

pros: Managers do better about their workers
cons: Not safe work place sometimes  more for profit then safety

pros: Strong brand, good services, great name recognition, easy to pitch to clients, great work life balance to have a good home life
cons: ever changing sales goals/ focus - lack of transparency in showing/explaining numbers,  treated like children in inside sales environment - negative environment

pros: steady work mon through fri full benefits with retirement.
cons: The company has changed from employee friendly to numbers only. Even reviews are generated on the computer automatically and managers have no say over them. Worked three years with no raise and then given 7 cents. Does not care about the employee and forget about family life.

review: I walked out of job I held for 9 years to do discrimination from management for being gay.
pros: They paid decent and there was tons of overtime opportunities due to lack of staff.
cons: Overworked.  Uncaring management, especially at district levels.

review: Make sure you document everything because you have no union..
pros:
Peek seasons hours lot's of overtime.
Relocated anywhere in the U.S. you would have to bid on it.
cons:
Management suck they would'n listen to your concerns or problems that you might have with a route or customer.
Their is only one HR representative available for 300 + couriers ,handlers,front desk Assistant and Managers.
So since there is no HR in house you have to call and leave a message and hope they will get back to you.  
No Union.

review: Ask the right question in the interview
pros: Job includes the normal benefits but not better than the larger companies offer.  Must be good at working independently, like spreadsheets and fast deadlines.
cons: It's a dead end job. Must travel from time to time.

pros: NO pros, You're better off getting your education.  You're not going to pay your bills doing that kind of job.  sometimes, they do offer free snacks. that's about it.
cons:
Dfficult job, my back hurts after work everyday,  i almost quit my first day
NO breaks
Bad environment
Hourly wage is not good enough for that type of job

pros: Stable job,  benefits
cons: Terrible sales management and directors. The base pay and bonuses are very low as a FedEx sales rep. I work in tech sales now and have made more money in 2 years vs what I made in 5 years at FedEx.  Do not work here If you are looking to make good money as a sales professional.

pros: Can move to full time,benefits  after 1,000 hours
cons: Quotas are unreasonable , constant  changing of management , care more about covering there backsides than their employees  when an injury occurs

review: Fedex Great Benefits but Long Hours
pros: Fedex offers a nice pension plan and very good benefits even for part time employees.
cons: We are always short handed and couriers have a very long day.

pros: A very good company with good financial health.   The benefit program was very good.  Always looking forward to the future.
cons: FedEx puts way too much stress on it's Salesforce and employees.   There are unrealistic expectations as to what is expected of their sales force.

pros: Team work, let you work overtime if you work hard. Benefits for part timers after 1000hrs. Sat and Sunday's off
cons: Lifting all day, they don't offer full time off the back you have to be there for 8months first. People just call off so you have to work as harder

pros: Great pay, but not competitive with our competitor in brown. Not what it used to be, but better than flipping burgers.
cons: Giant disconnect between managers and upper management and hourly employees. Pushing full time employees to become part time

pros: Great money, flexibility, camaraderie,  well developed programs and applications.
cons: I am now being managed by my 4th manager in 10 months. It's difficult to receive timely help from supporting departments and management. The Regional Director manages through fear.

review: Package Handler: Extremely hard labor work. Low hourly pay $11.47- $12.47; without health coverage.
pros:
Tuition reimbursement after you reach a
 1,000  worked hours. Team leads don't want any talking while working.
cons: Must work 1,000 hours before eligibility for Heath coverage. You are worked hard, hard for little pay. Also, you aren't guaranteed  a 40 hours work week.  Weekly paycheck 40 hours $350.00, with taxes deducted.

pros: Easy to catch on and to get a quality understanding of what they do, and also it is good exercise.
cons: The glass ceiling is very low and one can not help but to feel a bit stuck in your position.

review: It's decent income but not quite good and definitely not great
pros: Great benefits including discount travel and 401k match...not much else to say ummm nice uniforms and they're good for a  reimbursement for safety shoes
cons: Not enough hours, favoritism,  poor management skills, don't you dare get hurt on the job because the write off everything as preventable

pros: Looks good on your resume, and you get a lot of experience. It's a recognized employer worldwide, so you don't have to explain where you work.
cons: Most of the managers suck, and a lot of them are "task masters". Majority of the business decisions are straight out of Dilbert.

pros: Excellent benefits even for part time employees.  Very easy to employ process due to high demand.
cons: Terrible management, plays favorites.  They preach that you can promote within the system but unless you're buddy buddy with upper managment you don't have a chance.  Poor work balance which leads to high turnover.   Peak season is complete chaos.

pros: The best position within the company as far as hourly. The pay is reasonable, very less stressful from being a courier.
cons: No hours and losing freight to Fedex freight and ground. I'm part-time and barely getting hours because full-timers have to get their hours first. Not worth it if its your only job.

pros:
This job is perfect for those who 
-like to go in with where nothing changes on a daily basis
-want decent benefits
-get not so great pay
-want to live in "The Office", "Office Space" or any other office-spoof comedy
cons:
-The "raises" 
-The review scores 
-The month before management surveys are due
-It is glorified data entry with no chance of change

pros: stable company, extremely strong brand
cons: management is way too political sometimes. saw more than qualified reps get passed over for promotion for someone whose parent worked at the company.

pros: Great health care, paid time off, 401k and pension.
cons: I was told for years to work hard and you will get promoted, just to find out this is a company that hand picks who they promote based on who can save them a dollar.

review: Good company, but very few options to move up.
pros: Fast paced work environment, with a fun friendly atmosphere.
cons: With in last year or so with good management and hardworking employees our building increased its productivity by at least 50 percent and we have not been given a raise or acknowledged by region for what we have accomplished.

pros: Great benefits and training program.  Good vacation time.
cons: Limited room for advancement.  Pay is OK, but doesn't equal the amount of knowledge you must have, workload everyday, and due to the job (Making sure international shipments have all required documents and related forms to clear Customs, the job is very important for the USA

pros: fast pace ,pleasing customers delivering and picking up packages  pay rate is good
cons: employees don't work as a team

pros: Great Benefits, Cheapest I've ever had, paid time off, they offer something called LWOP (Leave without pay) and it does not count against you. Very flexible with allowing employees to switch schedules, for any reasons.
cons: Very low pay for the amount of work, long hours during peak season, raises are not good. No career opportunities in the area,

pros: Flexible work hours with nice clean facilities.
cons: Outsourcing has become the very common. Of course, this will cause the current staff to exit. Why train the outsourcing company and shadow them. Then correct their error and allow them to take credit for your work.

pros: Hours are nice and so are some of the co-workers as well as the company you are contracted through. Easy to overtime if you want
cons: Management is horrible, shows favoritism and lacks leadership knowledge. Zero growth opportunity. Never complimented on going above and beyond your actual job

review: People are nice, but not innovative
pros: FedEx truly loves its people.  The company focuses on making almost any accommodations for there people which is why the average years of service is about 15.
cons: FedEx is not an innovative company.  Being based in Memphis  narrows the focus of the world and thus, from an IT perspective, trails competitors.

pros: it was alright, it could have been better, good perks but needed more pay.  It might eb doing alright now though.  They had fun events every now and then
cons: Leadership was meh, the location isn't very great.  Memphis is pretty meh to be honest.  The whole thing could me better. More social activy needed

pros: Decent benefits are an option after six months on the job for both full and part time employees
cons: HR is a joke, lots of miscommunication between management, they change the way they want things done often, and there is very little opportunities for job advancement.

review: A big ship that's very slow to turn
pros: There are many different things to work on, so you can find something you're good at and do it.
cons: Outdated technology, takes forever to get anything updated. Silos are getting worse, not better, limiting advancement; especially if you're not in Memphis.

pros: Good part time job with decent holiday hours. Ability to communicate with front line supervisor daily.  Good co workers and work environment.
cons: Inability to move up regardless of educational background. Talked with Branch Manager about possibilities of moving up and was basically told to take other job offer

pros: employee benefits, retirement savings programs, profit sharing plans, after 10 years 5 weeks vacation, retirement benefits after age 65,
cons: Unrealistic performance expectations for operations management in Express services,

pros: Fedex is a great company to work for.  They have great benefits for their employees.  The company gives back to the community.
cons: There is nothing wrong with the company.  There is a lot wrong with management.  Management needs improvement.  Advancement with the company needs improvement also.

pros:
Highest hourly pay in my town.
Great discount programs.
You can choose to work overnight or during the day.
cons:
Mandatory overtime during some parts of the year.
Constantly changing hours.
Poor management.

pros: Good company, benefits. Very good software engineering process. Sometimes the process takes over the technical advancement.
cons: Not for someone who wants to move up in career ladder. The good software development process takes over the career advancement.

review: Are you related?  If not don't bother applying
pros: Awesome parent company and decent benefits
cons: IT Mgmt leads by fear... If you are not related to someone don't bother applying in the IT department

pros: Pay not to bad and benefits are good . Manage is helpful.
cons: Fedx drivers don't do there job, so you get yelled at constantly for there mistakes. Also, don't like Fedx procedures on how to handle customers who packages are lost. No where to move up in the company.

pros: Pays bills very easy job on the road you don't have to deal with management until you get back to the station
cons: No life your schedule changes weekly you have to work splits in order to make 40 hours a week or you will bring home your minimum of 35 hours a week

review: Disappointed in Management staff at the City of Industry location.
pros: Maybe the perks and the reduced shipping costs.  Coworkers are good people as well but management really needs to be flexible in receiving ideas that did originate from them
cons: The inflexible management staff-  Closed to the possibility that employees have great ideas.  Inflexible in accommodating schedules that conflict with yours

pros: Decent Medical/Dental, tuition assistance,  401k,etc.. like many corporations.
cons: Basically the same pay for past 7 yrs. factoring in our annual health insurance hikes, working in extreme conditions,shift differential cuts, uniform allowance cuts, big time favoritism, etc...

review: Great benefits, compensation could be better
pros: Great benefits and flexibility. You are given the autonomy to manage your own territory without micro management. If you have good organization skills you'll be successful
cons: The biggest con in my opinion is the compensation structure. It could be better. However they are making strides in the right direction.

pros: Good benefits and the managers were really down to earth people, I even managed to become good friends with one of them.
cons: Poor working conditions, faulty equipment, and low wages made my experience as a package handler unbearable. The big wigs were inhuman to say the least.

pros:
Consistent work. Stay very busy.
Great vacation package
Very diverse environment.
Can delegate tasks when you do not want to do it.
cons:
Pay is below market so come in as high a you can. 
You will not get a raise based on your skills or accomplishments.
Over ten years lacking in accepting modern processes ike JUnit, Agile, Eclipse etc.

pros: The insurance with this company is great. There is a lot to learn with the importation of products into the country.
cons: Growth within the company is limited. The pay is low compared to the importance of the job description.

pros: Brand - everyone knows FedEx.  Cumbersome tools and camping home internet reimbursement at $40.  Spreadsheets and fire drills run by Managers who have been promoted beyond their intelligence level.
cons: Pay you just enough to make you question your desire to leave.  No one gets rich at FedEx.  Not alot of individual contributor advancement opportunities as people are sitting in current positions until retirement

pros: Decent benefits for part time hours.
cons: Takes so much of your own time to get in and out of the "complex". So basically you get paid for part-time hours and you actually spend full time hours at the job. Hard to advance to better position.

review: Memphis Tn. Hacks Cross-- Stay Away!
pros: The building is nice. That's about IT
cons: Management is abusive; unappreciative; and degrading.  They view it as your  privilege to be there, and they will shove that down your throat. You will work 60 hrs per week, and you will be told it's not good enough. There is a reason you get seven free mental health visits on the health plan.

pros: Although part-time you can't beat getting  full health benefits with the job, which includes doctor visits, prescriptions, visionsand dental.
cons: Not a lot of money to be made part-time and will have to wait a year or more to transfer to a different location.

review: FedEx was a good job to get me through college.
pros: Decent pay, they will work with you around school and they offer tuition reimbursement.
cons: Physical labor, poor management, and not a lot of room for growth.

pros: If you want to focus on becoming an expert of a particular technology or language, FedEx is the right place. You'll focus on an aspect of development and not much more.
cons: If you want to be more of a jack of all trades, full stack developer, your needs won't be met at FedEx

pros: Weekly pay good people and decent benefits. Great for some one who just wants money and don't care how much you earn.
cons: They expect too much.. They work you too hard and not a single manager is willing to help just complain.

pros: Good people to work with a lot of room for growth and advancement if you work hard.
cons: Only part time not much full time work available

pros: Laid back, easy, a lot of freedom, rarely any issues of concern
cons: most of the people are not educated, so you deal with a lot of drama and unprofessional people, some people dont actually do anything and still get paid, education doesnt matter, you could be Einstein and they would have you shoveling packages

pros: You get 75% off shipping
cons: Most FedEx Office locations are treated as stand alone stores.  There are store goals, if the store isn't doing well staffing is cut, despite that there is still heavy traffic in the stores.  Can be frustrating. but I guess that is retail

review: Hard work for 11.00/hour part time to start.
pros: Good way to get in shape, friendly atmosphere
cons: Have to go through guard shack to enter and leave. They frisk you on leaving. They have high demands to fit their needs. a lot of people don't last, high turnover.

review: I enjoyed my time working in the warehouse as well as meeting new & interesting people.
pros: The fast pace, the laid back environment, staying physically fit as well as meeting new people/learning different things.
cons: Not enough hours as well as poor ventilation.

review: Rocky in the beginning, but I've adjusted.
pros: Good salary for part time work. Room to advance if you put the time in.
cons: Extremely fast paced so quality sometimes must take a backseat.

pros: The pay and benefits are okay, if you land the right gig. Lots of time to daydream, as very few tasks require thought to complete.
cons: Not much room for advancement unless you're willing to move to Memphis. Communication is poor and morale is low year round. Peak season (December) is a nightmare.

pros: Pretty solid pay. They really are an equal employing company. They give alot of people chances.
cons: Very hard work. Hot conditions to work in, in the summer, and cold conditions to work in during the day. Not enough hours, & the break isn't long enough at all.

pros: you have job security as long as you are on time and there everyday if not you will be fired because it is undkilled labor and new workers get paid less.
cons: Each package Handler will receive very little hours and is pressured yo unload a tractor trailer full of  boxes.

pros: Good paycheck. Its enough money to support if you are leaving with someelse.
cons: Manager and staff can be two faced.

pros: The insurance is adequate.  FedEx offers a pension.
cons: There is little work-life balance.  Your input isn't important unless you are a manager.  Dealing with colleagues in other locations is difficult because they aren't welcoming or cooperative.

review: Fedex used to be a good place to work.
pros: As a courier you are on your own on the road with no one to bother you during the day.
cons: The constant threats if you dont meet unreasonable goals. the ridiculous policies set by a company that calls itself a people company.

review: Great expierence into how a large company operates.
pros: Fedex is a great place to learn, grow your skills and see the effect they have on the global economy. Company does a great job to support its employing in leadership development
cons: beaucracatic and lots of red tape

pros: Learn many things, fast paced environment
cons: Has continually went down in having a professional management team. Now is more centered on bully management. All bonuses are gone. Have many incentive program pools but all tied into sales that are split among coworkers that may average around $10 a month if even that.

pros: You have the ability to learn multiple skills in different areas. There are a lot of perks to working for Fedex. You receive discounts from multiple stores in the city as well as online.
cons: working under contract can limit you from a lot of the opportunities that Fedex has to offer.

pros: Great hours and flexible.  No one expects you to spend your nights responding to emails.  Good emphasis on developing and investing in the company culture.
cons: Little room to advance and not many opportunities for new challenges to grow. Promotions rarely happen.

pros: Opportunity to promote from within is realistic and competitive.
cons: The facility doesn't have enough scanners for the whole crew, usually the last person to grab a scanner ends up being 20 minutes behind.

pros: Over-Time is the best part, if you can make it that far.
cons: Modern Day Slavery, Warehouse is a sauna during the summer and a deep freezer during the winters.

pros: Easy job to obtain, lots of demand for drivers
cons: Poor pay compared to UPS, little to no support for drivers, poor training of new drivers, constant turnover, poor facility management

pros: Great benifits, growth opportunities, and company stability. You learn something new everyday.
cons: Lack of management support. People with the company are overloaded with tasks that are unsuccessful at achieving goals and company satisfaction.

pros: If you are willing to work hard and long hours, the management will notice and move you up.
cons: The middle management is lives under a constant fear from senior management. Mentally its a very stressful job.

pros: very fast pace and flexible
cons: theres a reason why they keep the number of workers small. so they will keep hiring and firing.. thats the business. it doesn't matter how long you work there. You're just slave to the job until someone pushes the button and announce when time to go home. interaction with co workers are positive. the interaction with managers are not. So everyone hates managers but not everyone can tolerate their behavior.

pros: It has decent pay for the work required with pay raises, a few different shifts are usually available to choose from.
cons: It is hard work, sometimes management expects too much of you and if you get stuck with a tough workload they sometimes don't have the staffing to come help you.

pros: Ok Pay other than that nothing.
cons: You are just another number. No one cares what you do as long as you do it by the unrealistic goals they set.

pros: There are absolutely no pros to this job.
cons: They don‚Äôt care to train. And they will take full advantage of you. I did great on my first day, so they decided to give me 9 trucks to fill while others had 2-3 trucks to fill. And would send everyone home while you‚Äôre still backed up on packages while the drivers stare at you.

review: Ok, if you like constant physical activity with hardly any time for breaks.
pros: It is a workout, Decent starting pay and some room to advance depending on how hard you work.
cons: Work in extreme temperatures, higher ups can be a pain and sometimes disrespectful. They sometimes expect too much.

pros: Tech Center has a decent workout facility, reasonably priced for employees & contractors.
cons: Below-market pay for FTEs. On-site contractors are shown the door after just 11 months.

review: The amount of stress is not worth the amount you get paid.
pros: Good benefits and you learn a lot of U.S. Customs regulations.
cons: Be aware who you are as this job requires being glued to the computer

pros: Different things daily keeps you motivated and job interesting
cons: pay is way low for what we do. no life work balance, short staffed constantly, corporate is not held accountable like the field staff.

pros:
Good benefits, 
opportunities for advancement
cons: Bad pay. They lie to get you to work there giving you the impression that you will get at least 36 hours a week but you dont. They have employees that have worked there for years still not able to get full time hours.

pros:
physically demanding and very satisfying
very concerned staff and always helpful with college student schedules
does have seasonal bonus and pay increase for established employees
cons:
evening and early morning shifts
works off historical data to see improvement in nightly operations
senior supervisor needs to show more concern to package handlers

review: Working at Fedex was very challenging.
pros: I like that I was able to create different projects for customers. And meeting different people everyday with creative ideas.
cons: At times made some mistakes but always learn form those mistakes.

pros: Great people to work with, weekly pay. Flexible schedule
cons: Very little room for advancement. Low moral.

pros:
Reasonable pay and benefits
work from home
off on major holidays
cons:
awful hours around the holiday (working until 8pm or later on Christmas Eve for example)
absolutely no career opportunities
not monday-friday work schedule anymore
managers are rough and irrational
unable to successfully have a work/life balance
raises are okay

review: Probably the best employer in this area
pros: People first philosophy. Relaxed work environment. Low house price.
cons: Most employees have no interest in learning new things. Even if some of them do, they are discouraged  by management.

review: Good company for the most part
pros:
-Good benefits. Solid retirement plan.
-More time off than most companies.
-Flexible hours depending on department.
-Tuition reimbursement if you're interested in returning to school
cons: Normal cons of working for a big corporation. Sometimes inflexible management. Could pay more. Depending on the department, individual contributions can go unrecognized.

pros: Decent pay for decent work. pretty solid starting jobs if your willing to put in the time and effort and don't mind working really hard moving a bunch of boxes around. lots of opportunity for advancement if you put in the time.
cons: not a lot of opportunity for overtime/extra pay

pros: its a job and there are decent benefits
cons: There are one or two package handlers such as myself that throw all of the packages on a belt.  Then there are the 4 or 5 who have been there for 20 years that laugh , and joke with each other while scanning those packages... Unfair so its not worth it

pros: Stable, Respected, Solid Benefits, Well-Positioned vs. Competitors.
cons:
-Due to the size of the company, standing out is very challenging.
-Do it their way or be punished.
-Customer Service has diminished due to cost-cutting

pros: Potential for growth within the company. World wide company with the ability to transfer if you decide to relocate
cons: Under staffed. Not egnoughan power to cover the work load

pros: Stable company, a lot of training the management help you to do the job better a lot support to improve the job
cons: It is hard to advance. The company is not growing in the US so the only opportunity to grow is to wait for people to retire

review: They contract there routes out and the pay is crap. 1.25 per stop and work 10 plus hours a day.
pros: I gained Experience using a scanner, met some cool people, learned the process in full, had fun for a little while.
cons: My contractor called me a dirtbag and threatened me because i quit. Gave a 2 week notice.

pros: As a delivery driver you set your own hours
cons: The pay is decent until the season slows down and there are no benefits. Just a paycheck. Nowhere to move in the company

pros: The company has incredible benefits, is great on a resume, and has a global footprint
cons:
The thinking of upper management is stale at best and they allow some of their best minds to atrophy.

Pay in the sales organization not on par with other similarly sized organizaitons

pros: Brand recognition and great network for looking at new roles in the company. You have the ability to relocate for new jobs.
cons: Senior management is made up of primarily men making it hard for working moms to relate to their career paths and experiences.

pros: good benefits and able to go to school during the day.  Weekend off
cons: Evening Management has favorites and sides with them when things go wrong   Coworkers complain about the management.  Stresses the drivers out.

pros: Benefits Are Good , Pay Is Good , Work Is Good . The more you work the better it is to keep yourself going everyday
cons: Not being able to have reliable transportation or having hours that you can not manage while you work a good job

pros: Great benefits after thirty days. Like vacation and you can change areas.
cons: The time to go in. Because u could call the night before and it may say 10a then when you call back to verify the clock in time it could literally change from 10a to 7a

pros: It's FedEx,  enough said
cons: The division I worked in,  FedEx Truckload Brokerage was a separate from FedEx Freight & Ground,  we were a brokerage. Making money was extremely difficult as we were the most expensive and was almost always beaten with price & service.

pros: Hourly rate, boot allowances, driver program internally.
cons: Not enough hours, bad hours, management has unrealistic expectations.  Wasnt really trained, management always was on the intercom rushing us.  Everything is based on numbers.

pros: Weekends off with the exception of the Month of December
cons: No overtime,  No health insurance, No employee benefits at all, vehicles not maintained well

pros: They care about their employees.  They have a lot of training opportunities.  Managers keep their employees well informed of corporate initiatives.
cons: In my opinion, it is too bureaucratic.  I don't find the work challenging enough.

review: Ok for awhile, good for students and benefits but not enough opportunity to advance past labor intensive jobs.

cons: cant move up so your stuck in the same position for years

Salary is not nearly enough to live in SF. Not even close. Not very stimulating work or anything that builds new skills.

review: It's okay job while in college

cons: Management Is okay but foot kiss butt or snitch on others folks to advance

pros: Lots of benefits for part time work, including tuition reimbursement.
cons: Very hard to advance. Hard physical work in cold and hot weather.

pros: Hourly rate is competitive and the benefits package is great.

pros: You are able to work at your own pace and choose what time to come in the morning.

review: Not quite as great as most think

cons: Horrible IT infrastructure., not leading edge and too many issues to ever list.

review: Do not care about their customers and have zero customer service.
pros: People in my team were lovely, helpful and friendly.
cons:
Pointless and childish KPI's such as 15 phone calls a day which means you get absolutely nothing else done that you need to get done such as pricing. 

CRM systems are dated and slow. Takes about 2 hours to try and get a price quote and even longer as most have to go through a special team. 

Customers get treated terribly, delivery service is poor and the Customer Service team are impossible to get hold of and when customers do get them they get no information and they come back to the account managers ranting and raving. 

Standard promotion of a 'great culture' through wellness emails and mental health emails when in reality peoples mental health is generally affected by the ludricrous daily targets. 

Experienced staff are treated like interns.

review: Culture has significantly change to worse
pros: Before integration, management always inspired, empowered staff. It was transparent, open door and mutual respect regardless of ranking, title. Staff was treated respectfully. Opinions were heard even if it opposite opinion. It was collaborative environment. Everyone upholds their quality of works and help each other. There is no politics in office
cons: During integration, managers who originally are not from FedEx can‚Äôt uphold purple culture and bring their own management style into FedEx. More aggressive, bossy mangers  who only wants yes man . Their ego,pride are high and the most important. Employees no longer can give any feedback, opinion, solutions. There is bias on treatment, TNT ex-mangers try to protect their own people by giving projects, opportunities, share information to their own people, let purple subordinates to clean up mess.  It creates a lot of toxic politic environment when now loud voice people can easily suppress others; created a grouping;  blaming game and passing the ball around.  More long service outstanding employees whose used to solve a lot of problems and proposed good ideas are leaving,this causes demoralise  and it creates domino  effect.

pros: There are really good people working at FedEx and the organisation supports its employees well. Whilst HR leaves a lot to be desired, the management teams generally care about their teams and work hard to support them. If you're in a place where you want stability and predictability, FedEx could be a great company for you. It offers great benefits and attractive salaries to its staff as well as nice opportunities for personal development.
cons: FedEx is an in-effective company that hasn't moved with the times. It's top-down and top-heavy structure makes it incredibly slow moving and leadership is, at best, indecisive. Time is wasted sat in meetings, reviewing powerpoint slides, debating approaches and ownership rather than getting stuff done. If you get energy from making a difference and having an impact, this probably isn't the place for you.

pros: Best work place and environment to work

pros: Outside of HR, the people are nice, trying to work with you understanding your constraints
cons:
in HR, it's not about your ability, nor what you deliver. It's about which MD likes you, or if you are situated in Hong Kong where you are closer to the management team. 

People in the inner circle gets their names into projects even without contribution. Favored people can fail projects or deliver poor quality and be forgiven or even 'recognized' for nothing. 

Stealing credits and shunning responsibility is very much the norm. 

HR Management likes to deliver motherhood statements with no content and with no idea of what they want, nor with any real desire to help employees (outside of MDs and VPs). The HR MDs dwells on decision making, often waiting till the last minute when matter becomes urgent. Very sad state of affairs.

review: FedEx results deliver as pandemic drives ecommerce boom ‚Äî as it happened
pros: I believe there can be some pros and cons of staying in the same job for years. Let‚Äôs explore some of these advantages and disadvantages of long-term employment with the same company.
cons:
Opportunities to Learn and Advance
Another benefit of switching jobs is that it can open doors to learn and advance in a career. Working up to higher pay and benefits within a company can take many years, while switching jobs can allow workers to get significant increases in pay, benefits and responsibilities quickly. Changing jobs also lets workers escape dead-end jobs and continue to learn and grow.

review: An IT Perspective of FedEx as a Company
pros: The schedule is VERY flexible.  If you have to run an errand or leave early for an appointment its fine.  This is a place where management actually cares about its employees.  Recently with the economy going through a rough patch it would have been very easy to layoff people, right before Christmas no less.  Instead, upper management took the biggest salary cuts and reduced our salaries by 5% and no one lost their job.  I eliminated my personal trainer (a luxury item) to make up the difference in pay.  No big deal whatsoever.  I have the ability to work from home if necessary.  This is a very laid back place to work where if you are talented and get your work done on time you will be successful.  People who are self-motivated and hard-working will definitely love this company.  You will be rewarded for your hard work.  I would say about 90% of management is promoted from within the organization.
cons: This is not a technology company so any projects you work on are driven by a business need and not a technology need.  You will not invent the next "gizmo" here.  This is more a place where you take the "gizmos" other people create and implement them in a way that makes sense to the company's business needs.  If you are a technophile who has to be involved in the latest and greatest cutting edge projects stay in Silicon Valley.

review: Good place to work if you have a good manager
pros: Good benefits, pension plan, vacation, competitive base salary, stability, corporate discounts everywhere, fair vacation/time off, flexibility, car allowance, work from home, make your own schedule, free cell phone, free lap top, and great car allowance plus mileage.
cons: FedEx is the definition of corporate america.  You are nothing but a number and there are 360,000 employees.  If you are looking for a sales job, this job is not for you.  I spend 80% of my time dealing with non sales issues such as invoice adjustments, tracking packages, software issues, pricing not loaded correctly, ect and 20% of my time selling.  I have been screwed so many times out of bonuses when I bring on an account that is "incorrectly aligned" or does not spend enough money to meet adjustment criteria.  This job looks great on your resume but long term you will realize you spend majority of your time dealing with problems not selling.  But to be fair, it's not that bad if you learn how to play the games and train your customers to utilize the customer service department instead of calling your cell phone every time they have a problem.

cons: Micro managed, no union and a culture that makes people afraid to join one, no recourse, terrible scheduling, zero flexibility

pros: Culture & Philosophy, Diversity, People

pros: Work life balance Diversity Inclusion

pros: Good work life balance, no ot required most of the time.

pros: Great people to work with....... good environment .......overall a good workplace to begin with
cons: low on yearly increments . . .. . . on the outset you see lot of opportunities....but actually there is lot of partial and minimal growth....the biggest con as far as my profile is concerned OVERTIME...you have to do it almost every week and for it least amount will be paid above all its not an option!

pros: Work life balance and culture
cons: Limited resources/support and workload.  Low paying

pros: Good work and life balance

pros: Good group of work colleagues easy to get along with
cons: The Pay is rubbish and you feel under valued

pros: There were zero pros .
