review: THE BEST WORK ENVIRONMENT I HAVE WORKED YET.
pros: great office set up, very empowering employer
cons: none so far its all good

pros: Good hours, were fair to me during my time there
cons: Not room for advancement for what I was looking for

pros: Good Medical and Insurance Benefits
cons: No DND and overly systematics. People just work and go back. No bonding between teams.

pros: Good multinational environment and different cultures
cons: Very demanding and long working hours

review: If you like manual labor, this is a great place to work
pros:
Autonomy. 

Tuition Reimbursement.  

Good wage for unskilled labor (great for students)

Paid to exercise.  

Neat logo/uniforms/design.  

Reputable.  

I worked the PM sort alone at a small station through college--scanning and loading an average of about 750 packages in a 2.5 hour period.  You're graded for accuracy each night by comparing your (outbound) scans to the pick up scans done by the CSAs and Couriers--I believe 99.4% was the minimum goal--which means out of 750 packages and documents, you could only miss four to meet goal.  At my station, they don't randomly drug test handlers (unless you operate FedEx vehicles, or there is some type of accident).  Advancing isn't that difficult if you're a competent, hard worker--although FedEx is vehemently anti-union so if you like the idea of being a courier and committing to a company, UPS will pay more in the long run.  Express shipping is extremely expensive, so you're not unloading oddly shaped 140lbs packages all day (although it happens).
cons:
In the smaller stations, the amount of work required of you can border on insane.  

Stressful environment.  

They seem to go through low-level managers pretty quickly.  

Can be odd hours (Ramp workers have shifts at 3am, drivers are usually in the door at 6am).

pros: Flexible, MNC  environment, friendly culture
cons: Not much career progression, stuck

pros: Great place to work, the sky is the limit. If you want to educate yourself they offer tuition refunds and encourage people to be their best. Offer great service to their customers.There are enough different jobs at Fedex that if you need a new challenge you can apply for different positions,so you do not need to leave the company for new oppurtunities to grow personally or professionally.
cons: overall I'm satisfied , If there was a down sideit would be that  there are not a lot of oppurtunities for the front line employees to move into sales without previous sales expereince. This really impedes people that have been with the company for a long time. I believe there should be a mentorship program that brings the front line employees and sales group together. THere are enough skills test that exist in the world that one would have to write a test see if they are compatiable with sales, if so they should be given a chance to develope those skills without having to leave the company. Overall this is a pet peeve. But this does not distract me from my commitment to the company  or its objectives.

review: Depends on your boss and department...
pros:
Supportive and people centric organization
Adequate resources to support personal growth
Global MNC exposure
cons: Fierce internal competitions and overly political

pros: Company who does not care about workers. Smiling in ur face they will stab u in the back.
cons: If u r rear end kisser this is perfect place for u. But u always be just a number for them.

pros: Very good work culture company wide
cons: Very difficult to progress or be promoted.

pros: FedEx offers a competitive salary and the opportunity for advancement within the organization.  In a relatively short amount of time you are able to progress from a part time employee to a full time manager.  In addition, FedEx offers loads of useful training and college-type courses for personal growth.  Further, the company also offers compensation beyond hourly wage and benefits in the form of college tuition reimbursement, discounts, travel benefits, and more.
cons: Some of the detractors of working for FedEx would be the hours; often they can be unpredictable and vary especially when you are part time working towards full time, or when you are a swing driver.  There are also at times issues with staffing and the overloading of work on employees.  One can however understand that to keep the company going and competetive you must keep labor costs lower and productivity higher.

pros: training for you to develop
cons: fast pace so need to be ..

pros: Great team, well established brand name and good work perks
cons: Internal processes are extremely slow and outdated. Sales executives are overloaded with extra non productive work continuously

review: No longer a good place to work
pros: The people are amazing and the best bunch of people you will ever meet.
cons: The management, the management style, the underhand workings, the pay, the breaks or virtual complete lack of.

pros: People, discounts, pay, air fare/travel benefits
cons: Worst management I've ever experienced

review: Live the "purple promise" and you will satisfy your customers
pros: Salary was good for the role. Up to 3 years ago you were encouraged to work independently and take initiative. This changed with acquisition of TNT
cons: TNT acquisition is causing challenges but will be resolved in the long term. I wish them all the best of luck.

pros: Good wedge and few nice people
cons: I'm working 2 years for this com[any never been promoted.

pros: stable for job security and good environment
cons: limited opportunity to grow specially in IT Canada

pros: Much of the job is autonomous at times. If you can penetrate a key account with a competitor and switch them you'll likely enjoy solid commissions for several quarters. Very good reimbursement for  expenses: car, mileage etc. Solid base pay.
cons: Tedious admin work- almost daily. Endless reports and reports of reports. New action items. Working for an enormous company there is significant projections to have for management weekly. Many of these mundane tasks interfere with the true role of the job- SALES! Account maintenance and service takes up a significant amount of time.

review: Comfortable location and tasks are not too difficult but renumeration is bad
pros: location and friendly / helpful staff
cons: low pay low career opportunities

pros: Monday to Friday, not long hours
cons: Crap lorries, always breaking down

pros: Great brand recognition?   You don't get the door slammed in your face that's for sure.  If someone won't talk to a FedEx rep, they aren't doing their job! Excellent service to sell.
cons: No life balance.  Pay cuts 5% that we w I'll never get back. Benefits more expensive every yr.  dental vision difficult to find providers w/in network.  Sales goals so out of reach they are not attainable.  First yr since I've worked here that I will not make a bonus 0for 4 .   Many AEs in same boat. My take home has declined by $10k for two yrs in a row now.  Headed in wrong direction.   FedEx constantly changes and we've always said to just hng on because if something is going on that is bad, things will always change. But now we joke that e're afraid of what's next.   Big mistake combining FXF and parcel sales forces.  They've weakened the quality of the sales force by doing that, crowded territories and overloaded their sales force with too much to learn to be good at anything.

review: Good company for long term career
pros: The base salary is good. Benefits for senior professionals include a vehicle (not fuel though). The medical insurance plan is good as is their retirement plan. The company philosophy of "People-Service-Profit" (in that order) is part of the oganizational culture and fabric. The work/life balance is excellent and allows for remote work from home. Management is fair.  The organization offers very diverse opportunities for a project manager. It's a good place for a long term career.
cons: Their bonus opportunity is not that great. Company cars do not include fuel costs. Their philosophy of putting people first has its drawbacks as perception management is a key skill for management (and project managers) to master. The functional organization structure and culture of silos can be complex to overcome for a project manager. Being an American based organization you may be required to work early evenings from time to time depending on the project. Staff turnover is low which does require one to have patience if professional advancement is an objective.

pros: Good salary , workers are good
cons: Too much work, they force you to work long hr, never take your suggestions into consideration

pros:
Fun
great people
Good brand to sell
cons: Comms and bonus and no opportunities

review: Overall its a good company but the company lives with the success of its past.
pros: The benefits, the front line people who actually do the work are great at what they do and there is a tremendous amount of teamwork.
cons: The managment are complacent and have not initated change in operations/service offering or have no clue of what their strategy is to take on the domestic or for that matter the cross border market.  They are too cozy amongst each other and there should be change.  They live in the glory of their past, the term what got us here won't keep us here comes to mind.

review: Good place to work; awful place to have a life.
pros: Benefits like health insurance, study tuition up to 3000‚Ç¨; good salary; job stability; constant training; good internal network among other stations and colleagues; work indepently without upper management behind you; no fear from upper management for doing something wrong.
cons: extreme working hours; shifts change at anytime due to sick leaves or vacations; if you don't say "yes" to every shift change (or any change, or anything that your manager expects from you) don't expect to be considered for special job opportunities or special training; everyone is involved in their own objective; teamwork is incouraged but not expected; your left on your own to solve big problems because management is no where to be found.

pros:
- Deep corporate resources for equipment, supplies, job tools
- Good education benefits
- Good bonuses (if the company is doing well)
- Tries to improve
- Has some agile, intelligent, hard-working employees
cons:
- Moves ponderously slowly (if at all) on intelligent suggestions from the experts the company employs
- Misses ENORMOUS money-making opportunities because of management turf wars
- Moves lightning-fast on pet projects promoted by upper management
- Wastes money investing in poorly managed and under-analyzed initiatives
- Terrible at follow-through on long-term projects
- Terrible at internal communications (can be very "siloed")
- You need to be excellent at tooting your own horn to advance
- Annual employee reviews are more a matter of defending yourself rather than collaborating with management and documenting your successes and learning experiences
- Awards and advancement can be based on favoritism and the "halo" effect
- Management quality is spotty
- Has shockingly few safeguards/redundancies in place to ensure quality/thoroughness of work

review: Receive full benefits and a guaranteed minimum paycheck while still being a part time worker.
pros: After 3 months probationary period you receive full benefits even when one is just a part time worker. As long as you work your normal work week you will be paid your guaranteed minimum even if you work less than that (if you work over your minimum you get paid that amount). Good opportunities to move up through the company. Get discounts with a wide variety of companies that are somehow associated with the company.
cons: Depending on your job it does not require much thinking. While job openings are available at times it can be hard to advance up in the company especially if you are trying to remain in one area.

review: I have found my experience to be professionally fulfilling.
pros: FedEx provides professional staff and management with a fast paced and challenging environment that keeps you engaged and constantly learning.  Great benefits, competitive compensation and great people to work with.
cons: Memphis is not among my favorite cities, and if you want to advance up the ranks in FedEx you need to do a hitch at WHQ.  There are plenty of nice suburbs, but with a young family there are numerous other cities in which I'd prefer to call home.

pros: Well structured corporation throughout the world with a great people philosophy. With the right management, this is a great company to work for.
cons:
Those same great people philosophy's are not always adhered to in the UK by sale management. 
There culture that a sales professionals performance can be directly affected by sales management failures does not exist. Performance improvement plans (PIP) is the first stage of a rocky road for a sales professional in the UK and it is not often used in the way it was intended which is as a support mechanism.

pros: Good for student without a responsibility, most of the jobs are part time. Excessive use of temporary hand workers instead of part timers. Non unionized. Benefits if you get a PPT. IF.
cons:
No movement between divisions; you are stuck. 
The different divisions (Express, Office, Ground, Custom critical...) behave as silos, same as each country where it works. Open the doors of the cross training an use the resources without borders.  Difficult to grow and closed groups handle the development. Too much overhead in operations. 
Poor use of technology. FedEx operations is just labor. Non unionized.

review: Decent compensation, lots of attitude from management
pros:
- Pay and benefits are quite competitive in the entry level positions.
- Direct management/supervisor is often quite congenial.
- Training received may be useful in other jobs/careers.
cons:
- A company that is very good at superficially making it appear it cares about its entry-level workers but in reality treats them like cogs in a machine.  It would be helpful if they were at least honest about this.
- Extremely rude payroll staff in Tennessee you will have to make most of the phone calls to if you have a problem, despite this being presumably HR's job.
- Senior management can be quite strange and hostile, making arbitrary rules for little to no reason that benefit no one other than a select few.

pros:
Great people in a team-oriented environment. I spent 25 years there, and learned invaluable skills that have served me well since I left. I was generally happy with the managers I worked for, and the culture was people-friendly, fast-paced, and fun.

From a work standpoint, there were always interesting, challenging projects that kept me interested and engaged. We weren't afraid to push the envelope on technology, and most of the time I could see how my efforts contributed to the bottom line.

Over the years, I developed a wonderful network of professional associates and friends, and will always value my time at Fedex.
cons:
Fedex is BIG, and the challenges of managing that size of organization has led to an over-reliance on rules and procedures that tend to hider productivity and innovation. More and more, it is losing the ability to respond to market pressures and opportunities in a timely fashion.

Additionally, the company has lost the managerial edge that propelled its success in early years. They have acquired a glut of mid-level corporate survivors who rely more on preserving the status-quo than taking the risks necessary for competitive success. 

From an employee standpoint, a job at Fedex is not as secure as it once was. While they formerly had a no-layoff policy, they have abandoned it. Layoffs aren't frequent, but they are now part of the Fedex culture, with the attendant effects on morale.

pros: They paid within the industry standards, though I could never get the answer to the question if we were paid in comparison to other staff that did tracing.
cons: minimal training,  limited opportunities for advancement, favoritism, lack of management oversight, dishonesty, inadequate facilities and equipment, at times dangerous, no one available to answer human resources or benefit questions. They seem to have someone on staff who's only job is to look for ways to deny health insurance claims.

pros: If You are just looking for a place to earn extra money and have rest of the day avaible for school or regular job package handler is good job. Good, hard worker with lots of initiative will find a very favorable environment for lots of personal and professional growth. Employees are rewarded based on performance.I found it is good company where employees are valued and it is posssible to progress within company from package handler to managing positions.Often company subdise education efforts.
cons: Job is very physicaly demanding. Shift starts at 1am and finishes around 6am.If you are looking for a repetitive, predictable task job, you will find what you are looking for here.

pros: We are encouraged to find better ways of doing things.  Do the right things right and you are pretty much left alone to get things done.
cons: The recent pay cuts, salary suspensions, cut in incentive pay, and the cut in 401K match have really hurt and make it hard to keep up with inflation.

pros:
People
There is a strong committment to doing the right thing for the customer. 
Very positive vibe for new technology 
Challenging and interesting industry
cons:
Salaries....national pay grade is same for high cost areas of Eastern US and  Mid West urban as in mid south. No visibility  to how salary range is determined geographically.  Hush hush attitude in regard to salary.
Very hard to move up in company if not located in Memphis.  
Difficult to obtain training outside of Memphis, it's all online and not very good

review: Company will do anything for its clients, must also focus on its staff more.
pros: Good team of colleagues. bad coffee, good internal learning program
cons: to many managers who look up, and forget to look down to the workers, all the time budget cuts work with FedEx now for more than 12 years. all extra bonus and or Employee Benefits are cut back, or shut down over a period of 10 years now. this crisis will not help to improve these bonus or benefits back soon.

pros: Fedex is the best company i have ever worked for they are a forward think company. I have come from LGV driver to driver trainer and been supported all the way by my manager and the whole of the transport team. FedEx is a great place to work we do team work.
cons: As far as i am  concerned there are no cons this is a GREAT company  with Great people working together to make FedEx the number 1 in the world (which i think we are)

pros: FedEx is a satisfactory job to start with as a young person,  but beware.  It will take the average driver (courier) over ten years to "top out" at pay.  FedEx is best to be used as a job to supplement full time college courses while working towards a degree.  When said degree is achieved, run don't walk away from FedEx.
cons: Slavish work atmosphere.  Negativity at all times from management concerning your job performance.  Rampant favoritism by management towards selected employees.  Zero tolerance for mistakes.  Failure of this company to keep pace with the cost of living.  The worst couriers go into management, perpetuating the "us vs. them" (courier vs. management) mentality.  Courier pay stagnates, management pay increases.

review: Reputation not always a good measure opportunity.
pros: Reputable company with flexible work environment and decent benefits package.  Opportunities to work with all types of companies and customers.
cons: Opportunites for advancement in technology positions are difficult live in Memphis and know the right people. Software not as reliable as service. Some software technologies not keeping up with market.

pros: No other jobs out there right now and there's stll a lot of potential, if the company will just begin listening to those of us who know how to grow the business.  The people who are left are still just as dedicated as they ever were and it is a privilege to work with them.
cons: Pay cuts, layoffs, benefits reductions, poor strategic decisions, idiotic tactical decisions, and a leadership in personal survival mode with no concept of long-term planning.

review: At Least I Have a Job and Healthcare
pros:
Healthcare
Don't have to interact with customers or anyone I don't feel like talking to
Physical job that keeps me toned
I am employed which is more than many can say
cons:
Ever shortening shifts
Dangerous work conditions like bad drivers on tugs and who-knows-what coming down the line (hazardous materials; poorly wrapped packages; broken glass)
Incompetent management
Lazy and intellectually challenged co-workers
No mobility, just fake lateral moves
Healthcare is way too expensive, $100/week for the family plan.

pros:
Great pay
Great benefits
Many opportunities for promotion
Nice people

This is a company that really understands the fact that their business is dependent on their labor workers, and they treat them well.  The pay is great, with wage increases happening every 1, 3, 6, 9 and 12 months, and then every year for four years.  The benefits are great, after six months of employment part timers are eligible for PTO and other benefits, as well as the opportunity to switch to full time.  The management staff really seems to have a legitimate care about safety and are very encouraging, motivating, and polite.  Management thanks package handlers after every shift and every two weeks or so they have a "package handler appreciation day" and give out cookies, cupcakes, or even sometimes a catered snack such as bagels or hot dogs.  Also, they will tell you that FedEx is one of the few places where you can start as a package handler and work your way up without a college degree, and it is true that hard workers are quickly spotted and promoted.  This is a great job for someone who is willing to provide tough physical labor, and can be great as a summer job or as a career starter.
cons:
Hard work
Hours (Depending on your shift)
Weather

The cons that I listed are not really FedEx's fault...  Just know that while you are paid well and given great benefits, this is a labor based job and you are expected to work hard for the duration of your shift (usually 3-4 hours off season, but as much as 5 during busy season).  The warehouses are not climate controlled so it is very hot and muggy in the summer and you WILL sweat, so make sure you bring a water bottle.  Management is very understanding and they provide gatorade and allow you to take short breaks to fill your bottle during your shift.  Also, some of the shifts are terrible hours (like 3AM - 8AM or 9PM to 2AM), but these shifts are also paid more and often are easy to get hired into, if you are willing to alter your sleep schedule.  Overall though, all of the cons relate to the nature of the job and not the company itself.

review: Its what you make of it.
pros: My co-workers are the first thing to come to mind. They really make the company. Beniefits are fine and there's opportunity for advancement if one so desires.
cons: Like all successful companies, they must answer to the stockholders and this sometimes leaves some employee with the feeling  they dont matter to the company. The couriers make up the majority of the company, yet they are the only employees not given any kind of bonus/pay incentives.

review: Great job (if you don't mind overtime)
pros: Friendly people, good atmosphere and modern office with canteen downstairs.  Lots of customs rules to learn but colleagues are super helpful.  Benefits are nice.  Job is pretty secure as long as you can work fast and accurately on repetitive tasks - they are always looking to increase the team.  Pay is fine for a first job in a corporation. Some opportunity to 'move up' eg. as a team leader.
cons:
Lots of compulsory overtime which to be fair is paid well (100% more), sometimes an hour extra per day, sometimes shorter, occasionally even longer than an hour. Overtime depends on when the tasks are finished by the whole team, so you cannot predict what time you'll go home in advance. 

Lots of pressure to work quickly. Tasks are repetitive but you have to keep alert in case of anything unusual.  This can be a bit stressful.

Holidays are very inflexible and you may not be granted your request, even if you ask months ahead of time - this applies to several months in the year, not only the obvious flashpoints like Christmas or August.  No Polish national holidays are given automatically - you may take the day off at a different time instead or be paid extra.

Be aware that if you are a 'native' English speaker, or near native then you may well be asked to join the small team calling out to customers. Customers are usually friendly (or neutral) so this is not a bad task, but some colleagues were disappointed to be moved to this team as they don't like to speak on the phone.

review: A truly great global company headquartered in the USA.
pros: FedEx offers a very dynamic and fast-paced work environment.  They take great pride in hiring the best and brightest people so that they require little direct management involvement to get the mission at hand accomplished.  There is a great deal of personal leeway granted as long as results match expectations.
cons: Stiff competition and highly specialized areas of expertise make it difficult to land desirable management jobs even if you are well qualified.

review: Co-workers and management were fantastic but indeed back breaking.
pros: Most employees at FedEx were friendly and management was amazing. The hub manager was always on floor, and the assistant manager had weekly meetings to ensure everyone was working together. An overall good experience.
cons: Not recommended to anyone with ANY back or joint problems as there are very heavy packages, and there are a very few counter productive employees.

review: FedEx is a great company to work for
pros: I worked in FedEx Services and the people are great and talented. It is not a high stress environment but each team member Contributes a lot.
cons: It is like a barge. It is a huge company that will keep going forward no matter how slow it is, just because of its size. It is impossible to make changes in the organization.

pros:
Flat organization
Lots of freedom
Easy access to hierarchy

Your opinion is valued
cons:
Difficult to manage people due to lack of boundaries on responsibilities, freedom, discipline expected.
People belonging to one team are typically spread over different countries, it's a challenge to manage different personalities, located in different countries, with different cultural backgrounds and very different levels of skills.
Management tends to overthink and avoid taking decisions.
The hub operations relies on a handful of very knowledgeable and senior resources which become unmissable over time. These resources are being overused and are in danger of burning themselves out due to the sheer amount of work getting shifted towards them.

review: Learn alot about the structure and the importance of chain of command in business
pros: It is a good place work if you are a team player.. there training is top notch. and they have great benefits and perks.
cons: the company promotes mainly through seniority.. you have to get used to policy changes on the regular and and if you are looking to get into management its alot of politics involved more than anything..

pros: stand for quality, speed, customer focus, efficiency, thinking outside of the box, employee empowerment, leadership excellence, flat organization
cons:
Very lean organization. Great in that you learn a lot and have a broad scope of responsibility but one can burn out if one is not careful.
The organization was starting to put more distance between upper management and the employee voice... becoming too typical of other organizations. Unfortunately, this can erode their People First philosophy.

review: Strong Senior Management, strong and well run company, put employees 1st....career advancement limited
pros: Great experience, great brand name.  Strong financially to withstand economic downturn which is big plus.  People first philosphy is evident.
cons: Career opportunities are limited unless you network intensively.  Advancement not always offered to best qualified but to "who you know".

review: This is a great company to work for. A lot of opportunities and FedEx encourages the employees to grow their career
pros: The salary and package are great. Work life balance, peaceful environment, nice people working around here. It is just like a huge and warm family
cons: Management changed too frequently in the recent years which made employees a little bit hard to follow and get used to.

pros: The one good thing I can say is they pay well. That's probably the only reason anyone would work there.
cons: Eroding benefits, blatant favouritism, elastic rules, poor, unsafe working conditions, no response to valid complaints, poor communication between departments, management decision are not based on facts or logic, hours are irregular, no recognition for seniority. Management has a disconnect between what the employees actually do. Inconsistent goals.

review: YBZ location downtown is poorly managed
pros: Slightly above average pay (vs. UPS, Purolator, etc.), pretty flexible with hours. Most employees are down to earth and make time at the station enjoyable.
cons: Station manager clearly not concerned with people. Staff at YBZ is given fewer and fewer hours or crazy split shifts. Takes YEARS to work up to even being eligible to get a full-tim position so almost everyone is part time. When part timers complain, they are replaced with 1 or 2 "casual" employees. No job stability. SFA (Survey, Feedback, Action) meetings, where managers "want" to hear from their workgroups regarding issues, etc., are a complete farce. Nothing changes. Improvements don't happen.

review: Very good company, model is getting outdated for the size,  opportunity relies on local management
pros: Almost nothing will get you fired
cons: You got only couriers as execs, no vision, risk nor real word or other company related experience. Very short sighted and "dumb" all knowing execs at local or divisional level. Worldwide leadership team is within the best out there. Mr Smith and Mr Bronzeck are realy on another league

pros: Because England is my dream country and I love to work there. I want to learn some more.
cons: Benefits of working. Working, whether paid or unpaid, is good for our health and wellbeing. It contributes to our happiness, helps us to build confidence and self-esteem, and rewards us financially. Because of these benefits, it is important to return to work as soon as possible after an illness or injur

pros:
Great Company that practices P-S-P, People, Service Profit equally.  Global Fortune 500 company with immediate name recognition and a very good reputation.  

Strong leadership that has a clear vision of the future.

A great deal of autonomy and decision making ability.
cons:
From a HR standpoint a great deal of hourly employees to support and very policy driven because of the highly regulatory environment of the operation.  

A little behind the times from an internal technology standpoint.

pros: The Salary, Benifit, environment and performance pay is really attractive. I'd say I could grow old here. I admire how the company value and supports it people. Somehow, you have a lot of room to grow and progress here.
cons: Depending on your job description, but for me I guess work-life balance is definitely a problem send my job needs most of my time to work, and less time to be with my family

pros: The health and dental benefits are good but can be upgraded to great for a little more money. College tuition reimbursement, if your field of study is within approved list.
cons:
My day started around 4 AM and 2:30 AM during peak season. 
When a plane is late and all you have to do is wait, they force you to schedule a break on your time-card.

review: Overall, great company, top leadership terrific.
pros: Brand name recognition, high caliber past sales history of FedEx Express.
cons: Dilution of general business acumen in the sales force ranks.

review: FedEx is an excellent company to work with because it recognises that its employees are key to it's success.
pros:
Fortune 100 Company
The company has exceptional visionary leadership
The company values and rewards it's people
The company has a strong financial position
Multiple operating companies that offer challenging opportunities
The company has multiple ocations across the country
In times of crisis the company takes care of it's people
cons:
Complex business model that takes a new comer awhile to learn
Newbies have to earn the respect of their peers because they are considered outsiders

review: The work content is great and there are opportunities and challenges, but is also very stressful.
pros: Diverse group of people, challenging projects, opportunities within IT to expand knowledge.  Education reimbursment.  Salary ok for area.  Job opportunities.
cons: Unrealistic expectations for working overtime, many nights and weekends on a continuous basis with no end in sight.  Poor performers are still awarded compensation.

review: Good company but career development not good
pros:
Good company culture and working in FedEx just like a big family. There are many nice colleagues.
Employee welfare and benefits are reasonable.
The workload is moderate.
cons:
Too many corporate standards need to follow, the restriction resulted in projects development too slow and inefficient.
The communication is less between colleagues.
No more room to promote as there are many senior and long-service staff in the company.
Cannot learn more from FedEx IT department.

review: Great CEO, Good leadership - too big if you are looking to advance
pros:
Great 'people first' mentality shown by the company during the difficult economic conditions.
Good benefits
Good resources
Fred Smith
cons:
Innovation mentality seems to be lacking
Advancement very tough - no one leaves and it seems that it is hard to crack the management bubble unless you are connected.

pros: One of the better jobs for a commercial airline pilot. Competitive pay and benefits as compared to the passenger carriers. Opportunities for both domestic and international flying.
cons: Much of the flying is at night. This is part of the business. Each pilot develops techniques to deal with circadian rhythm issues and managing fatigue.

pros: very good health benefits - growth is always available if you want it.  you just have to be willing to go after it.
cons: sometimes the hours are limited- and the work is hard (but that's no seceret) - and management can be a pain because some act like drill sgts!

pros: I like meeting people, whilst out and doing my daily deliveries. And work in a team, to get all trucks empty smoothly and safe.
cons:
Once trucks are unloaded . Loading your vans up to 100 drops a day. They leaving yard and making
Sure all your customers get there delivery that day

review: outstanding 14 years, hardwork is required to secure promotion and growth, expectation from employees are high
pros: freedom to do the right thing, less interference from upper management, well run company, great leadership and vision from the management. They are generally employee friendly and promote from within.
cons: long working hours, less work life balance

pros: cultural diversity, opportuntiy for advancement, training resources, team work, excellent benefits, great brand recognition, best in the business, always growing and changing.
cons: large corporate structure sometimes there is disconnect from department to department.  lots of change constantly happening and sometimes lines get crossed.

review: Birds of the same feather flock together...
pros: Good benefits (especially tuition refund, full healthcare coverage, decent wage)
cons: You don't create a culture out of thin air, for a big part you hire it... Because FedEx doesn't fire people the good people eventually leave and the bad ones end up getting promoted. As a result middle management is often clueless, lazy, under-qualified, over-staffed and grossly overpaid. There are no career paths for young ambitious professionals because they are not allowed to progress (mostly out of fear). The focus is put on internal political games that further hurt the advancement of good people... HR is a hot mess. FedEx Express Europe can be a lot more efficient than it is today but again it is unclear if middle management would accept or applaud these advancements... mostly because they would make their own positions redundant if they would do so...

pros: Working at corporate HQ in Memphis was different than any other corporation I have ever worked.  No one worked >40 hours/week.   It was a very relaxed environment, come in between 7-9, take a long lunch if y ou please and leave between 4-6.  Very friendly place and co-workers.
cons:
Working at corporate HQ in Memphis was different than any other corporation I have ever worked.  
-Overstaffed, not enough to keep you busy.
-People stay in position for 20+ years because they are comfortable,  not because they excel at their job. 
-Managers promoted based on diversity, not necessarily merit.

review: Don't work for FedEx as a courier!
pros: Not having your boss around all day.  Checking out all the hot receptionists.  Working outside in the summer time.  Seeing all the women walking around all day downtown!
cons: Last few years treated the couriers like garbage, even though we are the face of company!  There was a lot of favoritism going on the past few years!  Can't advance through the company at all!  Ripped off with benefits.  Lost all bonuses but having to do more work then we did in the past!  Get no bonus for driving around in the snow, told to work faster but try to be safe!

review: Failed to deliver the Purple Promise
pros: Competitive pay for the industry.  Great product/service offerings backed by a well known and respected brand name.  FedEx hires top notch people and I made life-long friendships and connections with co-workers.
cons: FedEx has been off-track for a while and has turned away from the "People First" mentality that it still touts.  Age discrimination is alive and well!  It's hard to swallow that FedEx is in the midst of a  major downsizing e.g., sales office closures, the big BuyOut of 2013 and yet Fred Smith takes a record pay raise and bonus plan as a reward.

review: Excellent place i worked in 12 years back
pros: Very friendly environment and wise management, team work and dynamic workplace and very enthusiastic . IT manger was a real leader and always supporting my new ideas and initiatives
cons: Always loaded with tasks and many times worked for more than 20 continuous hours. That should have rationalized by increasing resource and additional training

pros: great benefits, sound business and company to work for. they treat employees fairly well and have updated computer applications and equipment.
cons: downsizing and making the reduced workforce responsible for more than they can sometimes handle. very fast paced and distracting at times. upper management disengaged from workers and issues.

pros: Best company to work for so far. Currently enjoying my time working there for this big corporation as its one of the best companies to work for.
cons: Currently I have not seen any cons so far in my present time working for my employer.

pros: You get an opportunity to help different business focus on what's important to them. I loved the idea that the AE was empowered to run their territory as if it was their own business. Unfortunately this empowerment was slowly taken away.
cons: In recent years the culture fundamentally changed in a negative way owing to a new direction taken by the leadership team.

pros: Great company with good benefits and pay.  Employees are treated fairly and with respect.  Lots of advancement opportunities depending on where you live or want to live.  Bonuses are decent.
cons: Professional advancement is limited in most cities outside of Memphis which is corporate headquarters.  Pay raises aren't the best but bonuses are pretty good.

pros: FedEx is very safe company. It takes care about employees and give them a lot of apportunities for self-development, additonal education, benefits...

pros:
International company with reasonable benefits. 
Training program includes videos, manuals, tests and buddy training. 
Good people to work with and Saskatoon has a very nice facility.
Saskatoon management team was eager to help you succeed.
cons:
My biggest surprise and perhaps disappointment is that the technology the company uses is so antiquated. For most people, looking up addresses on a map can be tedious and time consuming. When you are new, that is the way it is done.

Try to imagine doing this manual look up for 70-100 packages/envelopes a day and then trying to frame that into a route/run where you are minimizing (or trying to minimize) the amount of time you spend doubling back on yourself. Of course, if you have a regular route, over the weeks and months you will improve in this regard but for someone new it is almost tragic. 

I am sure that eventually they will incorporate more GPS and the morning sorts and truck set-ups will carry a higher degree of automation but for now things are firmly embedded in the early 1990's.

No coffee breaks, very easy to miss lunch breaks when busy.

pros: Benefites,personal growth, company values, Company has a strong thirst for talent and gives them the required opportunity to grow in their professional as well as in their personal life.

pros: FedEx company is a smart and efficient, I am also smart at my job

review: Disappointed. Stuck in a rut. I am willing to take a pay cut to get out
pros:
1. Company has a good reputation
2. Good work areas with large cubicles
3. Competitive salaries and benefits
4. Cost of living is low in Memphis
5. They advocate work life balance but it really depends on your manager
6. Discounts on many things all over the city and elsewhere
cons:
1. Too much upper management. Too many layers of management
2. Not many career paths. They don't move people around very much. You can get stuck in the same department for years and years. 
3. Lower and middle managers are on average not very competent leaders
4. Politics politics politics
5. Very bureaucratic. You have to go through so much red tape to get anything done. There is a convoluted process for everything. 
6. The various operating companies and regions function as different companies sometimes with their own rules and processes
7. Those awful acronyms that don't make any sense
8. Performance reviews that are very subjective and the manager's word is final

pros: teamwork is awesome and salary is good.  big company is hard to get good ideas through but I enjoyed it
cons: It is a big company.  You have to go through a lot of red tape to have management approve of ideas. always expanding

review: Working at FedEx Express EMEA is not pleasant.
pros:
-No lay-offs at FedEx Express EMEA.
-Good medical insurance.
-2,500 euro/year tuition reimbursement
cons:
-Awful location for European headquarters (offices in Brussels airport cargo area with mediocre public transport).
-Managers to remain in the same position for 10, 15, 20+ yrs without receiving training on how to manage people.
-Inexistent/very slow career progression: only possible if you have the same personality as your boss and act as his puppet.
-Favoritism within the team.
-Being honest during annual feedback survey is used against you.
-Company rarely allows moving from one team/department to another: mainly goes for hiring external candidates... so most people remain stuck in the same team for years. 
-Boring atmosphere.

review: Pathetic Culture & Poor Management in India Office
pros: None that i can think of
cons:
Highly Bureaucratic Organization with Directors & VPs in India running units as personal fiefdoms.
Whistle blowers of malpractices are targeted.
No freedom to speak your mind or share honest answers/feedback.
Yes Man Culture. People who constantly nod their heads to VPs & Directors are preferentially treated.
New ideas and innovations are met with fierce resistance and scoffed at.
Widespread Nepotism and Favoritism.
Highly political culture.
Mediocrity is celebrated.

review: politics & processes more important than work
pros:
Renowned company, good to have on your cv
Expanding company
Advantages in the form of courses for long-time employees
cons: There are some very skilled and hard-working people in that company, but there are also many whose only activity during the day is to play politics to get to the top. Processes are an important part of the company, as it should be in any company this size, however, these processes will not be clearly explained to joining employees and because of their sheer number, they even hamper the effective work of seasoned employees.
